EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON JUNE 5, 2018, AT APPROXIMATELY 4:11 PM, UNITS WERE DISPATCHED TO WALMART, LOCATED AT 1919 MAIN, PEARLAND, TEXAS, IN REFERENCE TO A MAN WITH A GUN THAT HAD DISCHARGED A FIREARM SEVERAL TIMES. UPON ARRIVAL, OFFICERS LOCATED A H/M, LATER IDENTIFIED AS ABEL GUZMAN, ON THE SOUTH/CENTER AREA OF THE PARKING LOT. UPON MAKING CONTACT WITH MR. GUZMAN HE WAS OBSERVED WAIVING A HANDGUN AROUND AND HOLDING IT AGAINST THE SIDE OF HIS HEAD. MR. GUZMAN WAS ALSO OBSERVED POINTING THE HANDGUN IN THE DIRECTION OF A MOVING VEHICLE AS IT DROVE BY AN AISLE CLOSE TO HIM BEFORE THE SCENE WAS TOTALLY SECURE. AN OFFICER ATTEMPTED TO SPEAK WITH HIM IN BOTH ENGLISH AND SPANISH, ATTEMPTING HIM TO LOWER THE WEAPON SO THEY COULD PROVIDE ASSISTANCE. AFTER SEVERAL MINUTES, MR. GUZMAN LEVELED THE PISTOL AND TOOK AIM IN THE DIRECTION OF OFFICERS AND HE WAS ENGAGED WITH DEADLY FORCE. MR. GUZMAN WAS HIT SEVERAL TIMES AND WENT TO THE GROUND. EMS TRANSPORTED MR. GUZMAN TO THE HOSPITAL AND HE WAS PRONOUNCED DEAD BY HOSPITAL STAFF.

incident_result_of: OTHER - SPECIFY TYPE OF CALL
EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: OFFICERS RESPONDED TO 7328 S. GLENN STREET AFTER RECEIVING AN EMERGENCY PHONE CALL TO 911, FROM THE COMPLAINANT, REPORTING THAT SOMEONE WAS BREAKING INTO THEIR HOME. THE COMPLAINANT DISCONNECTED FROM THE CALL AFTER A SHORT TIME. A SUBSEQUENT PHONE CALL TO 911, BY A NEW COMPLAINANT, BUT RELATED TO THE SAME INCIDENT, REPORTED THAT THE SUSPECT WAS A KNOWN PERSON AND WAS THE COMPLAINANT'S COUSIN. THE COMPLAINANT ADVISED THE SUSPECT POSSESSED A KNIFE AND WAS CHASING THE COMPLAINANT AND OTHER OCCUPANTS OF THE RESIDENCE DOWN THE STREET. DURING THE CALL, THE COMPLAINANT ADVISED THE SUSPECT HAD PREVIOUSLY ASSAULTED HER AND OTHER PARTIES AT THE LOCATION. THE COMPLAINANT ADVISED THE SUSPECT WAS INTOXICATED AND UPSET OVER SOMETHING THAT OCCURRED IN THE PAST. RESPONDING OFFICERS MET WITH THE TWO 911 COMPLAINANTS AT THE INTERSECTION OF AUTUMN BAY/ASPEN GLEN. WHILE AT THIS LOCATION, TWO OFFICERS ON-SCENE DETERMINED THAT THE REPORTED SUSPECT WAS BACK INSIDE OF THE RESIDENCE LOCATED AT 7328 S. GLENN STREET. THE OFFICERS ALSO DETERMINED THAT ANOTHER RESIDENT OF THE HOME WAS IN THE RESIDENCE AS WELL. THE TWO OFFICERS WENT TO THE RESIDENCE TO CHECK ON THE WELFARE OF THE OCCUPANTS OF HOME DUE TO THE ASSAULTIVE BEHAVIOR THAT WAS REPORTED BY THE COMPLAINANTS. AT THE FRONT DOOR OF THE RESIDENCE, OFFICERS MADE CONTACT WITH A FEMALE RESIDENT AND HAD CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 HER COME OUTSIDE. OFFICERS THEN ENTERED THE RESIDENCE IN ORDER TO LOCATE THE REPORTED SUSPECT, AND TO CHECK ON THE WELFARE OF ANY OTHER OCCUPANTS INSIDE. WHILE CHECKING THE LOWER LEVEL OF THE TWO-STORY RESIDENCE, THE OFFICERS VERBALLY ANNOUNCED THEIR PRESENCE AS THEY LOOKED FOR OTHER OCCUPANTS. IN THE KITCHEN AREA OF THE RESIDENCE, THE TWO OFFICERS ENCOUNTERED A HISPANIC FEMALE ARMED WITH A KNIFE WALKING IN THEIR DIRECTION. ONE OF THE OFFICERS ORDERED THE FEMALE TO DROP THE KNIFE AS HE MOVED IN A BACKWARDS DIRECTION. THE FEMALE DID NOT DROP THE KNIFE AND CONTINUED TO MOVE IN THE DIRECTION OF THE OFFICER. THE OFFICER THEN DISCHARGED HIS HANDGUN MULTIPLE TIMES STRIKING THE FEMALE. THE FEMALE FELL TO THE GROUND. OFFICERS IMMEDIATELY SUMMONED EMS VIA RADIO AND BEGAN ATTEMPTING LIFE SAVING MEASURES. EMERGENCY MEDICAL PROFESSIONALS PRONOUNCED THE FEMALE DECEASED, WHILE ON THE SCENE, AT 3:00AM.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON JUNE 9, 2018 AT 3:38 AM, A 911 CALL REPORTED A MALE THREATING A FEMALES MOTHER WITH A HAND GUN AT THE GLENN APARTMENTS, 2602 SOUTH 39TH STREET, APARTMENT 607 TEMPLE, BELL COUNTY, TEXAS, 76502. OFFICERS ARRIVED TO THE APARTMENT AND SET A PERIMETER TO THE APARTMENT. TWO OFFICERS HEARD A MALE THREATING TO KILL UNKNOWN PERSON(S). THE FRONT DOOR TO THE APARTMENT WAS SLIGHTLY OPEN AND OFFICERS OPENED THE DOOR AND ANNOUNCED THEIR PRESENCE. OWEN CONFRONTED THE OFFICERS AND OFFICERS GAVE COMMANDS TO DROP THE HANDGUN IN HIS HANDS. OWEN FIRED HIS WEAPON AND SLAMMED THE FRONT DOOR. ONE OFFICER DISCHARGED HIS WEAPON THROUGH THE DOOR AT OWEN, WHO WAS HOLDING THE DOOR SHUT AS THEY TRIED TO MAKE ENTRY. THREE MORE SHOTS WERE HEARD FROM INSIDE THE APARTMENT THE DOOR WAS KICKED IN BY ONE OFFICER AND THE OTHER RETURNED FIRE TOWARDS OWEN. OWEN ATTEMPTED TO EXIT THE APARTMENT THROUGH THE PATIO DOOR AND WAS CONFRONTED BY THE OTHER OFFICER, DISCHARGED HIS WEAPON STRIKING OWEN SEVERAL TIMES. OWEN WAS FOUND TO BE WEARING A MASK AND WAS WEARING CLOTH WORK GLOVES. HE WAS ALSO IN POSSESSION OF A KNIFE. THE INVESTIGATION FOUND THAT OWEN HAD MADE ENTRY INTO THE APARTMENT AND HELD THREE ADULTS AT GUN POINT OWEN FORCED THE TWO FEMALE VICTIM'S TO PERFORM SEXUAL ACTS ON EACH OTHER. THE MALE VICTIM WAS THREATENED ADDITIONALLY BY OWEN WITH THE HANDGUN. ALL THREE VICTIMS WERE THREATENED WITH DEATH WHILE BEING HELD AT GUN CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 POINT THIS INVESTIGATION IS BEING LEAD BY THE TEXAS RANGERS AND SPECIFICALLY, RANGER JUSTIN DUCK, TEMPLE.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON 06-25-18 AT ABOUT 1546 HOURS, OFFICERS WERE DISPATCHED TO TOWNE CENTRE MART, 2604 TOWNE CENTRE DR. MESQUITE, TX 75150, IN REFERENCE TO SUSPICIOUS ACTIVITY. THE CALLER REPORTED AN ADULT MALE SUSPECT HAD INAPPROPRIATELY TOUCHED A 12 YEAR OLD GIRL INSIDE THE STORE. THE CALLER DESCRIBED THE SUSPECT AS A HISPANIC MALE WITH SHORT HAIR, WEARING A BLACK SHIRT, BLACK PANTS, AND RED SOCKS. THE CALLER STATED THE SUSPECT WAS GETTING INTO A RED CAR AND LEAVING TOWARDS POTEET DR. OFFICERS ARRIVED IN THE AREA AND OBSERVED A CAR MATCHING THE DESCRIPTION AND A CHASE ENSUED. THE VEHICLE PURSUIT ENDED WITH THE SUSPECT CRASHING HIS CAR AND FLEEING ON FOOT. OFFICERS CHASED THE SUSPECT INTO A BUSINESS PARK AREA AND LOST SIGHT OF HIM FOR A SHORT TIME. AN OFFICER LOCATED THE SUSPECT HIDING IN SOME DEBRIS NEAR A BUILDING AND ORDERED HIM TO SURRENDER. THE SUSPECT CHARGED AT THE OFFICER AND BEGAN ASSAULTING HIM. THE SUSPECT ATTEMPTED TO TAKE THE OFFICER'S SIDEARM AND A STRUGGLE ENSUED OVER POSSESSION OF THE WEAPON. AFTER STRIKING THE OFFICER REPEATEDLY IN THE FACE, THE SUSPECT WAS ABLE TO GAIN CONTROL OF THE WEAPON AND POINT IT AT THE OFFICER. OTHER OFFICERS ON THE SCENE WERE CONVERGING ON THE STRUGGLE AND ARRIVED JUST AS THE SUSPECT POINTED THE WEAPON AT THE OFFICER. FOUR OFFICERS (TWO MESQUITE PD AND TWO GARLAND PD) FIRED SIMULTANEOUSLY AT THE SUSPECT STRIKING HIM NUMEROUS TIMES.

incident_result_of: TRAFFIC STOP
cdr_narrative: OFFICER INITIATED TRAFFIC STOP. SUSPECT FLED IN VEHICLE, THEN FLED ON FOOT CARRYING A WEAPON IN HIS RIGHT HAND. DURING THE BRIEF FOOT CHASE, THE OFFICER FIRED HIS WEAPON AT THE SUSPECT. SUSPECT LATER DIED OF HIS WOUNDS. THE GALVESTON SHERIFF'S OFFICE IS CONDUCTING THE INVESTIGATION. NOTE: THERE HAVE BEEN SEVERAL COMMAND STAFF CHANGES AT THE GALVESTON POLICE DEPARTMENT. CHIEF VERNON L. HALE III IS OUR CURRENT POLICE CHIEF. I AM UNABLE TO CHANGE THE AGENCY INFORMATION ON THIS FORM AT THIS TIME.

EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON JULY 10, 2018 AT APPROXIMATELY 1:28 P.M. GARLAND POLICE OFFICERS WERE DISPATCHED TO THE AREA OF E. INTERSTATE HWY 30 AND BASS PRO DR. IN REFERENCE TO A WHITE MALE ARMED WITH TWO MACHETES. THE MALE, LATER IDENTIFIED AS SHAUN LEO GATES WHITE/MALE, DATE OF BIRTH 3-27-1978 WAS REPORTEDLY CHASING AND SWINGING THE MACHETES AT PASSING MOTOR VEHICLES, SOME OF WHICH HE STRUCK. MR. GATES ALSO MADE ATTEMPTS TO ENTER AT LEAST TWO OCCUPIED BUSINESSES WITH THE WEAPONS WHICH WERE SECURED TO HIS WRIST WITH PARA CORD. NUMEROUS 911 CALLS WERE MADE FROM PASSING MOTORIST/VICTIMS AS WELL AS FROM THE BUSINESSES HE ATTEMPTED TO ENTER. ADDITIONAL CITIZENS HAD FLAGGED DOWN NEARBY DALLAS COUNTY DEPUTY SHERIFFS TO REPORT THE OFFENSES. GARLAND POLICE ARRIVED AT THE LOCATION AND OBSERVED GATES ARMED WITH THE MACHETES WHEREAS HE WAS CONFRONTED. GATES IGNORED OFFICERS VERBAL COMMANDS TO DROP THE WEAPONS AND INSTEAD BEGAN HOLLERING AND AGGRESSIVELY CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 CAME TOWARD A GARLAND POLICE OFFICER. THE OFFICER FEARING FOR HIS SAFETY AS WELL AS THE SAFETY OF THE IMMEDIATE PUBLIC, FIRED HIS DUTY WEAPON STRIKING AND KILLING MR. GATES . THE MACHETES HAD APPROXIMATE BLADE LENGTHS OF 12 TO 14 INCHES EACH, ONE WITH A "TANTO" STYLE TIP, AND BOTH WITH DOUBLE EDGES.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: OFFICERS WERE DISPATCHED TO THE INCIDENT LOCATION IN REFERENCE TO AN IN-PROGRESS TRESPASSING / AGGRAVATED ASSAULT CALL. UPON ARRIVAL TWO PATROL DEPUTIES ARRIVED ON SCENE WITH A PATROL SERGEANT TO FIND THE DECEDENT INSIDE OF A RESIDENCE AT THAT LOCATION WITHOUT THE CONSENT OF THE OWNER. THE OFFICERS MADE CONTACT WITH THE DECEDENT, WHO WAS ON A SECOND FLOOR LOFT, AND ORDERED HER DOWN. THE DECEDENT DISPLAYED A FOLDING KNIFE, AND PUT IT IN HER LEFT FRONT PANT POCKET WITH THE BLADE EXPOSED. SHE THEN RETRIEVED A LARGE FIXED BLADED KNIFE FROM THE LOFT AND SET IT NEAR BY. THE SERGEANT PARTIALLY ASCENDED THE LADDER TO THE LOFT AND ORDERED THE DECEDENT TO DROP THE KNIFE SEVERAL TIMES. DESPITE MULTIPLE COMMANDS, THE DECEDENT REFUSED TO PUT THE KNIFE DOWN AND OC SPRAY WAS DEPLOYED. WHEN THE OC SPRAY DID NOT GAIN HER COMPLIANCE, THE DEPUTIES DEPLOYED TASERS THREE TIMES AND SHE WAS ABLE TO REMOVE THE PRONGS. THE DECEDENT THEN MADE AN AGGRESSIVE MOVEMENT WITH THE KNIFE TOWARD THE SERGEANT WHO WAS ON THE LADDER AND WITHIN THE REACH OF THE DECEDENT'S WEAPON. THE DEPUTIES ON THE LOWER LEVEL FIRED SIX ROUNDS AT HER, STRIKING HER SIX TIMES. EMS WAS CALLED TO THE SCENE AND PERFORMED LIFE-SAVING MEASURES BUT WERE UNABLE TO PREVENT HER DEATH.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON JULY 13, 2018 AT APPROXIMATELY 3:45AM THE SUBJECT WAS A SUSPECT IN AN AGGRAVATED ROBBERY OF A PICKUP TRUCK AT THE TARGET LOCATED AT 6464 E. NORTHWEST HWY. AT APPROXIMATELY 4:45AM THE STOLEN VEHICLE DRIVEN BY THE SUBJECT WAS INVOLVED IN MULTIPLE ACCIDENTS AT 3411 INDIANOLA STREET. A WITNESS, WHO OBSERVED THE ACCIDENTS, ATTEMPTED TO PREVENT THE SUBJECT FROM DRIVING AWAY FROM THE SCENE. THE WITNESS JUMPED INSIDE THE CAB OF THE TRUCK AND A STRUGGLE ENSUED. DURING THE STRUGGLE THE SUBJECT PRODUCED A HANDGUN AND FIRED A ROUND AT THE WITNESS AND MISSED. THE WITNESS RETREATED AND THE SUBJECT CONTINUED TO DRIVE FROM THE LOCATION. PATROL OFFICERS LOCATED THE TRUCK AND A VEHICLE PURSUIT ENSUED. THE SUBJECT WRECKED THE TRUCK AT THE END OF A CUL-DE-SAC AT THE 9300 HAVENCOVE DRIVE. THE SUBJECT EXITED THE VEHICLE AND THEN RE-ENTERED THE VEHICLE WHILE APPEARING TO LOOK FOR AN OBJECT.OFFICERS CONTINUED TO GIVE THE SUBJECT CLEAR LOUD VERBAL COMMANDS TO SHOW THEM HIS HANDS AND EXIT THE VEHICLE. THE SUBJECT STOOD ON THE DRIVER SIDE DOOR JAM OF THE VEHICLE AND DISPLAYED A HANDGUN. OFFICERS CONTINUED TO GIVE VERBAL COMMANDS WHICH THE SUBJECT INTENTIONALLY DID NOT OBEY. THE SUBJECT MADE A FURTIVE GESTURE WITH THE HANDGUN AND OFFICERS DISCHARGED THEIR WEAPONS. CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 THE SUBJECT EXPIRED FROM HIS INJURIES AT THE SCENE. THE COMPLAINANTS' PROPERTY FROM THE AGGRAVATED ROBBERY WAS FOUND ON THE SUBJECTS' PERSON. A HANDGUN WAS RECOVERED AT THE SCENE NEXT TO THE SUBJECT.

EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON JULY 15, 2018, AT APPROXIMATELY 4:00 P.M., THE ALVIN POLICE DEPARTMENT RECEIVED A 9-1-1 CALL REGARDING A DISTURBANCE AT A RESIDENCE IN THE 500 BLOCK OF N. FIFTH STREET. THE CALLER REPORTED THE ACTOR, ISAAC O. CHAPA III, WAS SUICIDAL AND HAD FIRED A SHOT INSIDE THE HOME. OFFICERS RESPONDED AND DISCOVERED THAT CHAPA HAD FLED THE SCENE ON A MOTORCYCLE WITH THE FIREARM. WITHIN MINUTES, THE OFFICERS LOCATED THE CHAPA’S MOTORCYCLE AT 2102 W. LANG STREET, ALVIN MISSIONARY BAPTIST CHURCH. AS OFFICER BEGAN SEARCHING THE PROPERTY FOR CHAPA HE EMERGED FROM AN ADJACENT WOODED AREA WITH THE FIREARM. AS OFFICERS MOVED CLOSER THEY GAVE REPEATED INSTRUCTIONS FOR CHAPA TO PUT THE WEAPON ON THE GROUND. CHAPA FINALLY THREW THE WEAPON ON THE GROUND BEHIND HIM. THE OFFICERS BEGAN TO MOVE CLOSER AND GAVE REPEATED INSTRUCTIONS FOR HIM TO GET ON THE GROUND. AT THE SAME TIME CHAPA BEGAN TO SHOUT TO THE OFFICERS “SHOOT ME”. CHAPA THEN BEGAN MOVING TOWARDS THE GUN. OFFICERS BEGAN SHOUTING COMMANDS FOR HIM TO STAY AWAY FROM THE WEAPON AND DON’T DO IT. CHAPA THEN SUDDENLY KNELT AND RETRIEVED THE GUN AND BROUGHT IT BACK UP AS THE OFFICERS MOVED IN ON HIM. ONE OFFICER DISCHARGED HIS PISTOL AT CHAPA AND HE FELL TO THE GROUND. THE OFFICERS IMMEDIATELY BEGAN ADMINISTERING AID TO CHAPA UNTIL THE ARRIVAL OF EMS AT WHICH TIME HE WAS TRANSPORTED TO CLEAR LAKE REGIONAL HOSPITAL. ISAAC O CHAPA III WAS PRONOUNCED DEAD AT THE HOSPITAL.

EXECUTION OF A WARRANT
cdr_narrative: DURING THE ANNOUNCED EXECUTION OF A WARRANT OBTAINED BY A MULTI-AGENCY TASK FORCE ON CRIMES AGAINST CHILDREN, THE DECEASED APPEARED IN FRONT OF A SWAT ENTRY TEAM WITH A FIREARM. THE DECEASED RAISED THE LONG-BARRELED WEAPON AT THE SWAT "POINT PERSON" AND DID NOT DROP IT WHEN ORDERED. HE WAS FATALLY INJURED IN THE PROTECTION OF SELF AND OTHERS (ANOTHER SWAT TEAM MEMBER).

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: HARRIS COUNTY SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT CALLED FOR AN ASSIST THE OFFICER DUE TO SHOTS BEING FIRED AT SHERIFF'S DEPUTIES FOLLOWING AN ARMED ROBBERY. CFISD POLICE OFFICERS RESPONDED. CFISD OFFICERS AND HCSO DEPUTIES CAME IN CONTACT WITH ONE HISPANIC MALE SUSPECT WHO WAS FIRING (AND RE-LOADING) UPON LAW ENFORCEMENT PERSONNEL WITH WHAT WAS LATER DETERMINED TO BE A .22 CALIBER PISTOL. RESPONDING LAW ENFORCEMENT PERSONNEL RETURNED FIRE STRIKING SUSPECT IN THE HEAD AND CAUSING THE DEATH OF THE SUSPECT. THE OFFICER WHO STRUCK THE SUSPECT WORKS FOR CFISD POLICE DEPARTMENT. THE INCIDENT TRANSPIRED IN HARRIS COUNTY AND THE HARRIS COUNTY SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT HOMICIDE DIVISION AND THE HARRIS COUNTY DISTRICT ATTORNEY'S OFFICE ARE INVESTIGATING THE INCIDENT.

incident_result_of: OTHER - SPECIFY TYPE OF CALL
EXECUTION OF A WARRANT
cdr_narrative: ON WEDNESDAY JULY 25, 2018 AT 2011 HOURS, APD SWAT OFFICERS HAD BEEN CONDUCTING SURVEILLANCE AT A HIGH CRIME LOCATION, 3930 E. IH-40, FOR A FUGITIVE WANTED FOR AGGRAVATED ASSAULT DEADLY WEAPON. THE SUSPECT WAS KNOWN TO BE ARMED AND HAD BEEN INVOLVED IN SEVERAL RECENT SHOOTINGS IN THE CITY OF AMARILLO. THE FUGITIVE WAS SPOTTED AT THE LOCATION, MOVING BETWEEN SEVERAL UPPER FLOOR ROOMS. HE WAS OBSERVED WITH SEVERAL ASSOCIATES WHO WERE CONDUCTING “COUNTER-SURVEILLANCE” ON BEHALF OF THE FUGITIVE. A HIGH RISK ARREST PLAN WAS FORMED. WHEN THE FUGITIVE MOVED TO A GROUND FLOOR ROOM WITH LIMITED AVENUES OF ESCAPE, THE ARREST TEAMS MOVED INTO POSITION. THE FUGITIVE EMERGED FROM THE GROUND FLOOR ROOM. HE WAS NOT WEARING A SHIRT AND HIS HANDS WERE IN VIEW. NO WEAPONS WERE OBSERVED ON HIS PERSON SO THE ARREST TEAM MOVED UP TO TAKE HIM INTO CUSTODY. THE FUGITIVE, SEEING APPROACHING OFFICERS, TOOK COVER BEHIND A WOMAN WHO WAS HOLDING A ONE YEAR OLD CHILD. THE FUGITIVE PRODUCED A HIDDEN HANDGUN AND WAS BRINGING THE WEAPON UP INTO A FIRING POSITION IN A DRAWING MOTION. ONE OFFICER FIRED TWO ROUNDS WHICH STRUCK THE SUSPECT; STOPPING HIS WEAPON PRESENTATION. THE SUSPECT WAS PRONOUNCED DEAD OF HIS INJURIES AT THE SCENE.

OTHER - SPECIFY TYPE OF CALL
EXECUTION OF A WARRANT
cdr_narrative: OFFICERS LEARNED JONATHAN JOEY MENDOZA WAS WANTED ON SEVERAL FELONY WARRANTS. THEY INCLUDED A PAROLE VIOLATION WARRANT, ORIGINAL CHARGE AGGRAVATED ASSAULT WARRANT NUMBER 06189230; POTTER COUNTY WARRANT 75988-Z FOR ASSAULT HOUSEHOLD MEMBER IMPEDING BREATH OR CIRCULATION; POTTER COUNTY WARRANT 75987-Z. FOR AGGRAVATED ASSAULT WITH A DEADLY WEAPON; POTTER COUNTY WARRANT # CCCR-17-1846-2 FOR TERRORISTIC THREAT. DEAF SMITH SO DEPUTIES LOCATED A VEHICLE MR. MENDOZA WAS KNOWN TO DRIVE AT 212 6TH AVE. SURVEILLANCE WAS BEGUN AT THAT LOCATION. CONTACT WITH OTHER FAMILY MEMBERS CONFIRMED MR. MENDOZA WAS AT THE LOCATION. EFFORTS WERE MADE TO ARREST MR. MENDOZA AWAY FROM THE HOUSE. THOSE EFFORTS WERE UNSUCCESSFUL. A SURROUND AND CALL OUT WAS PLANNED. AS OFFICERS SET UP THE PERIMETER, THE SUSPECT EXITED THE BACK AND WAS CHALLENGED BY OFFICERS. MR. MENDOZA THEN RAN TOWARD THE FRONT. HE WAS DISPLAYING A WEAPON. OFFICERS IN FRONT CHALLENGED MR. MENDOZA; HOWEVER, HE WOULD NOT SUBMIT TO ARREST. AN OFFICER FEARING THAT HE WAS ABOUT TO FIRE ON OTHER OFFICERS ON SCENE FIRED HIS RIFLE AT MR. MENDOZA STRIKING HIM. THE SUSPECT CONTINUED TO CLIMB A PIPE AND WIRE FENCE AND FELL TO HIS BACK ON THE OPPOSITE SIDE. THE FALL DISLODGED THE GUN FROM HIS HAND. MR. MENDOZA LOOKED AROUND AND FOUND THE GUN AND PICKED IT UP. OFFICERS OBSERVED THE GUN NOW POINTED IN THEIR DIRECTION. TWO DIFFERENT OFFICERS NOW IN THE LINE OF FIRE ENGAGED MR. MENDOZA AND FIRED ROUNDS FROM THEIR RIFLES. HE WAS STRUCK AGAIN, AND THEN STOPPED RESISTING. MEDICAL CARE WAS ATTEMPTED BUT OFFICERS AND MEDICS COULD NOT SAVE HIS LIFE.

incident_result_of: EXECUTION OF A WARRANT
cdr_narrative: ON AUGUST 16, 2018, AT APPROXIMATELY 0015 HOURS, THE MIDLAND POLICE DEPARTMENT BEGAN INVESTIGATING THE MURDER OF A 36 YEAR OLD WOMAN. A SUSPECT WAS QUICKLY DEVELOPED AND IDENTIFIED AS OSCAR OMAR GURROLA (H/M DOB: 10/23/76). AT APPROXIMATELY 0800 HOURS, THE DETECTIVE WORKING THE CASE OBTAINED AN ARREST WARRANT FOR MR. GURROLA AND BEGAN SEARCHING FOR HIM. LATER THAT MORNING, DETECTIVES FOUND OUT THAT MR. GURROLA WAS CURRENTLY WORKING ON A RANCH LOCATED AT 9500 SOUTH COUNTY ROAD 1030, STANTON, MIDLAND COUNTY, TEXAS. DETECTIVES OBTAINED DIRECTIONS TO THE RANCH AND PERMISSION TO ENTER THE PROPERTY FROM THE LANDOWNER. SINCE THE SUSPECT HAD A WARRANT FOR MURDER AND WAS SUSPECTED TO BE ARMED, THE MIDLAND POLICE DEPARTMENT SWAT TEAM WAS DEPLOYED TO APPREHEND HIM. THE TEAM ARRIVED TO THE PROPERTY AT APPROXIMATELY 1057 HOURS AND NOTICED MR. GURROLA OPERATING A BACKHOE IN AN OPEN FIELD. THE TEAM WAS COMPRISED OF TWO FOUR-MAN ELEMENTS RIDING IN TWO SEPARATE VEHICLES. THEY APPROACHED MR. GURROLA AND PARKED APPROXIMATELY 30 YARDS AWAY FROM THE BACKHOE, AND EVEN WITH EACH OTHER, WITH APPROXIMATELY 10 YARDS IN BETWEEN THEIR VEHICLES. AS THE TEAM EXITED THEIR VEHICLES, MR. GURROLA EXITED THE BACKHOE. HE LOOKED AT THE OFFICERS WHO IDENTIFIED THEMSELVES AND GAVE HIM VERBAL COMMANDS TO GET ON THE GROUND. MR. GURROLA THEN REACHED BACK INTO THE BACKHOE AND PULLED OUT A HANDGUN. AT THAT POINT, FIVE OF THE TEAM MEMBERS FIRED THE AR-15 RIFLES THEY WERE CARRYING, STRIKING MR. GURROLA, CAUSING HIM TO FALL TO THE GROUND. AT THAT POINT, THE TEAM APPROACHED MR. GURROLA, SECURED THE HANDGUN HE PULL OUT, HANDCUFFED HIM, AND BEGAN MEDICAL TREATMENT. EMS WAS CALLED AND PRONOUNCED HIM DECEASED UPON ARRIVAL.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON AUGUST 17, 2018, AT APPROXIMATELY 5:20 A.M., AN ARMED ENCOUNTER CALL WAS DISPATCHED AROUND THE 4000 BLOCK OF N. JIM MILLER ROAD. DEPLOYMENT OFFICER T. ALLISON #9442 OBSERVED A SUBJECT (FLORES) ON FOOT JUST SOUTH OF MILITARY PARKWAY ON N. JIM MILLER ROAD MATCHING THE DESCRIPTION FROM THE CALL. WHEN OFFICER T. ALLISON ENCOUNTERED FLORES, FLORES DISCHARGED A HANDGUN TWICE (2) STRIKING OFFICER T. ALLISON IN THE LEFT THIGH. OFFICER T. ALLISON RETURNED FIRE, DISCHARGING HIS WEAPON TWICE (2), AND STRIKING FLORES ON THE UPPER LEFT CHEST. OFFICER T. ALLISON WAS TRANSPORTED TO BAYLOR HOSPITAL BY RESPONDING DPD ELEMENTS ARRIVING AT THE SCENE. FLORES EXPIRED AT THE SCENE FROM HIS INJURIES. A HANDGUN WAS RECOVERED NEXT TO FLORES AT THE SCENE. THE SECOND SUBJECT (ESQUIVEL) WAS FOUND A SHORT DISTANCE AWAY FROM THE SHOOTING AND IN POSSESSION OF A HANDGUN. ESQUIVEL WAS TRANSPORTED TO HEADQUARTERS, INTERVIEWED BY SIU AND CHARGED WITH UCW.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON 8/17/2018, AT APPROXIMATELY 1:00AM, SEVERAL OFFICERS RESPONDED TO GUNSHOTS BEING FIRED IN THE VICINITY OF THE NORTH ALLEY, IN THE 300 BLK OF E. 6TH STREET. DOWNTOWN PATROL OFFICERS BEGAN TO CONVERGE ON THE ALLEY FROM THE EAST AND THE WEST. OFFICERS THEN BEGAN TO GIVE CHASE TO A B/M SUSPECT WHO MAY HAVE BEEN INVOLVED IN THE GUNFIRE, RUNNING EASTBOUND THROUGH THE NORTH ALLEY FROM SAN JACINTO BLVD. SEVERAL OTHER OFFICERS WERE STAGED EAST OF THE FLEEING SUBJECT, NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF THE NORTH ALLEY AND TRINITY ST. THE FLEEING B/M SUSPECT EMERGED FROM THE ALLEY AND ONTO TRINITY STREET, IN FRONT OF THE OFFICERS AWAITING THERE. THE SUSPECT WAS ARMED WITH A FIREARM IN ONE OF HIS HANDS. AS HE CROSSED IN FRONT OF THE OFFICERS, THE SUSPECT'S HAND, HOLDING THE WEAPON, MOVED IN A DIRECTION TOWARDS THE OFFICERS, AND MULTIPLE OFFICERS FIRED UPON THE SUSPECT, STRIKING HIM. THE SUSPECT FELL TO THE GROUND. HE WAS TAKEN INTO CUSTODY AND EMS WAS SUMMONED TO THE SCENE. UPON EMS ARRIVAL, THE SUSPECT WAS TRANSPORTED TO THE HOSPITAL. HE WAS PRONOUNCED DECEASED AT 1:22AM.

incident_result_of: HOSTAGE/BARRICADE/OTHER EMERGENCY SITUATION
cdr_narrative: OFFICERS RESPONDED TO THE REPORT OF AN ACTIVE SHOOTER WITH INJURIES. ARRIVING OFFICERS ENCOUNTERED THE SUSPECT IN THE PARKING LOT OF THE BUSINESS POSSIBLY IN AN ATTEMPT TO FLEE THE SCENE. THE SUSPECT WAS STILL ARMED WITH A HANDGUN WHEN ENCOUNTERED. ONE OFFICER DID FIRE TWO ROUNDS AT THE SUSPECT. IT WAS AT THIS TIME THE SUSPECT TURNED HER WEAPON ON HERSELF FIRING ONE ROUND TO THE HEAD. THE SUSPECT WAS TRANSPORTED BY AIR AMBULANCE TO THE MEDICAL CENTER.

incident_call_other: PEACE OFFICER ON-VIEWED A MALE ON PROPERTY, WHO WAS PREVIOUSLY ISSUED A CRIMINAL TRESPASS WARNING TO NOT RETURN
cdr_narrative: ON AUGUST 26, 2018, TWO DEPUTIES WERE WORKING AN APPROVED EXTRA-JOB, WHICH INCLUDED A CLUB PARKING LOT, IN FULL UNIFORM. THE DEPUTIES OBSERVED A TRUCK PARKED IN THE PARKING LOT WITH TWO PEOPLE INSIDE. A DEPUTY RECOGNIZED THE PASSENGER IN THE TRUCK AS BEING A PERSON WHO HAD PREVIOUSLY BEEN GIVEN A CRIMINAL TRESPASS WARNING TO NOT RETURN TO THE PROPERTY. THE TWO DEPUTIES APPROACHED THE TRUCK AND ORDERED THE TWO MALES TO RAISE THEIR HANDS. THE DEPUTY ON THE PASSENGER SIDE OBSERVED A HANDGUN ON THE SEAT NEXT TO THE PASSENGER'S LEG. DEPUTIES REMOVED THEIR WEAPONS AND ORDERED BOTH MALES TO KEEP THEIR HANDS UP. THE PASSENGER BEGAN TO LOWER HIS HANDS, AND THE DEPUTY ORDERED HIM TO KEEP HIS HANDS VISIBLE. THE PASSENGER DID NOT COMPLY WITH THE VERBAL COMMANDS AND PLACED HIS HAND ON THE HANDGUN. THE DEPUTY FEARED THE PASSENGER WAS ABOUT TO USE DEADLY FORCE AGAINST HIM AND HE DISCHARGED HIS WEAPON ONE TIME, STRIKING THE PASSENGER IN THE CHEST. EMS PARAMEDICS ARRIVED ON SCENE AND FOUND NO SIGNS OF LIFE ON THE PASSENGER.

incident_result_of: OTHER - SPECIFY TYPE OF CALL
incident_call_other: UNDERCOVER FELONY STOP ON AGGRAVATED ROBBERY SUSPECT
cdr_narrative: ON 08/29/2018, HARRIS COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE DEPUTIES AND TEXAS DPS SPECIAL AGENTS LOCATED AND FOLLOWED A VEHICLE TAKEN IN A CAR-JACKING/AGGRAVATED ROBBERY. AFTER HOURS OF SURVEILLANCE, OFFICERS MADE THE DECISION TO STOP THE VEHICLE AND INITIATED A CONTAINMENT PROCEDURE AFTER THE SUSPECT VEHICLE EXITED THE FREEWAY. THREE SPECIAL AGENTS BLOCKED THE SUSPECT VEHICLE IN THE FRONT, BACK, AND DRIVER'S SIDE. OFFICERS EXITED THEIR UNMARKED VEHICLES WEARING TACTICAL VESTS DISPLAYING IDENTIFYING LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCY PATCHES. OFFICERS ANNOUNCED, "POLICE, DON'T MOVE." THE SPECIAL AGENT PARKED BEHIND THE SUSPECT VEHICLE WAS STANDING NEXT TO HIS OPENED DRIVER'S SIDE DOOR. THE SUSPECT VEHICLE REVERSED AND PUSHED THE SPECIAL AGENT VEHICLE BACK AS THE AGENT HAD RE-ENTERED HIS VEHICLE. THE DRIVER TURNED THE WHEELS TO THE RIGHT AND STRUCK THE BACK OF THE AGENT'S VEHICLE IN FRONT OF HIM AS HE ATTEMPTED TO FLEE. OFFICERS DISCHARGED THEIR WEAPONS TOWARDS THE SUSPECT VEHICLE. THE SUSPECT VEHICLE CONTINUED TO TRAVEL A SHORT DISTANCE AND STOPPED AS IT DROVE UP ON THE CURB. A FEMALE PASSENGER EXITED THE SUSPECT VEHICLE AND WALKED TOWARDS THE OFFICERS. OFFICERS APPROACHED THE SUSPECT VEHICLE, REMOVED THE DRIVER, AND DETERMINED HE HAD BEEN STRUCK BY GUNFIRE. OFFICERS INITIATED LIFE-SAVING MEASURES AND REQUESTED EMS. EMS PERSONNEL ARRIVED ON SCENE AND FOUND NO SIGNS OF LIFE ON THE DRIVER.
lea_narrative_published: TEXAS DPS CDR

incident_result_of: OTHER
incident_call_other: CALL FOR A DISTURBANCE / YELLING / ITEMS BEING THROWN IN APARTMENT #320
cdr_narrative: ON AUGUST 31ST 2018 AT 1127HRS SAPD OFFICER RODRIGUEZ ARRIVED AT 5910 ROYAL GATE APARTMENT NUMBER 320 FOR A DISTURBANCE. THE CALLERS TOLD POLICE DISPATCH THEY COULD HEAR SOMEONE YELLING AND POSSIBLY THROWING THINGS IN APARTMENT 320. OFFICER RODRIGUEZ ARRIVED ON SCENE AND KNOCKED ON THE DOOR OF APARTMENT 320. OFFICER RODRIGUEZ HEARD A MALE VOICE SOUNDING THREATENING. OFFICER RODRIGUEZ BACKED AWAY FROM THE DOOR AND PETE SANCHEZ LATER EXITED. PETE SANCHEZ WAS ARMED WITH A METAL PIPE IN ONE HAND AND A LARGE KITCHEN KNIFE IN THE OTHER. OFFICER RODRIGUEZ ORDERED PETE TO DROP THE WEAPON AND PETE ACKNOWLEDGED OFFICER RODRIGUEZ PRESENCE, THEN ADVANCED. OFFICER RODRIGUEZ PULLED HIS DUTY ISSUE FIREARM AND FIRED THREE TIMES IN THE DIRECTION OF PETE SANCHEZ. PETE SANCHEZ WAS SHOT TWICE AND WALKED BACK INTO HIS APARTMENT. OFFICER CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 RODRIGUEZ MAINTAINED A SAFE DISTANCE FROM PETE SANCHEZ UNTIL THE ASSISTANCE FROM OTHER OFFICERS ARRIVED. OFFICER RODRIGUEZ ADMINISTERED FIRST AID (TOURNIQUET TO LEFT THIGH) AND PETE SANCHEZ WAS THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE HOSPITAL BY EMS. ON 09/01/2018 PETE SANCHEZ WAS PRONOUNCED DECEASED AT 1548HRS BY HOSPITAL STAFF.

incident_result_of: OTHER - SPECIFY TYPE OF CALL
TRAFFIC STOP
cdr_narrative: SUSPECT WAS STOPPED FOR A TRAFFIC VIOLATION. THE OFFICERS DETECTED AN ORDER OF MARIJUANA IN THE VEHICLE. THE DRIVER ADMITTED TO HAVING RECENTLY SMOKED MARIJUANA AND ATTEMPTED TO LOCATE THE MARIJUANA CIGARETTE IN THE CENTER CONSOLE OF HIS VEHICLE. THE DRIVER AND OCCUPANT OF THE VEHICLE WERE DETAINED IN ORDER TO FURTHER SEARCH THE VEHICLE FOR THE PRESENCE OF MARIJUANA. AS STANDARD COMPUTERIZED CHECKS WERE BEING PERFORMED ON THE DRIVER AND THE OCCUPANT, THE DRIVER RESISTED DETENTION BY STARTING THE VEHICLE AND PROCEEDING TO DRIVE OFF WITHOUT WARNING. A SECOND OFFICER GAVE COMMANDS FOR THE SUSPECT TO STOP HIS EFFORT TO FLEE. THE SUSPECT DISREGARDED THE OFFICER'S COMMANDS AND ACCELERATED THE VEHICLE WHILE THE OFFICER STOOD ON THE RUNNING BOARD AND HELD ON TO THE PASSENGER WINDOW. THE OFFICER FIRED HIS ISSUED FIREARM AT THE SUSPECT. THE SUSPECT WAS SHOT FOUR TIMES BEFORE THE OFFICER FELL FROM THE VEHICLE, SUFFERING INJURY, AND THE VEHICLE CONTINUED ON.

cdr_narrative: AFTER THREATENING MULTIPLE OFFICERS AT GUNPOINT, THE SUBJECT WAS SHOT MULTIPLE TIMES. THE SUBJECT WAS RESTRAINED AND MEDICAL CARE WAS PROVIDED ONCE THE SUBJECT WAS CLEARED OF ANY WEAPONS. MEDICAL CARE WAS GIVEN TO THE SUSPECT MOMENTS AFTER THE SHOOTING. THE SUSPECT WAS TRANSPORTED TO A MEDICAL FACILITY WHERE HE LATER DIED. THIS INCIDENT IS STILL UNDER INVESTIGATION BY THE TEXAS RANGERS AND TPWD INTERNAL AFFAIRS DIVISION.

incident_call_other: OFFICER WAS OFF DUTY AND RETURNING HOME. THE OFFICER ENTERED THE WRONG APARTMENT AND MISTOOK THE DECEDENT AS AN INTRUDER IN HER APARTMENT.
cdr_narrative: ON 9/6/2018 AT APPROXIMATELY 10:00PM OFFICER GUYGER, AMBER #10702 WAS RETURNING HOME FROM A TOUR OF DUTY TO THE SOUTH SIDE FLATS APARTMENTS LOCATED AT 1210 SOUTH LAMAR STREET. OFFICER GUYGER ENTERED APARTMENT 1478 WHICH WAS OCCUPIED BY SUBJECT JEAN, BOTHAM. OFFICER GUYGER DISCHARGED HER DUTY WEAPON TWICE (2) STRIKING COMPLAINANT JEAN, BOTHAM ONCE (1) IN THE CHEST. RESPONDING OFFICERS PROVIDED FIRST AID TO JEAN, B. AND DFR 4 RESPONDED TO THE LOCATION. JEAN, B. WAS TRANSPORTED TO BAYLOR HOSPITAL WHERE HE EXPIRED FROM HIS INJURIES. incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE; TRAFFIC STOP
cdr_narrative: ON FRIDAY, SEPTEMBER 07, 2018 AT APPROXIMATELY 0729 HOURS, WCSO COMMUNICATIONS ADVISED THROUGH RADIO TRANSMISSION THAT A VEHICLE PURSUIT WAS NORTH BOUND ON STATE HIGHWAY 18 ENTERING WARD COUNTY FROM PECOS COUNTY. THE VEHICLE PURSUIT HAD BEGUN IN BREWSTER COUNTY AND HAD COVERED OVER 100 MILES ON RAIN SLICK HIGHWAYS AT SPEEDS IN EXCESS OF 100 MILES PER HOUR. RADIO TRAFFIC ADVISED THE VEHICLE BEING PURSUED HAD CAUSE A TRAFFIC COLLISION INVOLVING A PECOS COUNTY DEPUTY AND THAT THE OCCUPANTS OF THE VEHICLE WERE DISCARDING FIREARMS FROM THE VEHICLE. OFFICERS TRAVELED SOUTH ON STATE HIGHWAY 18 AND TO PARKED THEIR PATROL UNITS IN SUCH A MANNER AS TO ENCOURAGE THE FLEEING VEHICLE TO TRAVEL EAST ON FM 1233 AVOIDING THE CONGESTED TRAFFIC IN THE CITY OF MONAHANS. I CONTINUED SOUTH BOUND ON STATE HIGHWAY 18 UNTIL I HEARD RADIO TRANSMISSION THAT THE VEHICLE WAS STILL NORTH BOUND AND WAS AT WINDMILL HILL ON STATE HIGHWAY 18. I ALSO OVERHEARD RADIO TRAFFIC ADVISING THAT A PREVIOUS ATTEMPT TO STOP THE FLEEING VEHICLE WITH A TIRE DEFLATION DEVICE PROVED UNSUCCESSFUL. IT WAS NOT UNTIL LATER I LEARNED OF A SECOND SUCCESSFUL DEPLOYMENT OF A TIRE DEFLATION DEVICE ON THE VEHICLE, HOWEVER IT WAS REPORTED THE VEHICLE WAS STILL NORTH BOUND ON SH 18 TRAVELING TOWARDS THE CITY OF MONAHANS AT A HIGH RATE OF SPEED. I APPROACHED THE INTERSECTION OF STATE HIGHWAY 18 AND FM 1233 AND MET WITH MY OFFICERS. I NOTICED THAT THREE (3) MONAHANS POLICE DEPARTMENT MARKED PATROL UNITS HAD THEIR RED AND BLUE EMERGENCY LIGHTS ACTIVATED AND WERE DIVERTING TRAFFIC EAST BOUND ONTO FM 1233. I SAW THE VEHICLE APPROACHING OUR LOCATION STILL BEING PURSUED BY A WCSO PATROL UNIT TRAVELING BEHIND WITH THEIR OVERHEAD RED AND BLUE EMERGENCY LIGHTS ON. I SAW THE VEHICLE ENTER THE MEDIAN BETWEEN NORTH AND SOUTH BOUND TRAFFIC AND ENTER THE ROADWAY, TRAVELING ON THE WRONG SIDE OF THE ROAD. DUE TO THE AMOUNT OF TRAFFIC ON THE ROADWAY AT THE TIME AND HEAVILY CONGESTED TRAFFIC IN THE CITY OF MONAHANS AND ROAD AND WEATHER CONDITIONS I TOLD MY OFFICERS TO ATTEMPT TO STOP THE VEHICLE BY DISCHARGING THEIR FIREARMS AT THE TIRES OF THE VEHICLE. THE VEHICLE APPROACHED MONAHANS POLICE OFFICERS AND SHOWED NO ATTEMPT TO STOP OR SHOW ANY REGARD FOR THE SAFETY OF THE MOTORING PUBLIC. OFFICERS DISCHARGED THEIR FIREARMS AT THE VEHICLE IN AN ATTEMPT TO DISABLE IT. THE VEHICLE CONTINUED NORTH BOUND IN THE SOUTH BOUND TRAFFIC LANES UNTIL IT MADE A COMPLETE STOP IN A PASTURE WEST OF THE ROADWAY. OFFICERS APPROACHED THE VEHICLE AND SECURED THE SCENE. I NOTICED A TOTAL OF SIX (6) INDIVIDUALS THAT WERE OCCUPANTS OF THE VEHICLE. OFFICERS PLACED HANDCUFFS ON FIVE (5) OF THE INDIVIDUALS AND ONE (1) OF THE OCCUPANTS APPEARED TO BE DECEASED

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE; TRAFFIC STOP
EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE; HOSTAGE/BARRICADE/OTHER EMERG SITUATION
cdr_narrative: ON SATURDAY, SEPTEMBER 8, 2016 AT APPROXIMATELY 8:45 A.M., OFFICER C. H. RAMOS AND OFFICER M. PEEL, BOTH ASSIGNED TO THE HOUSTON POLICE DEPARTMENT'S PATROL REGION 2 COMMAND, CLEAR LAKE DIVISION, WERE DISPATCHED TO 16505 TIFFANY COURT #7, REGARDING A "SUSPICIOUS PERSON WITH A WEAPON." UPON ARRIVAL AT THE SCENE, OFFICERS RAMOS AND PEEL MADE CONTACT WITH A RESIDENT OF THE COMPLEX, WHO ADVISED THERE WERE MULTIPLE GUNSHOTS COMING FROM APARTMENT #7. AS OFFICERS APPROACHED THE APARTMENT, THEY HEARD A MALE YELLING IRATELY FROM AN OPEN UPSTAIRS WINDOW. THE OFFICER ASKED THE SUSPECT TO COME OUTSIDE AND TALK TO THEM, BUT HE REFUSED. A SHORT TIME AFTER MAKING VERBAL CONTACT WITH THE SUSPECT, THE OFFICERS WERE FORCED TO TAKE COVER, AS THEY HEARD GUNSHOTS ERUPT FROM INSIDE THE SUSPECT'S APARTMENT. AS A RESULT, OFFICERS REQUESTED ADDITIONAL UNITS AND SWAT, SINCE THE SUSPECT WAS BARRICADED INSIDE THE APARTMENT. WHILE WAITING FOR THEIR SUPPORT, OFFICERS CONTINUED TO HEAR GUNSHOTS COMING FORM WITHIN THE SUSPECT'S APARTMENT. OFFICE K. DREY ASSIGNED TO THE HOMELAND SECURITY DEMAND, TACTICAL OPERATIONS DIVISION, WAS THE FIRST SWAT, OFFICER TO ARRIVE ON THE SCENE, AND WAS QUICKLY BRIEFED BY OFFICERS RAMOS AND PEEL. AS OFFICER DREY WAS SUITING UP WITH HIS TACTICAL GEAR, HE HEARD A GUNSHOT FROM INSIDE APARTMENT.#7. CONSEQUENTLY, OFFICER DREY STRATEGICALLY MADE HIS WAYS TOWARDS THE UNIT AND ASSUMED A TACTICAL POSITION BEHIND SOME PARKED VEHICLES UNDER A CARPORT, SO HE COULD SEE THE BACK DOOR OF APARTMENT #7. DURING HIS POSITIONING, OFFICER DREY HEARD MULTIPLE GUNSHOTS COMING FROM INSIDE APARTMENT #7. ONCE OFFICER DREY WAS IN POSITION HE HEARD THE SUSPECT REMOTELY START HIS CADILLAC ESCALADE, WHICH WAS PARKED DIRECTLY OUTSIDE HIS BACK DOOR GROUND LEVEL. OFFICER DREY FEARED THE SUSPECT PLANNED TO EXIT HIS APARTMENT AND GET INTO HIS VEHICLE, CREATING A GREATER DANGER TO OTHER CITIZENS AND OFFICERS, SO HE CAUTIOUSLY CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 MADE HIS WAY TOWARDS THE SUSPECT'S VEHICLE AND PUNCTURED BOTH OF THE DRIVER SIDE TIRES WITH HIS KNIFE. OFFCIER DREY THEN MOVED BACK TO HIS ORIGINAL LOCATION. WHILE REPOSITIONING WITH HIS LARUE OBR. 308 DUTY RIFLE, THE SUSPECT WALKED OUT OF THE BACK DOOR, HOLDING A SHOTGUN AND A PISTOL. THE SUSPECT THEN POINTED THE SHOTGUN AND FIRED IN THE DIRECTION OF OFFICERS DREY, RAMOS , AND PEEL, SO OFFICER DREY RETURNED A SINGLE GUNSHOT AT THE SUSPECT, STRIKING HIM IN THE HEAD, IMMEDIATELY INCAPACITATING HIM. DOWN ON THE GROUND BUT STILL CLENCHING BOTH WEAPONS, RESPONDING SWAT OFFICERS PULLED THE SUSPECT FROM THE BACK PATIO AREA AND INTO THE PARKING LOT TO ADMINISTER FIRST AID. HFD RESPONDED TO THE SCENE AND TRANSPORTED THE SUSPECT, IDENTIFIED AS RONALD SINGLETARY, TO CLEAR LAKE REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER. MR. SINGLETARY WAS PRONOUNCED DEAD SHORTLY AFTER ARRIVAL.

incident_result_of: TRAFFIC STOP
EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: OFFICERS RESPONDED TO AN UNKNOWN MAJOR/MINOR ACCIDENT AT AN APARTMENT COMPLEX. OFFICERS WERE UNABLE TO LOCATE THE DRIVER OR VICTIMS OF THE ACCIDENTS. OFFICERS BEGAN A SEARCH OF THE APARTMENT COMPLEX TO LOCATE ANY VICTIMS OF THE ACCIDENT,. DURING THE SEARCH THE OFFICERS WERE MADE AWARE OF A POSSIBLE DISTURBANCE AND PROCEEDED TO THAT AREA. UPON APPROACH THEY WERE CONFRONTED BY A BLACK FEMALE WHO WAS BRANDISHING A SMALL HANDGUN AND A LARGE KNIFE. OFFICERS GAVE VERBAL COMMANDS TO STOP AND DROP THE WEAPONS. THE SUSPECT REFUSED COMMANDS AND ADVANCED ON THE OFFICERS. THE OFFICERS GAVE FURTHER COMMANDS TO DROP THE WEAPONS AND THE SUSPECT REFUSED. ONE OFFICER DEPLOYED HIS TASER WHICH WAS INEFFECTIVE AND THE SECOND OFFICER DISCHARGED HIS DUTY WEAPON STRIKING THE SUSPECT MULTIPLE TIMES RESULTING IN THE DEATH OF THE SUSPECT.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
EXECUTION OF A WARRANT
TRAFFIC STOP; EXECUTION OF A WARRANT
cdr_narrative: ON SEPTEMBER 11, 2018 WHITE SETTLEMENT CITY MARSHAL'S OFFICE CONDUCTED A TRAFFIC STOP ON THE DECEDENT'S VEHICLE FOR FAILURE TO COME TO A COMPLETE STOP AT A MARKED STOP SIGN AND POSSIBLE TRAFFIC WARRANTS OUT OF MULTIPLE AGENCIES. UPON MAKING CONTACT WITH THE DRIVER, DECEDENT, HE EXITED THE VEHICLE ACTING NERVOUS AND STRANGELY. HE KEPT SAYING HE WAS SORRY. HE WAS CHECKED FOR THE OUTSTANDING WARRANTS. THE WARRANTS WERE CONFIRMED. THE MARSHAL WENT BACK TO HIS VEHICLE AND AS HE DID THE DRIVER, DECEDENT, GOT BACK INTO HIS VEHICLE AND PRODUCED A HANDGUN AND HELD IT TO HIS CHIN, STARTED THE VEHICLE AND DROVE OFF. THE MARSHAL BEGAN A PURSUIT OF THE DRIVER, DECEDENT, AND REQUESTED ASSISTANCE FROM WHITE SETTLEMENT POLICE DEPARTMENT. THE PURSUIT WENT THROUGH THE CITY OF WHITE SETTLEMENT AND INTO PARTS OF THE CITY OF FORT WORTH COMING FINALLY BACK INTO THE CITY OF WHITE SETTLEMENT. THE PURSUIT LASTED APPROXIMATELY 15 MINUTES. THE PURSUIT ENDED WHEN THE DRIVER PULLED UP TO AND STOPPED AT 691 MEADOW PARK DRIVE, WHITE SETTLEMENT, TEXAS. THE DRIVER EXITED THE VEHICLE. THE DRIVER, DECEDENT, STILL HAD THE HANDGUN POINTED TO HIS CHIN AND BEGAN RUNNING TOWARDS THE FRONT DOOR THE RESIDENCE. ONE OFFICER FIRED AT THE DRIVER, DECEDENT, STRIKING HIM IN THE ABDOMEN. THE DRIVER, DECEDENT, THEN DISCHARGED THE HANDGUN HE WAS HOLDING TO HIS CHIN AND NECK AREA WITH THE BULLET EXITING THE TOP OF HIS HEAD. OFFICERS BEGAN ADMINISTERING FIRST AID TO THE DRIVER, DECEDENT. THE DRIVER, DECEDENT, WAS LOADED INTO AN AMBULANCE AND TRANSPORTED TO A LOCAL HOSPITAL WHERE HE WAS PRONOUNCED DECEASED.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
TRAFFIC STOP; OTHER
cdr_narrative: ON FRIDAY SEPTEMBER 14, 2018 AT APPROXIMATELY 23:26 HRS., LAREDO POLICE COMMUNICATIONS CENTER RECEIVED A CALL FROM A FEMALE WHO REPORTED THAT HER RECENT EX-BOYFRIEND, IDENTIFIED AS ANTONIO AGUIRRE, DOB 11/1/65, HAD PLACED A GUN TO HER HEAD AND PHYSICALLY ASSAULTED HER. THE FEMALE VICTIM REPORTED THAT DURING THE TIME AGUIRRE ASSAULTED HER WITH A HANDGUN HE ALSO INTERFERED WITH HER ATTEMPT TO CALL 911. SHE ALSO STATED THAT AGUIRRE WAS OPERATING HIS WHITE FORD PICKUP WORK TRUCK AND LEFT HER RESIDENCE TRAVELING NORTHBOUND ON DAVIS AVE. IN ADDITION, SHE HEARD GUNSHOTS AS HE DROVE AWAY. DURING THE TIME OFFICERS WERE TAKING A REPORT OF THE DOMESTIC VIOLENCE INCIDENT. FEMALE VICTIM ALERTED THE OFFICERS THAT THE MR. AGUIRRE VEHICLE WAS DRIVING PAST HER HOUSE. OFFICER AT SCENE OBSERVED THE SUSPECT VEHICLE TRAVELING EAST ON SANCHEZ STREET TOWARDS JUAREZ AVE. OFFICERS RESPONDED TO ASSIST AND WERE NOTIFIED THAT THE SUSPECT WAS ARMED. OFFICERS ATTEMPTED TO CONDUCT A FELONY STOP, BUT THE SUSPECT FLED AND THE OFFICERS INITIATED A VEHICLE PURSUIT. THE VEHICLE PURSUIT ENDED AT HIS RESIDENCE AT 417 E. FREMONT ST. OFFICERS SURROUNDED THE RESIDENCE. OFFICER GAVE MULTIPLE COMMANDS TO DROP THE WEAPON. AGUIRRE DISREGARDED OFFICER'S COMMANDS AND MADE A SUDDEN AND THREATENING MOVE THAT CAUSED OFFICERS TO OPEN FIRE STRIKING AGUIRRE NUMEROUS TIMES AND SUBSEQUENTLY KILLING HIM.

incident_result_of: EXECUTION OF A WARRANT
cdr_narrative: ON SEPTEMBER 19, 2018 AT APPROXIMATELY 10:30 A.M., LEAGUE CITY POLICE OFFICERS ATTEMPTED TO SERVE A WARRANT AT 323 WACO AVE. LOCATED IN LEAGUE CITY, TEXAS. THE OFFICERS KNOCKED ON THE FRONT DOOR AND WERE MET BY THE FEMALE RESIDENT WHO ADVISED THE OFFICER THAT THE SUSPECT WAS IN THE BACK BEDROOM, AND SHE GAVE THE OFFICERS PERMISSION TO SEARCH THE HOME FOR THE SUSPECT. UPON SEARCHING THE RESIDENCE, THE SUSPECT WAS LOCATED HIDING IN A CLOSET BEHIND CLOTHING WHILE HOLDING A BOX CUTTER. THE OFFICERS DIRECTED THE SUSPECT TO DROP THE BOX CUTTER, BUT HE DID NOT COMPLY AND LUNGED AT THE OFFICERS. THE OFFICER FIRED HIS DUTY WEAPON TO STOP THE ATTACK. THE SUSPECT WAS PRONOUNCED DECEASED AT THE SCENE.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON FRIDAY, SEPTEMBER 28, 2018, AT APPROXIMATELY 12:26 A.M., OFFICERS FROM THE PATROL REGION 3 COMMAND, MIDWEST DIVISION, WERE DISPATCHED TO THE BRIARWOOD APARTMENTS, LOCATED AT 2525 WINROCK BOULEVARD, REGARDING A POSSIBLE HOSTAGE SITUATION,. UPON OFFICERS' ARRIVAL, THEY WERE MET BY D'ERYCA WALLS, WHO ADVISED HER COUSIN, KENDRA JONES, WAS BEING HELD AT GUNPOINT IN ONE OF THE APARTMENTS BY HER EX-BOYFRIEND, WILLIE EARL SIMMONS. MS. WALLS WAS UNAWARE WHICH APARTMENT MR. SIMMONS LIVED IN, BUT SHE KNEW HE DROVE A BLACK DODGE CHALLENGER. THEREFORE, OFFICERS SEARCHED THE APARTMENT'S PARKING LOT AND QUICKLY LOCATED A VEHICLE MATCHING THE DESCRIPTION, WHICH WAS REGISTERED TO WILLIE SIMMONS. ALTHOUGH THE VEHICLE'S REGISTRATION RETURNED A DIFFERENT ADDRESS, OFFICERS IDENTIFIED MR. SIMMONS' APARTMENT AS CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 NUMBER 137, BASED ON THE VEHICLE PARKING LOCATION AND FROM SCREAMS HEARD FROM WITHIN THE APARTMENT. CONSEQUENTLY, OFFICERS TACTICALLY POSITIONED THEMSELVES AT THE FRONT AND REAR OF APARTMENT. ONCE IN POSITION, SERGEANT J. M. SEYMORE INSTRUCTED OFFICER N. A. NGUYEN TO KNOCK ON THE FRONT DOOR. WHEN OFFICER NGUYEN ANNOUNCED HIMSELF, THEY IMMEDIATELY HEARD MS. JONES START SCREAMING FOR HELP, AND THEN HEARD GUNSHOTS COMING FROM INSIDE THE APARTMENT, CAUSING THEM TO TAKE COVERED POSITIONS AT THE FRONT AND REAR OF WILLIE SIMMONS' APARTMENT. SERGEANT SEYMOUR THEN INSTRUCTED OFFICER NGUYEN TO FORCE ENTRY WAS MADE THOUGH THE FRONT DOOR, MR. SIMMONS FIRED MULTIPLE GUNSHOTS AT OFFICER NGUYEN AND OTHER OFFICERS POSITIONED IN THE FRONT. THE OFFICERS AGAIN TOOK COVER. WHILE ATTEMPTING TO ESTABLISH VERBAL COMMUNICATION WITH MR. SIMMONS, OFFICER NGUYEN OBSERVED HIM SHOOT MS. JONES. MR. SIMMONS THEN ATTEMPTED TO FLEE OUT OF THE APARTMENT'S BACK DOOR WITH HIS PISTOL IN HAND, BUT HE ENCOUNTERED OFFICER M. A. HARRIS AND SERGEANT SEYMOUR, WHO WERE POSITIONED IN THE BACK, BEHIND COVER. OFFICER HARRIS YELLED VERBAL COMMANDS TO MR. SIMMONS TO DROP HIS PISTOL, BUT HE DID NOT COMPLY, SO OFFICER HARRIS, FEARING FOR THIS SAFETY, DISCHARGED HIS DUTY WEAPON APPROXIMATELY 5 TIMES. MR. SIMMONS THEN RETREATED BACK INSIDE THE ONE BEDROOM APARTMENT, AFTER DROPPING HIS PISTOL ON THE BACK PATIO. ADDITIONAL OFFICERS BEGAN ARRIVING ON THE SCENE TO SECURE THE PERIMETER. ONCE MULTIPLE OFFICERS ARRIVED ON SCENE AND IN POSITION, SERGEANT SEYMOUR COMMANDED ENTRY THROUGH THE BACK DOOR IN AN EFFORT TO SAVE THE LIFE OF MS. JONES, WHO WAS STILL SCREAMING FOR HELP. SERGEANT SEYMOUR, OFFICER J. J. FEW, OFFICER C. SANTANA AND OFFICER HARRIS MADE ENTRY THROUGH THE BACK SLIDING DOOR AND IMMEDIATELY OBSERVED MR. SIMMONS HUDDLED OVER MS. JONES IN THE BEDROOM. THUS, SERGEANT SEYMOUR BEGAN GIVING HIM VERBAL COMMANDS TO SHOW HIS HANDS, BUT HE REFUSED TO COMPLY WITH THOSE SIMPLY COMMANDS. INSTEAD OF COMPLYING WITH VERBAL ORDERS, MR. SIMMONS QUICKLY GOT UP FROM THE FLOOR AND MOVED INTO THE BATHROOM, OUT OF OFFICERS' VIEW. A SHORT TIME LATER, MR. SIMMONS EMERGED FROM THE BATHROOM WITH A LARGE KNIFE IN HAND AND ADVANCED IN AN AGGRESSIVE MANNER TOWARDS SERGEANT SEYMOUR, OFFICER FEW, AND OFFICER SANTANA. SERGEANT SEYMOUR AND OFFICER FEW USED DEADLY FORCE, DISCHARGING THEIR DUTY WEAPONS AT WILLIE SIMMONS, WHILE OFFICER SANTANA DISCHARGED HIS CONDUCTED ENERGY DEVICE (CED). MRS. JONES WAS THEN SAFETY REMOVED FROM INSIDE THE APARTMENT, WHEREIN MEDICAL AID WAS PROVIDED TO HER WALKING AWAITING PARAMEDICS. MOREOVER, FIRST AID WAS ALSO ADMINISTERED BY OFFICERS TO MR. SIMMONS. UPON PARAMEDICS' ARRIVAL, THEY CONTINUED MEDICAL EFFORTS, MR. SIMMONS WAS PRONOUNCED DECEASED AT THE SCENE AT 1:22 A.M. WHILE MS. JONES WAS TRANSPORTED TO SOUTHWEST MEMORIAL HOSPITAL FOR MULTIPLE, NON-LIFE THREATENING GUNSHOT WOUNDS. THERE WAS NO INJURIES TO ANY OF THE RESPONDING PATROL OFFICERS OR ANY OTHER CITIZENS, AS A RESULT OF THE SUSPECT SHOOTING AT THEM. BODY WORN CAMERAS (BWC) WORN BY RESPONDING OFFICERS CAPTURED THE ENTIRE EVENT, AND ALL FOOTAGE ALIGNED WITH ALL OFFICERS' ACCOUNTS. THE PRELIMINARY INVESTIGATION REVEALED MR. JONES ABDUCTED MS. JONES AT GUNPOINT, APPROXIMATELY ONE HOUR PRIOR, FROM THE AREA OF 5100 CARMEN, AS SHE WALKED WITH HER NEW BOYFRIEND. MS. JONES WAS QUICKLY STABILIZED AT THE HOSPITAL, AFTER SUSTAINING SIX GUNSHOT WOUNDS.

incident_result_of: EXECUTION OF A WARRANT
cdr_narrative: ON OCTOBER 1, 2018, MEMBERS OF THE GULF COAST VIOLENT OFFENDERS TASK FORCE (COMPRISED OF MULTIPLE AGENCIES) OBTAINED INFORMATION ON THE LOCATION OF A PERSON WANTED ON FOUR OUTSTANDING FELONY WARRANTS. OFFICERS ARRIVED AT THE LOCATION AND SECURED A PERIMETER. A PERSON EXITED THE RESIDENCE AND AFFIRMED THE WANTED PERSON WAS INSIDE. AS OFFICERS APPROACHED THE FRONT DOOR, THE SUSPECT ATTEMPTED TO EXIT THROUGH A BACK DOOR OF THE RESIDENCE. TWO OFFICERS CONFRONTED THE SUSPECT, WHO WAS HOLDING A HANDGUN. THE SUSPECT REFUSED COMMANDS TO DROP THE HANDGUN AND OFFICERS DISCHARGED THEIR WEAPONS, STRIKING THE SUSPECT. EMS PARAMEDICS ARRIVED AND DETERMINED THE SUSPECT HAD NO SIGNS OF LIFE.

cdr_narrative: OFFICERS I. MARTINEZ #1706 AND J. HERRERA #1571 WORKING AS UNIT 1F175 RESPONDED TO THE ADDRESS OF 10780 PEBBLE HILLS (PEBBLE HILLS REGIONAL COMMAND CENTER) REFERENCE A SUICIDAL SUBJECT PARKED IN THE PARKING LOT INSIDE HIS VEHICLE WITH A WEAPON. UPON ARRIVAL THE OFFICERS OBSERVED SEVERAL OTHER OFFICERS APPROACHING THE OF-01 AT GUN POINT. THE OF-01 POINTED HIS WEAPON AT OFFICERS AND FIRED HIS WEAPON, AND AT WHICH TIME THE OFFICERS DEFENDED THEMSELVES BY SHOOTING AT THE OF-01. OF-01 EXPIRED AT THE SCENE. CASE WAS TURNED OVER TO TEXAS RANGERS AND CRIMES AGAINST PERSONS DETECTIVES FOR FURTHER INVESTIGATION. CROSS REFERENCE CASE #18-283108...

cdr_narrative: OFFICERS WERE INVESTIGATING A REPORT OF AN ASSAULT AT A KNOWN DRUG HOUSE LOCATED AT 217 ROBERTS. OFFICERS SECURED THE HOUSE AND OFFICER CASANOVA KNOCKED ON THE FRONT DOOR. THE DOOR UNEXPECTEDLY OPENED WHEN THE OFFICER KNOCKED AT WHICH TIME A BLACK MALE JUMPED UP AND YELLED, "WHO THE FUCK ARE YOU?" TO THE OFFICER. THE BLACK MALE IGNORED THE OFFICERS COMMANDS TO SHOW HIS HANDS AS THE BLACK MALE MOVED AWAY GRABBING AT A GUN AT HIS WAISTBAND. THE OFFICER FIRED TWICE; ONE OF THE BULLETS TRAVELLED THROUGH THE BLACK MALE'S BUTTOCKS AND STRUCK THE VICTIM.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE; HOSTAGE/BARRICADE/OTHER EMERG SITUATION
incident_call_other: UNIFORMED PATROL OFFICERS WERE DISPATCHED TO 1907 LAMAR AVENUE IN REFERENCE TO A STABBING. UPON ARRIVAL, OFFICERS FOUND A FEMALE VICTIM OUTSIDE THE MOTEL WITH CHEST WOUNDS. OFFICERS LEARNED THE SUSPECT IN THE STABBING WAS THE HUSBAND OF THE VICTIM, AND HE WAS INSIDE THE MOTEL ROOM WITH THE VICTIM?S CHILDREN. OFFICERS ESTABLISHED A PERIMETER NEAR THE FRONT DOOR OF THE MOTEL ROOM ENTRANCE TO BEGIN VERBAL NEGOTIATION WITH THE SUSPECT. THE SUSPECT EXTENDED HIS ARM OUT A WINDOW OF THE MOTEL ROOM HOLDING A BLACK HANDGUN AND POINTED IT AT THE OFFICERS, WHICH RESULTED IN THE OFFICERS TO RETREAT TO COVER BEHIND PARKED VEHICLES. AFTER OFFICERS OBTAINED COVER THE SUSPECTED EXITED AND RE-ENTERED THE MOTEL ROOM HOLDING A GUN WHILE TAUNTING OFFICERS TO SHOOT HIM. THE ARMED SUSPECT ULTIMATELY EXITED THE MOTEL ROOM AND WALKED HURRIEDLY IN THE DIRECTION OF OFFICERS POINTING THE GUN AT THEM, WHICH RESULTED IN OFFICERS TO DISCHARGE THEIR WEAPONS STRIKING THE SUSPECT ONCE.
cdr_narrative: UNIFORMED PATROL OFFICERS WERE DISPATCHED TO 1907 LAMAR AVENUE IN REFERENCE TO A STABBING. UPON ARRIVAL, OFFICERS FOUND A FEMALE VICTIM OUTSIDE THE MOTEL WITH CHEST WOUNDS. OFFICERS LEARNED THE SUSPECT IN THE STABBING WAS THE HUSBAND OF THE VICTIM, AND HE WAS INSIDE THE MOTEL ROOM WITH THE VICTIM’S CHILDREN. OFFICERS ESTABLISHED A PERIMETER NEAR THE FRONT DOOR OF THE MOTEL ROOM ENTRANCE TO BEGIN VERBAL NEGOTIATION WITH THE SUSPECT. THE SUSPECT EXTENDED HIS ARM OUT A WINDOW OF THE MOTEL ROOM HOLDING A BLACK HANDGUN AND POINTED CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 IT AT THE OFFICERS, WHICH RESULTED IN THE OFFICERS TO RETREAT TO COVER BEHIND PARKED VEHICLES. AFTER OFFICERS OBTAINED COVER THE SUSPECTED EXITED AND RE-ENTERED THE MOTEL ROOM HOLDING A GUN WHILE TAUNTING OFFICERS TO SHOOT HIM. incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: FAYETTE COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE RECEIVED A CALL FROM BRAZORIA COUNTY THAT MICHAEL WATT WAS MAKING HOMICIDAL AND SUICIDAL THREATS. HE WAS THREATENING TO KILL A FEMALE, HER KIDS, AND HER MOTHER IN BRAZORIA COUNTY. HE HAD AN ACTIVE FELONY WARRANT AND WAS ARMED WITH A HANDGUN. HIS PHONE WAS PINGED IN FAYETTE COUNTY. THE VEHICLE HE WAS DRIVING WAS LATER SPOTTED AT SONIC IN LA GRANGE, UPON LEAVING, LA GRANGE PD ATTEMPTED A TRAFFIC STOP; HOWEVER WATT REFUSED TO STOP AND A PURSUIT ENSUED. WATT THREW ITEMS OUT OF HIS VEHICLE AND BRAKE CHECKED AT THE PURSUING UNITS. SPIKES WERE DEPLOYED AND SUCCESSFUL DURING THE SECOND ATTEMPT. WATT'S VEHICLE CAME TO REST IN A DRIVEWAY TO A RESIDENCE IN BASTROP COUNTY. A STAND-OFF ENSUED WITH WATT THREATENING HARM TO HIMSELF. UPON TRAVIS COUNTY SWAT TEAM COMING TO ASSIST, WATT TOOK OFF IN THE DRIVEWAY, STRAIGHT TO A RESIDENCE THAT WAS UNKNOWN IF IT WAS OCCUPIED AT THE TIME. THERE WAS A VEHICLE AND CHILD'S TOYS PRESENT. IT WAS BELIEVED THAT WATT MAY ENTER THE HOME. WATT WAS ASKED TO STOP AND REFUSED VERBAL COMMANDS. SHOTS WERE FIRED BY LAW ENFORCEMENT AND WATT THEN SELF INFLICTED A GUNSHOT WOUND UNDER HIS CHIN. WATT WAS APPROACHED AND TAKEN INTO HANDCUFFS. THE SCENE WAS SECURED FOR EMS TO COME ATTEND TO WATT WHO SUCCUMBED TO HIS INJURIES.

incident_result_of: TRAFFIC STOP
cdr_narrative: ON OCTOBER 31, 2018, A HARRIS COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE DEPUTY ATTEMPTED TO CONDUCT A TRAFFIC STOP ON A VEHICLE BEING OPERATED BY THE DECEDENT IN REFERENCE TO A TRAFFIC VIOLATION. THE DECEDENT FAILED TO STOP AND A PURSUIT ENSUED. APPROXIMATELY SEVEN MINUTES INTO THE PURSUIT, THE DECEDENT CRASHED HIS VEHICLE INTO A DITCH ON THE SIDE OF A PUBLIC ROADWAY. DEPUTIES APPROACHED THE DECEDENT AT GUNPOINT, ORDERED HIM TO SHOW HIS HANDS, AND HE REFUSED TO COMPLY. THE DECEDENT POINTED AND FIRED A 1911 REPLICA CARBON DIOXIDE CANISTER-POWERED CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 BB/PELLET AIRGUN TOWARDS DEPUTIES. DEPUTIES DISCHARGED THEIR FIREARMS AND STRUCK THE DECEDENT. EMS PERSONNEL ARRIVED AND FOUND THE DECEDENT TO HAVE NO SIGNS OF LIFE.

incident_result_of: EXECUTION OF A WARRANT
EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE; OTHER
EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: OFFICERS HEARD OVER THE RADIO THAT THE SUSPECT HAD JUST PULLED OUT A GUN ON A PERSON. THE OFFICERS, PATROLLING ON BICYCLES DOWNTOWN, PROCEEDED TO PEDAL IN THAT DIRECTION. WHILE IN ROUTE, THEY CAME IN CONTACT WITH THE PERSON WHO CALLED THE POLICE. HE POINTED IN THE DIRECTION OF WHERE THE SUSPECT WITH A GUN WAS, GIVING A CLOTHING DESCRIPTION. OFFICERS PEDALED TO THE SUSPECT MATCHING THE DESCRIPTION GIVEN BY THE PERSON WHO CALLED POLICE. THE SUSPECT WAS STANDING AT A BUS STOP. AS THE TWO OFFICERS CONTACTED THE SUSPECT, HE TOOK A BLADED STANCE. THE SUSPECT HAD HIS RIGHT HAND WRAPPED IN A SHIRT. ONE OF THE OFFICERS PULLED OUT HIS TASER GIVING THE SUSPECT VERBAL COMMANDS. THE SUSPECT DID NOT COMPLY WITH THE VERBAL COMMANDS AND RAISED THE RIGHT HAND TOWARDS THE OTHER OFFICER. THE OFFICER WITH THE TASER FIRED AT THE SUSPECT. THE SUSPECT RAN INTO THE STREET. WHILE IN THE STREET, THE SUSPECT GRABBED THE ITEM CONCEALED IN THE SHIRT AND PULLED BACK ON THE ITEM. THE SUSPECT THEN RAISED HIS RIGHT HAND, STILL WRAPPED IN THE SHIRT, POINTED IT AT THE OTHER OFFICER AND FIRED ONE SHOT. OFFICERS RETURNED FIRE, FATALLY WOUNDING THE SUSPECT.

incident_call_other: POLICE RESPONDED TO A 911 CALL ABOUT THE SUSPECT DISTURBING AT THE RESIDENCE. SUSPECT HAD BEEN ARRESTED THE DAY BEFORE FOR ASSAULT FAMILY VIOLENCE AND HAD AN ACTIVE EMERGENCY PROTECTION ORDER. SUSPECT CONFRONTED POLICE ARMED WITH AN AX AND LUNGED AT POLICE WHO TRIED TO NEGOTIATE WITH THE SUSPECT

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 14, 2018 AT APPROXIMATELY 5:25 P.M., HOUSTON POLICE OFFICER ASHLEY KELLEY WAS DISPATCHED TO A "TRAFFIC HAZARD" LOCATED AT THE 7100 BLOCK OF BEECHNUT. PRIOR TO ARRIVAL, MR. BANDA WAS REPORTEDLY IN THE STREET AND STRIKING PASSING CARS WITH A FLAG POLE. UPON ARRIVAL, OFFICER KELLEY EXITED HER VEHICLE AND APPROACHED THE MR. BANDA LAYING DOWN IN THE MEDIAN. OFFICER KELLEY EXITED HER VEHICLE AND APPROACHED THE MR. BANDA ON FOOT. AT THIS POINT MR. BANDA BEGAN ATTACKING THE OFFICER AND KNOCKED HER DOWN TO THE GROUND. MR. BANDA AS ABLE TO MOUNT THE OFFICER AND WRAPPED HIS ARM AROUND THE OFFICER'S NECK AND BEGAN CHOKING HER. OFFICER KELLEY WAS ABLE TO RAIN HER STANCE AND OBSERVED MR. BANDA WITH NEGATIVE RESULTS. MR. BANDA CONTINUED TO CHARGE AT OFFICER KELLEY AND IGNORED HER VERBAL COMMANDS TO STOP. AFTER ATTEMPTING TO CREATE DISTANCE, OFFICER KELLEY FEARED FOR HER LIFE, AND DISCHARGED HER DUTY WEAPON ONCE AT MR. BANDA, STRIKING HIM IN THE CENTER OF HIS CHEST.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: DECEDENT WAS ONE (1) OF THREE (3) ACTORS IN AN AGGRAVATED ROBBERY WITH A DEADLY WEAPON (FIREARM) OF A COMMERCIAL BUSINESS, I.E., WING-STOP RESTAURANT. LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS ATTEMPTED TO APPREHEND THE ACTORS UPON EXITING THE RESTAURANT WHEN THE DECEDENT BRANDISHED A FIREARM PLACING THE OFFICERS LIVES IN JEOPARDY. LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS GAVE COMMANDS FOR DECEDENT TO DISARM IN WHICH THE DECEDENT WAS NON-COMPLIANT. LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS UTILIZED DEADLY FORCE TO STOP DECEDENT. DECEDENT WAS SHOT BY LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS AND SUBSEQUENTLY KILLED. THE OTHER TWO (2) ACTORS WERE APPREHENDED ATTEMPTING TO FLEE.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
TRAFFIC STOP
cdr_narrative: THE LEO STOPPED THE DRIVER OF A MOTOR VEHICLE FOR TRAFFIC VIOLATIONS (STOP SIGN). BEFORE THE LEO COULD INFORM THE DRIVER THE REASON FOR THE STOP, THE DRIVER FLED THE SCENE ON FOOT. THE LEO PURSUED THE DRIVER, GIVING COMMANDS TO STOP. THE LEO DEPLOYED HIS TASER, BUT IT HAD NO EFFECT. THE DRIVER CONTINUED TO FLEE. THE LEO DEPLOYED HIS TASER A SECOND TIME, CAUSING THE DRIVER TO FALL TO THE GROUND. THE LEO JUMPED ONTO THE DRIVER TO SUBDUE HIM AND PLACE HIM IN HANDCUFFS. THE DRIVER RESISTED, TRYING TO GET AWAY FROM THE LEO. DURING THE STRUGGLE, THE LEO PULLED HIS SERVICE WEAPON (FIREARM) AND FIRED AT THE DRIVER, STRIKING THE DRIVER THREE TIMES. THE DRIVER DIED AT THE SCENE. NO WEAPON WAS FOUND ON THE DRIVER.

incident_call_other: POSSIBLE ACTIVE SHOOTER IN A RESIDENCE.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 27, 2018 AT APPROXIMATELY 12:47 A.M. HOUSTON POLICE OFFICERS WERE DISPATCHED TO A DRIVE-BY SHOOTING (HPD INCIDENT# 1494762-18) THAT HAD JUST OCCURRED AT 12315 BELLAIRE BOULEVARD, SUITE 300. OFFICERS ARRIVED TO FINE THE FRONT DOOR OF A BUSINESS LOCATED IN A STRIP CENTER HAD BEEN STRUCK BY GUNFIRE AND A PATRON INSIDE THE BUSINESS HAD A NON-PENETRATING GUNSHOT WOUND TO THE HEAD. OFFICERS WERE TOLD THAT THE SUSPECT WAS REFUSED ENTRY AND SHORTLY AFTER FIRED SHOTS INTO THE BUSINESS. WITNESSES ALSO TOLD OFFICERS THE SUSPECT WAS HIDING IN AN ADJACENT BUSINESS. OFFICERS ENTERED THE ADJACENT BUSINESS TO SEARCH FOR THE SUSPECT WHEN OFFICER J. DUNCAN LOCATED THE SUSPECT HIDING IN A CRAMPED AREA INSIDE THE ATTIC. OFFICER DUNCAN ORDERED THE SUSPECT TO SHOW HIS HANDS WHEN THE SUSPECT FIRED A SHOT. OFFICER DUNCAN, FEARING FOR HIS LIFE OF OTHER OFFICERS, RETURNED FIRE AND RETREATED FROM THE BUSINESS. SWAT WAS CALLED FOR A BARRICADED SUSPECT AND LATER DETERMINED THE SUSPECT WAS DECEASED IN THE ATTIC. A FIREARM WAS FOUND NEXT TO THE SUSPECT'S BODY. THE MEDICAL EXAMINER'S OFFICE DETERMINED THE SUSPECT HAD ONE SHOT TO THE HEAD (APPEARED SELF INFLICTED) AND ONE SHOT TO THE CHEST AREA (POSSIBLE SECONDARY WOUND BY OFFICER). MEDICAL EXAMINER'S REPORT IS STILL PENDING. THE CITIZEN WHO WAS STRUCK BY THE SUSPECT'S GUNFIRE WAS TREATED AT THE SCENE BY THE HOUSTON FIRE DEPARTMENT AND RELEASED WITH MINOR INJURIES.

incident_result_of: TRAFFIC STOP
EXECUTION OF A WARRANT
cdr_narrative: ON WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 28, 2018, AROUND 10:00 P.M., THE HOUSTON POLICE DEPARTMENT (HPD) SWAT OFFICERS ASSISTED THE DRUG ENFORCEMENT (DEA), IN AN OPERATION AT 7647 HARRISBURG BOULEVARD, HOUSTON, TEXAS (HPD INCIDENT# 150372018) WHILE HPD SWAT OFFICERS WERE ATTEMPTING TO AFFECT AN ARREST, A SUSPECT FIRED A HANDGUN AT LEAST TWO TIMES AT SWAT OFFICERS. SWAT OFFICER J. SEAY DEFENDED HIMSELF AND THE OTHER OFFICERS ON THE SCENE BY RETURNING FIRE WITH HIS CARBINE DUTY WEAPON STRIKING THE SUSPECT. THE SUSPECT WAS PRONOUNCED CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 DEAD AT THE SCENE BY THE HOUSTON FIRE DEPARTMENT (HFD). AUTOPSY RESULTS ARE PENDING. SEVEN OTHERS SUSPECTS WERE ARRESTED AND ONE OTHER SUSPECT DIED AT A LOCAL HOSPITAL FROM AN UNKNOWN CAUSE AFTER COMPLAINING OF CHEST PAINS AND TROUBLE BREATHING SUBSEQUENT TO ARREST.

incident_result_of: TRAFFIC STOP
cdr_narrative: TROOPER KIM OUSMAN ATTEMPTED TO CONDUCT A TRAFFIC STOP ON A PASSENGER CAR TRAVELING WESTBOUND ON I-10 FOR SPEEDING (110 MPH IN A 65 MPH ZONE) WHEN THE SUSPECT (EDWARD GOMEZ) FLED. AFTER A SHORT PURSUIT, THE SUSPECT LOST CONTROL OF THE VEHICLE AND CRASHED. TROOPER OUSMAN ATTEMPTED A HIGH-RISK TRAFFIC STOP WITH HER PISTOL DRAWN. THE SUSPECT EXITED THE WRECKED VEHICLE WITH A PISTOL IN HIS HAND. TROOPER OUSMAN SHOT SEVERAL ROUNDS FROM HER P-320 STATE-ISSUED WEAPON AT THE SUSPECT. THE SUSPECT WAS HIT AND WENT TO THE GROUND. TROOPER OUSMAN WAITED FOR BACKUP BEFORE SHE APPROACHED THE SUSPECT. WHEN BACKUP ARRIVED, THEY ATTEMPTED CPR UNTIL AN AMBULANCE ARRIVED. THE SUSPECT WAS PRONOUNCED DECEASED AT 11:06 PM AT ST. ELIZABETH'S HOSPITAL IN BEAUMONT, TEXAS.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON NOVEMBER 28, 2018, AT APPROXIMATELY 1:30 PM, A TEXAS HIGHWAY PATROL TROOPER ATTEMPTED TO STOP A VEHICLE DRIVEN BY ANTONIO JASO AGUILAR FOR A TRAFFIC VIOLATION IN SHELBY COUNTY. AGUILAR FLED, AND A PURSUIT ENSUED. DURING THE PURSUIT, AGUILAR RAMMED THE THP UNIT, DISABLING THE UNIT. AGUILAR BRIEFLY EXITED THE VEHICLE AND FIRED AT THE TROOPER WITH A RIFLE. THE TROOPER RETURNED FIRE, BUT AGUILAR WAS ABLE TO ESCAPE. LATER THAT DATE, THE SUSPECT'S VEHICLE WAS LOCATED IN RURAL SHELBY COUNTY NEAR CENTER, TEXAS. AN EXTENSIVE SEARCH UTILIZING STATE, FEDERAL AND LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT AS WELL AS DPS AIRCRAFT WAS CONDUCTED WITHOUT SUCCESS. A WARRANT WAS ISSUED CHARGING AGUILAR WITH ATTEMPTED CAPITAL MURDER. AGUILAR WAS ADDED TO THE TEXAS TOP TEN MOST WANTED FUGITIVE LIST AND A $7,500.00 REWARD WAS OFFERED FOR INFORMATION ABOUT HIS WHEREABOUTS. OVER THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS, RANGERS, DPS CID, US MARSHALS, AND NUMEROUS OTHER STATE, FEDERAL AND LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT CONTINUED THE SEARCH FOR AGUILAR. NUMEROUS INTERVIEWS WERE CONDUCTED. MULTIPLE STRUCTURES AND RESIDENCES OF FAMILY AND ASSOCIATES WERE SEARCHED WITHOUT SUCCESS. ON DECEMBER 1, 2018, THE CENTER POLICE DEPARTMENT RECEIVED INFORMATION THAT AGUILAR WAS LOCATED INSIDE A RESIDENCE IN CENTER, SHELBY COUNTY, TEXAS. THE LUFKIN POLICE DEPARTMENT SRT ALONG WITH NUMEROUS LOCAL OFFICERS RESPONDED TO THE RESIDENCE AND VERIFIED WITH THE PROPERTY OWNER THAT THE FUGITIVE WAS INSIDE THE RESIDENCE ARMED WITH AN ASSAULT RIFLE. A PERIMETER WAS ESTABLISHED. DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY CRISIS NEGOTIATION UNIT MEMBERS RESPONDED TO ASSIST. UTILIZING LUFKIN PD ARMOR AND A TACTICAL ROBOT, A THROW PHONE WAS INTRODUCED INTO THE RESIDENCE AND COMMUNICATION WAS ESTABLISHED. CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 AFTER SEVERAL HOURS OF NEGOTIATION, THE SUSPECT TERMINATED COMMUNICATIONS. AT APPROXIMATELY 12:24 AM, THE FRONT DOOR OF THE RESIDENCE WAS BREACHED TO ALLOW ACCESS FOR THE TACTICAL ROBOT. ONCE THE ROBOT WAS INSIDE, THE SUSPECT REESTABLISHED COMMUNICATION FOR A BRIEF TIME THEN LEFT THE THROW PHONE OFF THE HOOK AND TERMINATED COMMUNICATIONS. THE SUSPECT COULD BE SEEN ON VIDEO SITTING ON A BED ARMED WITH THE RIFLE POINTED TOWARD THE DOOR. AT APPROXIMATELY 1:00 AM, DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY TACTICAL OPERATORS ASSUMED OPERATIONAL CONTROL OF THE SCENE. THE CRISIS NEGOTIATION UNIT CONTINUED WITH INTERMITTENT CONTACT WITH AGUILAR, BUT THE NEGOTIATIONS WERE NOT SUCCESSFUL. AS NEGOTIATIONS DETERIORATED, MULTIPLE MEASURES WERE EXHAUSTED BY THE TACTICAL OPERATORS IN ATTEMPTS TO HAVE THE SUSPECT SURRENDER PEACEFULLY. AT APPROXIMATELY 3:00 AM, THE DECISION WAS MADE TO DEPLOY CHEMICAL MUNITIONS INTO THE STRUCTURE. AT APPROXIMATELY 3:46 AM, AGUILAR EMERGED FROM THE RESIDENCE AND BEGAN TO FIRE A RIFLE AT SOG PERSONNEL. TWO SOG OPERATORS RETURNED FIRE, FATALLY STRIKING THE SUSPECT. NO OFFICERS WERE INJURED DURING THE EVENT.

EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: OFFICERS WERE DISPATCHED TO A CALL FOR SERVICE AT THE 400 BLOCK OF E EXPRESSWAY 83. DISPATCH ADVISED A MALE BY THE NAME OF RICARDO TREVINO III TOOK SEVERAL PILLS AND NEEDED AN AMBULANCE. WHEN OFFICERS ARRIVED TREVINO REFUSED TO SPEAK WITH OFFICERS AND FLED IN HIS VEHICLE. OFFICERS CHASED TREVINO FOR SEVERAL MINUTES DOWN FM 732, FM 281 AND SEVERAL SURROUNDINGS STREETS. DURING THE PURSUIT TREVINO DROVE INTO A DEAD END OFF OF RANCH PARK ROAD. OFFICERS SURROUNDED TREVINO'S VEHICLE AND GAVE HIM SEVERAL COMMANDS TO STOP HIS VEHICLE. TREVINO DISREGARDED OFFICERS' COMMANDS AND DROVE HIS VEHICLE HEAD ON CRASHING INTO AN UNMARKED POLICE UNIT. TREVINO CONTINUED ACCELERATING TRYING TO PUSH THE UNMARKED UNIT OUT OF THE WAY. TREVINO THEN DROVE THE VEHICLE IN REVERSE AT A HIGH RATE OF SPEED AND THAT IS WHEN OFFICERS DISCHARGED THEIR FIREARMS TO STOP THE THREAT. TREVINO SUSTAINED AN UNKNOWN NUMBER OF GUNSHOT WOUNDS TO HIS BODY. OFFICERS ATTEMPTED TO PROVIDE MEDICAL ATTENTION TO TREVINO, BUT HE WAS PRONOUNCED DEAD ON SCENE WHEN PARAMEDICS ARRIVED.

incident_call_other: ON THE 28TH OF DECEMBER 2018 AT APPROXIMATELY 1:48 PM, OFFICERS WITH THE BIG SPRING POLICE DEPARTMENT OBSERVED A SUBJECT THEY KNEW HISPANIC/MALE 31 YEARS OF AGE DRIVING A 2012 RED IN COLOR BUICK 4 DOOR IN THE AREA OF 4TH AND DOUGLAS. OFFICERS KNEW HE WAS WANTED FOR FIREARMS SMUGGLING AND BURGLARY OF A BUILDING AT WHICH TIME THEY ATTEMPTED A TRAFFIC STOP. HE REFUSED TO STOP AND A PURSUIT INITIATED IN THE 400 BLOCK OF S. DOUGLAS. THE PURSUIT CONTINUED SOUTHBOUND AND ENDED IN THE 400 BLOCK OF EDWARDS. HE EXITED HIS VEHICLE AND RAN NORTHBOUND IN-BETWEEN HOUSES. A PERIMETER WAS SET UP AND HE WAS ULTIMATELY LOCATED HIDING IN A DUMPSTER IN THE ALLEY OF THE 400 BLOCK OF DALLAS. ONCE HE WAS LOCATED HE FIRED MULTIPLE ROUNDS AT OFFICERS IN WHICH AN DEPUTY WITH THE HOWARD COUNTY SHERIFF?S OFFICE RETURNED FIRE STRIKING HIM IN THE HAND. HE WAS TAKEN INTO CUSTODY A SHORT TIME LATER AND TAKEN TO HOSPITAL AND TREATED FOR HIS INJURIES.

incident_result_of: OTHER
cdr_narrative: SHAYNE LYONS APPROACHED AN OFFICER WHILE DISPLAYING A MACHETE SO AN OFFICER DISCHARGED HIS WEAPON TO STOP THE THREAT TO HIS SAFETY.

incident_result_of: HOSTAGE/BARRICADE/OTHER EMERG SITUATION
cdr_narrative: ON 12/30/2018, VICTIM REPORTED THAT SUSPECT HAD STABBED HIM. LAW ENFORCEMENT ATTEMPTED TO CONTACT SUSPECT, WHO SWUNG MACHETE AT OFFICER THEN BARRICADED HIMSELF INSIDE HIS RESIDENCE. OFFICERS ATTEMPTED TO CALL SUSPECT OUT OF HIS RESIDENCE. OFFICERS BEGAN TO REMOVE FENCING CLOSE TO SUSPECT'S DOOR IN AN ATTEMPT TO GAIN A BETTER VANTAGE POINT ON ENTRY DOOR. THE SUSPECT CAME OUT FROM DOOR AND SWUNG MACHETE AT OFFICERS. OFFICER FIRED UPON SUSPECT, STRIKING SUSPECT IN THE HEAD, SUSPECT DIED ON SCENE.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON 01/02/109 AT APPROXIMATELY 1407 HOURS SAN ANTONIO UEDI MIRELES # 2548 RESPONDED TO LOOP 410 NE NEAR THE AUSTIN HWY RAMP FOR A GRAY STALLED VEHICLE. THE CALLER REPORTED THE PERSON WITH THE STALLED VEHICLE SEEMED SUSPICIOUS AND WAS REMOVING THE LICENSE PLATES FROM THE VEHICLE. WHEN MIRELES ARRIVED HE LOCATED A GRAY 2019 CADILLAC THAT APPEARED TO BE STUCK IN THE MUD IN THE GRASSY AREA BETWEEN THE MAIN LANES AND THE RAMP TO AUSTIN HWY. MIRELES EXITED HIS PATROL VEHICLE AND APPROACHED THE VEHICLE. THE WEATHER WAS COLD AND RAINING AND HE COULD NOT DETERMINE IF THE VEHICLE WAS OCCUPIED. MIRELES WENT TO THE PASSENGER SIDE OF THE VEHICLE AND KNOCKED ON THE WINDOW. MIRELES REPORTED THAT HE HEARD THE VEHICLE’S DOORS UNLOCK AND HE OPENED THE PASSENGER DOOR SO HE COULD SEE INSIDE THE VEHICLE. THE ACTOR QUICKLY EXITED THE DRIVER’S SIDE OF THE VEHICLE WHEN MIRELES OPENED THE PASSENGER DOOR. MIRELES STATED THE ACTOR TURNED TOWARDS HIS DIRECTION AND SEEMED TO BE VERY NERVOUS AND NOT ACTING NORMAL. THE ACTOR SAID SOMETHING ABOUT THE VEHICLE HAVING FLAT TIRES. MIRELES SAID IT APPEARED THE ACTOR WAS UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF NARCOTICS AND KEPT TRYING TO GET BACK INSIDE THE VEHICLE. HE SAID HE KEPT TALKING TO THE ACTOR WAS ASKING HIM TO COME TOWARDS HIM AND THE ROADWAY TO GET OUT OF THE MUD THEY WERE STANDING IN. MIRELES CONTINUED TALKING TO THE ACTOR UNTIL OFFICER GARCIA ARRIVED AT THE LOCATION. WITH GARCIA’S ASSISTANCE THEY WERE ABLE TO GET THE ACTOR TO START WALKING TOWARDS MIRELES’S PATROL VEHICLE. MIRELES STATED THE ACTOR PAUSED AND PICKED UP A METAL PIPE AND HE ASKED HIM TO PUT IT DOWN. THE ACTOR PUT THE PIPE DOWN AND WALKED OVER TO MIRELES’S PATROL VEHICLE. OFFICER GARCIA ASKED THE ACTOR FOR IDENTIFICATION AND HE STATED HE DID NOT HAVE ANY. MIRELES STATED HE DECIDED TO HANDCUFF THE ACTOR FOR THEIR SAFETY, DUE TO HIS ERRATIC BEHAVIOR AND UNTIL THEY COULD DETERMINE IF THE VEHICLE WAS STOLEN AND THE IDENTITY OF THE ACTOR. WHEN MIRELES AND GARCIA STARTED TO PLACE THE ACTOR IN HANDCUFFS THE ACTOR BEGAN RESISTING THEM. THE ACTOR WAS ABLE TO GET HIS ARMS IN FRONT OF HIS BODY AND CONTINUED TO PHYSICALLY RESIST MIRELES AND GARCIA. BOTH OFFICERS WERE GIVING VERBAL COMMANDS TO THE ACTOR TO STOP RESISTING. AS THEY STRUGGLED WITH THE ACTOR AND DUE TO THEIR PROXIMITY TO THE ROADWAY MIRELES DEPLOYED HIS TASER. MIRELES TASED THE ACTOR AND HE BEGAN TO FALL TO THE GROUND. MIRELES WAS ON HIS KNEES AND WAS ATTEMPTING TO GAIN CONTROL OF THE ACTOR WHEN THE ACTOR WAS ABLE TO GAIN CONTROL OF MIRELES’S TASER. THE ACTOR USED THE TASER ON MIRELES AND WAS ABLE TO TASE HIM IN THE LEG. MIRELES AND GARCIA CONTINUED TO STRUGGLE WITH THE ACTOR. MIRELES STATED THE ACTOR REACHED TOWARDS HIS WAISTBAND WITH HIS FREE HAND AND FEARING THAT THE ACTOR WAS REACHING FOR A WEAPON HE FIRED THREE ROUNDS FROM HIS SERVICE WEAPON. THE ACTOR WAS STRUCK THREE TIMES IN THE CHEST. MIRELES AND GARCIA WERE ABLE TO HANDCUFF THE ACTOR AND AS THEY ROLLED HIM TO HIS SIDE MIRELES OBSERVED A KNIFE ON THE PAVEMENT NEAR THE ACTOR.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON THURSDAY, JANUARY 3RD, 2019 AT APPROXIMATELY 0840 HOURS THE DECEASED WAS IN THE 1400 BLOCK OF PLEASANTON ROAD. WHILE THERE HE FIRED SEVERAL SHOTS AT A CITIZEN WHO WAS RIDING A BIKE. POLICE WERE CALLED AT THAT TIME. THE DECEASED THEN WALKED SOUTHBOUND ON PLEASANTON ROAD HOLDING A HANDGUN. THE DECEASED WAS ENCOUNTERED BY OFFICERS RESPONDING TO THE CALL AT THE INTERSECTION OF PLEASANTON ROAD AND E. GERALD. WHEN THE FIRST OFFICER APPROACHED THE DECEASED IN A PATROL VEHICLE THE DECEASED STARTED SHOOTING AT THE OFFICER. THE DECEASED THEN RAN SOUTHBOUND ON PLEASANTON ROAD. AS THE DECEASED WAS RUNNING SOUTHBOUND ON PLEASANTON ROAD HE TURNED AND FIRED SHOTS AT THE SECOND RESPONDING OFFICER. THE DECEASED STOPPED RUNNING AND TOOK UP A POSITION AND STARTED FIRING SHOTS IN THE DIRECTION OF THREE DIFFERENT OFFICERS WHO RESPONDED TO THE CALL. THE OFFICERS RETURNED FIRE, STRIKING THE DECEASED. THE DECEASED FELL TO THE GROUND. THE DECEASED WAS TAKEN INTO CUSTODY

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON FRIDAY, JANUARY 4, 2019, AT APPROXIMATELY 1632 HOURS HOUSTON POLICE OFFICERS WERE DISPATCHED TO A SHOOTING JUST OCCURRED AT 213 W. 44TH STREET. OFFICERS ARRIVED TO FIND THREE PERSONS HAD BEEN SHOT BY ONE SUSPECT. OFFICERS IMMEDIATELY BEGAN TO SEARCH FOR THE SUSPECT AND SHORTLY AFTER AN OFFICER WAS FLAGGED DOWN BY THE SUSPECT'S FATHER WHO THEN POINTED THE OFFICER IN THE DIRECTION OF THE SUSPECT. THE OFFICER LOCATED A MALE THAT APPEARED TO MATCH THE DESCRIPTION OF THE SUSPECT AND FOUND HE WAS STRUGGLING WITH AN UNKNOWN FEMALE BETWEEN TWO RESIDENCES. THE OFFICER GAVE VERBAL COMMANDS FOR BOTH PARTIES TO GET DOWN ON THE GROUND. THE FEMALE SEPARATED HERSELF FROM THE MALE AND BEGAN TO SCREAM. THE MALE NOW FACING THE OFFICER WAS HOLDING A SILVER PISTOL IN BOTH HANDS, IN FRONT O HIS STOMACH. THE OFFICER GAVE THE SUSPECT SEVERAL VERBAL COMMANDS TO GET ON THE GROUND TO WHICH HE DID NOT COMPLY AND WAS NOW SWITCHING THE PISTOL BETWEEN HANDS. IN FEAR OF HIS LIFE, THE OFFICER FIRED THREE TIMES, STRIKING THE SUSPECT ONCE. AS THE OFFICER APPROACHED THE SUSPECT, HE WAS LAYING ON THE GROUND ON HIS BACK WITH A SILVER PISTOL ON THE RIGHT SIDE OF HIS BODY. THE PISTOL WAS SECURED AND OFFICERS BEGAN TO ADMINISTER FIRST AID. THE SUSPECT DIED AT THE SCENE. NO OFFICERS WERE INJURED DURING THIS INCIDENT. THE MEDICAL EXAMINER'S OFFICE DETERMINED THE SUSPECT HAD ONE SHOT THROUGH HIS ARM WHICH THEN CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 TRAVELED THROUGH HIS CHEST AREA. THE THREE CITIZENS HOT BY THE SUSPECT WERE ALL TRANSPORTED TO AREA HOSPITALS AND ARE EXPECTED TO SURVIVE.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE; TRAFFIC STOP
cdr_narrative: ON FRIDAY, JANUARY 4, 2019 AT APPROXIMATELY 9:34 PM, A CITIZEN REPORTED TO SAN MARCOS POLICE DISPATCH THAT SHE HAD WITNESSES A MALE SHOOTING AT A PARKED VEHICLE. THE WITNESS REPORTED THAT THE MALE THEN ENTERED THE PASSENGER SIDE OF THE SAME VEHICLE JUST PRIOR TO THE VEHICLE LEAVING THE SCENE. MOMENTS LATER, OFFICERS LOCATED A VEHICLE MATCHING THE DESCRIPTION OF THE INVOLVED VEHICLE DRIVING AWAY FROM THE AREA. OFFICERS CONDUCTED A CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 HIGH RISK STOP ON THE SUSPECT VEHICLE AT 1302 WEST HOPKINS STREET, THE PARKING LOT OF A CONVENIENCE STORE. MR. CAMACHO, THE DECEASED, EXITED THE PASSENGER SIDE OF THE SUSPECT VEHICLE AND FACED THE OFFICERS. MR. CAMACHO MATCHED THE DESCRIPTION OF THE PERSON SEEN FIRING AT THE VEHICLE MOMENTS EARLIER. OFFICERS GAVE MR. CAMACHO CLEAR AND LOUD COMMENDS TO KEEP HIS HANDS RAISED HIGH. MR. CAMACHO BRIEFLY COMPLIED BUT THEN LOWERED HIS HANDS AND REACHED FOR THE AREA OF HIS WAISTBAND. MR. CAMACHO GRASPED A PISTOL IN HIS WAISTBAND AND BEGAN TO PULL UPWARD ALL WHILE BEING GIVEN COMMANDS TO KEEP HIS HANDS IN THE AIR. BOTH INVOLVED OFFICERS FIRED THEIR SERVICE PISTOLS SIMULTANEOUSLY, STRIKING MR. CAMACHO MULTIPLE TIMES. WHILE TAKING MR. CAMACHO INTO CUSTODY, THE OFFICERS DETERMINED THE PISTOL WAS A COMPRESSED AIR PELLET PISTOL. THE PISTOL WAS A REPLICA OF A SEMI-AUTOMATIC HANDGUN. MR. CAMACHO WAS PRONOUNCED DEAD AT THE SCENE BY THE ON-CALL JUSTICE OF THE PEACE, JOANN PRADO.

incident_result_of: EXECUTION OF A WARRANT
cdr_narrative: OFFICERS OBSERVED THE SUBJECT IN A GREEN CHEVROLET TRUCK AND KNEW HE HAD A FELONY WARRANT. OFFICERS HAD ALSO RECEIVED INFORMATION THAT THE SUBJECT WAS ARMED WITH A WEAPON. OFFICERS FOLLOWED THE SUBJECT TO 111 SE 37TH WHERE THE SUBJECT STOPPED THE TRUCK IN THE DRIVEWAY. AN OFFICER APPROACHED THE TRUCK AND MADE CONTACT WITH THE DRIVER, WHOM THEY KNEW TO HAVE A FELONY WARRANT. THE OFFICER GAVE THE DRIVER COMMANDS TO STOP AND INFORMED THE DRIVER HE WAS UNDER ARREST. THE DRIVER PUT THE TRUCK IN REVERSE AND TURNED THE WHEEL, STEERING THE TRUCK TOWARDS THE OFFICER. THE OFFICER WAS TRAPPED IN THE OPENING OF THE DOORWAY, BETWEEN THE DOOR AND THE FRAME OF THE TRUCK. THE OFFICER ALSO NOTICED THE DRIVER HAD A PISTOL IN A HOLSTER ON HIS RIGHT HIP. THE DRIVER BEGAN TO DRIVE IN REVERSE, DRAGGING THE OFFICER. WHEN THE TRUCK MADE IT BACK OUT TO THE STREET THE OFFICER WAS STILL TRAPPED IN THE DOORWAY. IN AN EFFORT TO END THE THREAT OF BEING KILLED OR SERIOUSLY INJURED BY THE DRIVER CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 RUNNING THE OFFICER OVER; THE OFFICER SHOT THE DRIVER. SEVERAL OFFICERS PROVIDED MEDICAL ATTENTION AT THE SCENE AND THE DRIVER WAS TRANSPORTED TO A LOCAL HOSPITAL, WHERE HE DIED OF HIS INJURIES. THE OFFICER WAS ALSO TAKEN TO A LOCAL HOSPITAL FOR HIS INJURIES AND LATER RELEASED.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE; HOSTAGE/BARRICADE/OTHER EMERG SITUATION
cdr_narrative: ON JANUARY 6, 2019, HARRIS COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE DEPUTIES WERE DISPATCHED TO AN ABDUCTION/KIDNAPPING INCIDENT. DEPUTIES ARRIVED AND ATTEMPTED TO SPEAK TO THE OFFENDER, WHO HELD THE VICTIM AT GUNPOINT. THE OFFENDER BARRICADED HIMSELF IN A BEDROOM WITH THE VICTIM AND MADE THREATS TO KILL HIM. SWAT PERSONNEL AND HOSTAGE NEGOTIATORS RESPONDED AND ARRIVED. AFTER SEVERAL HOURS, SWAT PERSONNEL BREACHED THE BEDROOM DOOR AND ENTERED. THE VICTIM RAN TO SAFETY AS SWAT PERSONNEL SEARCHED THE ROOM. AS A SWAT MEMBER CLEARED THE CLOSET WITH HIS HANDGUN DRAWN, THE OFFENDER GRABBED THE SWAT MEMBER'S HANDGUN AND ATTEMPTED TO GAIN POSSESSION OF IT. ANOTHER SWAT MEMBER APPROACHED THE CLOSET AND DISCHARGED HIS HANDGUN, STRIKING THE OFFENDER. EMS PERSONNEL WERE ESCORTED IN AND DETERMINED THE OFFENDER TO HAVE NO SIGNS OF LIFE.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: AT 12:33 PM ON JANUARY 8, 2019, MIDLAND COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE RECEIVED A 911 CALL REFERENCE A DISTURBANCE INVOLVING A HAMMER AND A HEAD INJURY EAST OF MIDLAND OFF OF BUSINESS 20 AND COUNTY ROAD 140. OTHER PEOPLE CALLED IN REPORTING THAT A MALE SUBJECT WAS WALKING IN THE ROADWAY IN THE EASTBOUND TRAFFIC AND HAD BEEN STRUCK BY A VEHICLE MIRROR BUT WAS UP AND GETTING ON THE RAILROAD TRACKS. THE SUBJECT APPEARED TO BE CUTTING HIMSELF WITH SOMETHING AND WAS WALKING IN THE MIDDLE OF THE RAILROAD TRACK. SOME SUBJECTS WERE TRYING TO GET HIM OFF THE TRACK AND WERE BEHIND HIM TRYING TO TALK TO HIM BUT HE WAS NOT PAYING ANY ATTENTION TO THEM. A PATROL DEPUTY ARRIVED AND TRIED TO TALK TO THE SUBJECT BUT WAS NOT HAVING ANY LUCK. THE DEPUTY DEPLOYED A TASER TWICE BUT IT DID NOT PHASE THE SUBJECT, THE SUBJECT TURNED AROUND AND LUNGED AT THE DEPUTY WITH A BROKEN BOTTLE, THE DEPUTY FIRED TWO ROUNDS AND THE SUBJECT FELL ON THE TRACKS. A TRAIN WAS HEADING EASTBOUND AND THE DEPUTY HAD TO PULL THE SUBJECT OFF THE TRACKS TO KEEP HIM FROM GETTING INJURED AND DISCOVERED THE SUBJECT WAS DECEASED. THE TEXAS RANGERS HAVE BEEN ASKED TO CONDUCT THE INVESTIGATION INTO THE OFFICER INVOLVED SHOOTING.

cdr_narrative: AFTER ASSAULTING AN OFFICER, THE SUSPECT DISCHARGED HIS FIREARM AT MULTIPLE OFFICERS WHILE FLEEING ON FOOT AND SHOT AN OFFICER, CAUSING INJURIES. ANOTHER OFFICER RETURNED FIRE, STRIKING THE SUSPECT MULTIPLE TIMES, RESULTING IN SUSPECT'S INJURIES AND SUBSEQUENT DEATH.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
EXECUTION OF A WARRANT
cdr_narrative: ON MONDAY, JANUARY 14, 2019 AT APPROXIMATELY 9:45 PM, ECTOR COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE SPECIAL INVESTIGATIVE UNIT (SIU) AND TACTICAL RESPONSE TEAM (TRT) EXECUTED A "NO KNOCK" SEARCH WARRANT AT 7321 N. KENTUCKY, ODESSA, ECTOR COUNTY, TEXAS. THE WARRANT WAS IDENTIFIED AS HIGH RISK WITH THE POTENTIAL OF GUNFIRE DUE TO PRIOR THREATS MADE AGAINST LAW ENFORCEMENT BY THE TARGET DAMON ASAD. AS OFFICERS OF THE TACTICAL RESPONSE TEAM MADE ENTRY INTO THE RESIDENCE AND ENCOUNTERED ASAD THEY WERE FACED WITH GUNFIRE. ASAD WAS IN POSSESSION OF A SEMI-AUTOMATIC HANDGUN AND FIRED SEVERAL SHOTS AT THE OFFICERS. OFFICERS EXCHANGED GUNFIRE WITH ASAD AND DURING THE EXCHANGE ASAD WAS STRUCK SEVERAL TIMES. ASAD WAS LATER PRONOUNCED DECEASED. THREE OF THE OFFICERS ASSIGNED TO THE TACTICAL RESPONSE TEAM WERE INJURED DURING THE EXCHANGE OF GUNFIRE, TRANSPORTED TO CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 MEDICAL CENTER HOSPITAL, TREATED AND RELEASED. THE INVESTIGATION INTO THE DEATH OF ASAD REVEALED THAT FIVE OF THE NINE OFFICERS ASSIGNED TO THE TACTICAL RESPONSE TEAM FIRED SHOTS AT ASAD WHICH EVENTUALLY LED TO HIS DEMISE.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE; TRAFFIC STOP
cdr_narrative: ON JANUARY 14, 2019 AT APPROXIMATELY 0452 HOURS, EL PASO POLICE DEPARTMENT , PEBBLE HILLS REGIONAL COMMAND PATROL OFFICERS RESPONDED TO SEVERAL SHOTS FIRED CALLS GENERATING AT 1600 TOMMY AARON, A SECOND 1348 BOB MITCHELL, AND A THIRD CALL AT 0458 HOURS AT 1819 ROBERT WYNN. CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 WHILE CANVASSING THE BLOCK OVER AT DALE DOUGLAS PATROL OFFICERS WERE FLAGGED DOWN BY A WOMEN WALKING HER DOG. SHE ADVISED SHE HAD JUST SEEN A BLACK CAR PASS BY THAT MAY BE RELATED TO THE SHOTS FIRED. OFFICERS CONTINUED TO CHECK THE STREET AND LOCATED THE BLACK VEHICLE COMING IN THE OPPOSITE DIRECTION. OFFICERS ATTEMPTED TO STOP THE VEHICLE WITH THE USE OF EMERGENCY LIGHTS AND SIREN AND THE VEHICLE REFUSED TO STOP AND ENTERED THE WIND TREE APARTMENT PARKING LOT. THE SUSPECT COLLIDED WITH THE BUILDING AND A PARKED VEHICLE IN THE PARKING LOT. WHEN THE SUSPECT EXITED HIS VEHICLE THE OFFICERS OBSERVED HE WAS HOLDING A HANDGUN. THE OFFICERS DISCHARGED THEIR SERVICE WEAPONS STRIKING THE SUSPECT. THE SUSPECT WAS TRANSPORTED TO DEL SOL MEDICAL CENTER, WHERE HE WAS TAKEN IN FOR EMERGENCY SURGERY. AFTER PERFORMING TWO SURGERIES, DOCTORS PRONOUNCED THE SUSPECT DECEASED. MEDICAL EXAMINERS INVESTIGATOR- MEI ROMERO RESPONDED, AND THE DECEDENT’S BODY WAS TRANSPORTED TO THE MEDICAL EXAMINER’S OFFICER. THE OFFICERS WERE UNINJURED IN THIS INCIDENT.THE CASE IS PENDING AUTOPSY EXAMINATION OF THE DECEDENT.
