incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE; HOSTAGE/BARRICADE/OTHER EMERG SITUATION
cdr_narrative: ON JANUARY 25, 2019 AT 11:00PM OFFICERS WERE DISPATCHED TO 839 W. CENTERVILLE ROAD GARLAND, TX. IN REFERENCE TO A SUICIDAL SUBJECT THAT WAS ARMED WITH A HANDGUN AND SITTING INSIDE OF A VEHICLE. PRIOR TO OFFICERS ARRIVAL ON THE SCENE, THE SUBJECT PLACED THE HANDGUN ON TOP OF HIS VEHICLE, WHILE HE STAYED SEATED INSIDE. CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 ONCE NUMEROUS OFFICERS ARRIVED ON THE SCENE THEY IMPLORED THE SUBJECT TO EXIT THE VEHICLE AND NOT TO REACH FOR THE HANDGUN. AFTER SEVERAL MINUTES, THE SUBJECT REACHED FOR THE HANDGUN ON THE ROOF OF THE VEHICLE. AS THE SUBJECT LOWERED THE HANDGUN, OFFICER HALL AND ADAMS BELIEVED THAT THE SUBJECT WAS GOING TO FIRE HIS WEAPON AT THEM AND IN THE DIRECTION OF OTHER OFFICERS. OFFICERS HALL AND ADAMS FIRED THEIR PATROL RIFLES, IN THE DEFENSE OF THEMSELVES AND OTHER OFFICERS, STRIKING AND KILLING THE SUBJECT.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
EXECUTION OF A WARRANT
cdr_narrative: ON JANUARY 28, 2019, HOUSTON POLICE OFFICERS ASSIGNED TO NARCOTICS DIVISION ATTEMPTED TO SERVE A NARCOTICS SEARCH WARRANT AT 7815 HARDING. OFFICERS ANNOUNCED THEIR PRESENCE PRIOR TO FORCING ENTRY INTO THE RESIDENCE. ONCE INSIDE OF THE RESIDENCE OFFICERS BEGAN RECEIVING HANDGUN FIRE. A WHITE FEMALE, LATER IDENTIFIED AS RHOGENA ANN NICHOLAS APPROACHED A OFFICER WHO HAD BEEN SHOT AT THE SCENE AND ATTEMPTED TO GRAB HIS WEAPON. ONE OFFICER DISCHARGED HIS LONG RIFLE AND STRUCK MRS. NICHOLAS TWICE IN THE ABDOMEN. MRS. NICHOLAS DIED AT THE SCENE DUE TO THE GUNSHOT INJURIES SHE SUSTAINED DURING THE INCIDENT.

incident_result_of: EXECUTION OF A WARRANT
cdr_narrative: ON JANUARY 28, 2019, HOUSTON POLICE OFFICERS ASSIGNED TO THE NARCOTICS DIVISION ATTEMPTED TO SERVE A NARCOTICS SEARCH WARRANT AT 7815 HARDING. OFFICERS ANNOUNCED THEIR PRESENCE PRIOR TO FORCING ENTRY INTO THE RESIDENCE. ONCE INSIDE OF THE RESIDENCE OFFICERS BEGAN RECEIVING HANDGUN FIRE BY A WHITE MALE, LATER IDENTIFIED AS DENNIS WAYNE TUTTLE. OFFICERS RETURNED FIRE, HOWEVER; FOUR OFFICERS SUSTAINED GUNSHOT INJURIES. OFFICERS RETURNED FIRE AND STRUCK MR. TUTTLE SEVERAL TIMES DURING THE GUN FIRE EXCHANGE. MR. TUTTLE DIED AT THE SCENE DUE TO THE GUNSHOT INJURIES HE SUSTAINED DURING THE INCIDENT.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON 1/28/2018, AT APPROXIMATELY 10:30PM, A VEHICLE EVADED FROM AN AUSTIN PD OFFICER, AFTER AN ATTEMPTED TRAFFIC STOP FOR A TRAFFIC VIOLATION COMMITTED AT THE INTERSECTION OF E. SLAUGHTER LANE AND THE NORTHBOUND FRONTAGE ROAD OF IH35. AFTER THE OFFICER INITIATED HIS EMERGENCY LIGHTS TO STOP THE VEHICLE, IT BEGAN TO EVADE THE OFFICER. DUE TO THE OFFENSE BEING A MINOR TRAFFIC VIOLATION, THE OFFICER DID NOT ENGAGE IN A PURSUIT OF THE VEHICLE. LATER THE OFFICER SPOKE OVER THE PHONE WITH A FAMILY MEMBER OF THE REGISTERED OWNER OF THE VEHICLE. THROUGH THAT CONVERSATION, THE OFFICER RECEIVED INFORMATION THAT THE VEHICLE, WHICH HAD EVADED EARLIER, MAY BE IN THE AREA OF AUBURN BLAZE LANE, IN AUSTIN, TEXAS. AT APPROXIMATELY 1:40AM, AN AUSTIN PD PATROL SUPERVISOR WAS PATROLLING IN THIS AREA, AND DISCOVERED THE VEHICLE THAT HAD EVADED EARLIER IN A FIELD ALONG SIDE THE 7900 BLK OF E. WILLIAM CANNON DRIVE. THIS SUPERVISOR WENT OUT ON THE VEHICLE TO INVESTIGATE FURTHER. AS HE PULLED UP BEHIND THE VEHICLE, THE DECEDENT EXITED THE VEHICLE ARMED WITH A FIREARM AND INITIALLY POINTED IT AT THE PATROL SUPERVISOR. THE PATROL SUPERVISOR TOOK A POSITION OF COVER AND REQUESTED MORE PATROL UNITS TO RESPOND. THE DECEDENT ASSUMED A KNEELING POSTURE ON THE GROUND. THE PATROL SUPERVISOR SPOKE TO THE DECEDENT FOR SEVERAL MINUTES IN AN ATTEMPT TO GET THE DECEDENT TO PUT DOWN THE FIREARM AND SURRENDER. MORE OFFICERS THEN BEGAN TO ARRIVE. AT VARIOUS TIMES DURING THE ENCOUNTER THE DECEDENT POINTED THE FIREARM AT HIMSELF. SUDDENLY, THE DECEDENT STOOD AND POINTED THE FIREARM OUTWARDS IN THE DIRECTION OF OFFICERS ON THE SCENE, AND TWO OFFICERS ENGAGED THE DECEDENT WITH GUNFIRE, STRIKING HIM. THE DECEDENT FELL TO THE GROUND. OFFICERS APPROACHED THE CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 DECEDENT, SECURED HIM, AND BEGAN ADMINISTERING FIRST AID WHILE AWAITING FOR EMS TO RESPOND. ONCE EMS ARRIVED, THE DECEDENT WAS TRANSPORTED TO THE HOSPITAL. THE DECEDENT WAS PRONOUNCED DECEASED AT 3:27AM.

incident_result_of: OTHER
incident_call_other: CHECKING SEX OFFENDER STATUS FOR PAROLE
cdr_narrative: ON 1/30/2019 AT APPROXIMATELY 2049 HOURS, A STATE PAROLE OFFICER APPROACHED A RESIDENCE AT 13115 W CR 127 TO CHECK ON A PAROLEE THAT IS A REGISTERED SEX OFFENDER WHO GAVE THIS ADDRESS AS HIS PLACE OF RESIDENCE. THE PAROLE OFFICER KNOCKED ON THE DOOR AND WAS MET AT THE DOOR BY A WHITE FEMALE IN HER 50'S WHO POINTED A PISTOL AT HER. WHEN QUESTIONED ABOUT THE PAROLEE THE FEMALE STATED THAT THE PAROLEE DID NOT LIVE THERE. THE PAROLE OFFICER LEFT AND CONTACTED THE MIDLAND COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE REQUESTING THAT DEPUTIES CHECK THE RESIDENCE FOR THE PAROLEE AND INVESTIGATE THE FEMALE CARRYING A WEAPON. AT ABOUT 2210 HOURS, TWO DEPUTIES FROM THE MIDLAND COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE ARRIVED AT THE RESIDENCE AND KNOCKED ON THE DOOR ANNOUNCING THAT CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 THEY WERE WITH THE SHERIFF'S OFFICE AND TOOK UP POSITIONS AWAY FROM THE FRONT DOOR. A WHITE MALE ANSWERED THE DOOR AND POINTED A WEAPON AT THE DEPUTY, THE DEPUTY ORDERED THE MALE TO DROP THE WEAPON WITH NO RESPONSE THE DEPUTY FIRED AT THE MALE STRIKING HIM IN THE CHEST AND THE MALE COLLAPSED INSIDE THE RESIDENCE. A WHITE FEMALE CAME OUT OF THE RESIDENCE AND WAS IMMEDIATELY REMOVED FROM THE RESIDENCE AND CHECKED FOR WEAPONS. RESPONDING DEPUTIES ARRIVED AT THE RESIDENCE AND ASSISTED CHECKING FOR ANY ADDITIONAL PERSONS AND PERFORMED FIRST AID ON THE DOWNED MALE UNTIL EMS ARRIVED ON SCENE. THE TEXAS HAVE BEEN CALLED IN TO CONDUCT THE INVESTIGATION. THE CASE WILL BE REFERRED TO THE MIDLAND COUNTY DISTRICT ATTORNEY FOR PRESENTATION TO A MIDLAND COUNTY GRAND JURY

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE; HOSTAGE/BARRICADE/OTHER EMERG SITUATION
EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON WEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 6,2019 AT 11:01 P.M. EDINBURG POLICE DEPARTMENT RECEIVED SEVERAL CALLS FROM 2904 PABLO STREET REGARDING A DOMESTIC DISTURBANCE INVOLVING A SUICIDAL MALE. INFORMATION INDICATED THAT UPON OFFICERS ARRIVAL THE SUSPECT (HUNTER CLAY ALAN) WAS HOLDING A KNIFE AGAINST HIS THROAT THREATENING TO COMMIT SUICIDE. THE OFFICERS ATTEMPTED TO DEESCALATE THE SITUATION, HOWEVER IT WAS EVIDENT THAT THE SUSPECT WAS NOT COOPERATING. TASER WAS DEPLOYED BUT HAD NO EFFECT AT WHICH TIME THE SUSPECT CHARGED AT THE OFFICERS THREATENING TO KILL THEM. TWO OFFICERS DISCHARGED THEIR DUTY WEAPONS STRIKING THE INDIVIDUAL MULTIPLE TIMES ON HIS BODY. THE SUSPECT WAS TRANSPORTED TO A LOCAL HOSPITAL WHERE HE LATER DIED FROM HIS INJURIES. IT IS BELIEVED CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 THAT THE SUSPECT SUFFERED FROM BIPOLAR DISORDER AND SCHIZOPHRENIA DISORDER AND WAS REPORTEDLY UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF MEDICATION AND ALCOHOL AT THE TIME OF THE INCIDENT. THE TEXAS RANGER OFFICE IS CONDUCTING THE INVESTIGATION AND THE FULL AUTOPSY REPORT IS PENDING.

incident_result_of: OTHER
incident_call_other: SUSPICIOUS MALE OUTSIDE OF A RESIDENCE KNOCKING ON THE DOOR.
cdr_narrative: ON THURSDAY, FEBRUARY 7, 2019, AT APPROXIMATELY 6.33PM OFFICERS WITH THE SNYDER POLICE DEPARTMENT WERE DISPATCHED TO THE 3600 BLOCK OF JACKSBORO AVE. IN SNYDER TEXAS IN REFERENCE TO A SUSPICIOUS MALE OUTSIDE OF A RESIDENCE KNOCKING ON DOORS. OFFICER MERKET WAS THE FIRST OFFICER ON THE SCENE AND MADE CONTACT WITH A WHITE MALE SUBJECT LATER IDENTIFIED AS MORGAN WEST. THE MAIL SUBJECT APPROACHED OFFICER MERKET AND BEGAN ASKING FOR HER KEYS. OFFICER MERKAT ATTEMPTED TO ASK THE MAILE SUBJECT IF HE WAS ALRIGHT, BUT BEGAN WALKING TOWARDS HER AND WANTED HER KEYS. THE MALE SUBJECT THEN ATTEMPTED TO GRAB OFFICER MERKET AND SHE HAD TO PHYSICALLY FIGHT MR. WEST OFF OF HER. SHE ALSO DEPLOYED A TASER, WITH NO EFFECT. MR. WEST CONTINUED TO MOVE TOWARDS OFFICER MERKET AND BEGAN YELLING FOR HER TO SHOT HIM. OFFICER MERKAT GAVE VERBAL COMMANDS FOR MR. WEST TO STOP COMING TOWARDS HER AND TO STOP GRABBING AT HER. OFFICER MERKAT BACKED UP ABOUT 80 FEET IN AN ATTEMPT TO STAY AWAY FROM MR. WEST. AT THAT TIME MR. WEST GRABBED AT OFFICER MERKAT AND STARTED TO PUT HIS ARMS AROUND HER NECK WITH OFFICER MERKET PULLED HER DUTY WEAPON AND FIRED TWO SHOTS AT MR. WEST. MR. WEST WAS STRUCK BY TWO GUNSHOT WOUNDS TO THE CHEST. MR. WEST DIED ON SCENE. THE INVESTIGATION HAS BEEN TURNED OVER TO THE TEXAS RANGERS FOR INVESTIGATIONS.

incident_result_of: TRAFFIC STOP
TRAFFIC STOP
HOSTAGE/BARRICADE/OTHER EMERG SITUATION
cdr_narrative: ON FEBRUARY 12, 2019, LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS WERE CONDUCTING SURVEILLANCE ON A GROUP OF INDIVIDUALS SUSPECTED OF CONDUCTING NUMEROUS AGGRAVATED ROBBERIES IN THE AREA. DURING THE SURVEILLANCE, OFFICERS OBSERVED PATRICK LEE REED, CHRISTOPHER KETREL BRIMSEY, AND ANOTHER SUSPECT ROB A WALGREEN'S PHARMACY USING A FIREARM. OFFICERS ATTEMPTED TO APPREHEND THE SUSPECTS AS THEY LEFT THE STORE. THE OFFICERS GAVE COMMANDS FOR THE SUSPECTS TO DISARM AND SURRENDER. REED AND BRIMSEY DID NOT COMPLY WITH THESE COMMANDS, AND BRIMSEY POINTED A HANDGUN AT THE OFFICERS. MULTIPLE ROUNDS WERE FIRED AT THE OFFICERS; HOWEVER, IT IS UNCLEAR WHICH SUSPECT FIRED. TWO HANDGUNS WERE LATER FOUND AT THE SCENE. ONE WAS LOCATED IN BRIMSEY'S HAND, AND IT IS UNKNOWN WHETHER REED OR THE OTHER SUSPECT WAS CARRYING OR FIRED THE OTHER HANDGUN. IN RESPONSE TO THE DEADLY THREAT, THE OFFICERS RETURNED FIRE. REED AND BRIMSEY WERE SHOT AND SUBSEQUENTLY KILLED. THE OTHER SUSPECT WAS APPREHENDED ALONG WITH ANOTHER INDIVIDUAL SUSPECTED OF DRIVING THE GETAWAY VEHICLE.

incident_call_other: SHOTS FIRED CALL BY TROOPER. SUSPECT FLED, EVADED AND FIRED ON OTHER OFFICERS.

incident_result_of: TRAFFIC STOP
cdr_narrative: ON FEBRUARY 20, 2019, CORPORAL LEE MEADOW CONDUCTED A TRAFFIC STOP ON A PICKUP TRUCK FOR NOT HAVING A FRONT LICENSE PLATE. AFTER APPROACHING THE VEHICLE TO MAKE CONTACT WITH THE DRIVER, LATER IDENTIFIED AS SHARROD CHAVEZ MOORE, THE DRIVER FIRED ONE SHOT FROM A PISTOL THROUGH THE OPEN PASSENGER SIDE WINDOW AT CORPORAL MEADOW. THE SHOT MISSED CORPORAL MEADOW. CORPORAL MEADOW DOVE OUT OF THE WAY AND RETURNED FIRE AT THE VEHICLE, STRIKING IT NINE TIMES. THE SUSPECT DROVE OFF AND A SHORT PURSUIT ENSUED. THE SUSPECT CAME TO A STOP AT A CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 ROADSIDE EXIT AND THEN TOOK HIS OWN LIFE WITH A SELF-INFLICTED GUNSHOT WOUND. IT WAS LATER DETERMINED THAT THE SUSPECT HAD COMMITTED MURDER IN EL PASO EARLIER IN THE DAY AND WAS ACTIVELY WANTED FOR CAPITAL MURDER.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON 02-22-2019, TEXAS DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY HIGHWAY PATROL TROOPER LOGAN EASTBURN WAS ON PATROL IN ATASCOSA COUNTY, TEXAS WHEN HE RESPONDED TO THE AREA OF JOURDANTON/PLEASANTON AFTER HEARING OF AN ASSAULT IN JOURDANTON. THE JOURDANTON POLICE DEPARTMENT WAS DISPATCHED TO THE ASSAULT OF A FEMALE VICTIM AND ARRIVED BEFORE TROOPER EASTBURN HAD MADE IT BACK TO THE JOURDANTON CITY LIMITS. SHORTLY AFTER THE JOURDANTON POLICE DEPARTMENT ARRIVED AT THE SCENE OF THE ASSAULT INFORMATION WAS DISPATCHED THAT THE POSSIBLE SUSPECT WAS IDENTIFIED AS FELIPE MARTINEZ JR. AND THAT HE HAD FLED THE AREA. THE ATASCOSA COUNTY SHERIFF’S OFFICE DISPATCHERS ADVISED THAT MARTINEZ WAS FROM THE POTEET, TEXAS AREA AND INFORMED OFFICERS THAT MARTINEZ COULD BE HEADED TO THAT AREA. TROOPER EASTBURN WENT TO THE AREA OF POTEET SO THAT HE COULD RESPOND IF THE POTEET POLICE DEPARTMENT REQUESTED ASSISTANCE. PRIOR TO ARRIVING IN THE POTEET AREA THE DISPATCHERS ADVISED OF A STABBING IN POTEET IN WHICH TWO VICTIMS WERE STABBED MULTIPLE TIMES. THE ADDRESS THAT WAS PROVIDED WAS ASSOCIATED WITH MARTINEZ AND WAS BELIEVED TO BE HIS RESIDENCE. THE DISPATCHERS PROVIDED A DESCRIPTION OF MARTINEZ AND STATED THAT WITNESSES IDENTIFIED THE STABBING SUSPECT AS MARTINEZ. THE JOURDANTON POLICE DEPARTMENT OFFICER THAT WAS CONDUCTING THE ASSAULT INVESTIGATION IN JOURDANTON ADVISED THAT THE VICTIM WAS MARTINEZ’S GIRLFRIEND AND THAT SHE HAD AN APP ON HER CELLPHONE THAT ALLOWED BOTH MARTINEZ AND HER TO TRACK EACH OTHER. PATROL OFFICERS RESPONDED TO SEVERAL REPORTED LOCATIONS OF MARTINEZ. WHEN THE LOCATION OF RUTLEDGE ROAD WAS PROVIDED TROOPER EASTBURN WAS CLOSE TO THE AREA AND RESPONDED. TROOPER EASTBURN LOCATED MARTINEZ LYING IN THE DITCH ALONG RUTLEDGE ROAD. TROOPER EASTBURN CONFRONTED MARTINEZ WHO STOOD UP IN THE BAR DITCH AND HAD A KNIFE IN HIS HAND. TROOPER EASTBURN PROVIDED SEVERAL COMMANDS TO MARTINEZ TO SURRENDER WHICH HE DID NOT COMPLY WITH AS HE APPROACHED TROOPER EASTBURN. AFTER MARTINEZ WALKED OUT OF THE DITCH AND ENTERED THE ROAD HE CAME TOWARDS TROOPER EASTBURN IN AN AGGRESSIVE MANNER WITH HIS KNIFE STILL IN HIS HAND. TROOPER EASTBURN FIRED A TOTAL OF FOUR SHOTS TO STOP MARTINEZ. ALL FOUR SHOTS STRUCK MARTINEZ AND HE WAS KNOCKED TO THE GROUND. TROOPER EASTBURN AND RESPONDING OFFICERS WERE ABLE TO SUBDUE MARTINEZ EVEN THOUGH HE WAS STILL ABLE TO RESIST. TROOPER EASTBURN THEN ADMINISTERED AID TO MARTINEZ. MARTINEZ WAS PRONOUNCED DECEASED AT 9:20 P.M.

incident_result_of: TRAFFIC STOP
cdr_narrative: A CARROLLTON POLICE OFFICER SHOT AND KILLED AN ARMED MAN AFTER HE ADVANCED ON OFFICERS POINTING A GUN AND REFUSED COMMANDS TO DROP IT. IT HAPPENED AT APPROXIMATELY 5:30 PM, SATURDAY, FEBRUARY 23RD, 2019 IN THE 1100 BLOCK OF WALNUT STREET IN CARROLLTON AFTER THE OFFICERS TRIED TO INITIATE A TRAFFIC STOP, LEADING TO A SHORT VEHICLE PURSUIT. THE SUSPECT, 28 YEAR OLD STERLING DURANT HUMBERT OF CARROLLTON, WAS PRONOUNCED DEAD AT PARKLAND HOSPITAL. NO OFFICERS WERE INJURED. THE INVOLVED OFFICERS WERE PLACED ON PAID ADMINISTRATIVE LEAVE DURING THE INVESTIGATION. VIDEO OF THE INCIDENT FROM BOTH DASH AND BODY CAMERAS OF THE INCIDENT ARE IN EVIDENCE.

incident_result_of: TRAFFIC STOP; OTHER
EXECUTION OF A WARRANT
cdr_narrative: ON FEBRUARY 27, 2019, AT APPROXIMATELY 6:00 AM MEMBERS OF THE KILLEEN POLICE DEPARTMENT’S TACTICAL RESPONSE UNIT EXECUTED A HIGH-RISK SEARCH AND ARREST WARRANT FOR JAMES SCOTT REED AT THE ADDRESS OF 215 W. CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 HALLMARK AVENUE, APARTMENT #A, KILLEEN. DURING THE EXECUTION OF THE WARRANT, MR. REED PRODUCED A FIREARM AND BEGAN FIRING OUT OF THE RESIDENCE AT OFFICERS. OFFICERS RETURNED FIRE, STRIKING MR. REED, WHO SUBSEQUENTLY SUCCUMBED TO HIS INJURIES.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
HOSTAGE/BARRICADE/OTHER EMERG SITUATION
incident_call_other: DOMESTIC THAT STARTED IN THE COUNTY, MOVED TO THE CITY AND SUBJECT RAMMED VICTIMS VEHICLE AND SHE WRECKED OUT, THE SUSPECT PULLED THE VICTIM OUT OF VEHICLE AND WAS THREATING TO KILL HER, SUBJECT HAD KNIFE AT VICTIMS NECK, OFFICER ADVISED SUSPECT TIME AND TIME AGAIN AND HE WOULD NOT, OFFICER TASED SUBJECT WITH NO RESPONSE, OFFICER PULLED HIS WEAPON AND KEPT TELLING TO DROP THE KNIFE AND OFFICER ENDED UP USING DEADLY FORCE.
cdr_narrative: OFFICER RECEIVED CALL THAT A DOMESTIC DISTURBANCE WHICH STARTED IN THE COUNTY WAS HEADED INTO TOWN. OFFICER DROVE UP ON A WRECK WHEN OFFICER EXITED THE VEHICLE HE REALIZED THAT IT WAS THE DOMESTIC FROM THE COUNTY. THE CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 OFFICER SAID THAT THE SUSPECT WAS DRAGGING THE FEMALE VICTIM OUT OF HER WRECKED CAR SAYING HE WAS GOING TO KILL HER, THE OFFICER SAID THAT THE SUSPECT HAD A KNIFE IN HIS HAND AND WAS HOLDING THE FEMALE, THE OFFICER SAID THAT HE OBSERVED THAT THE SUSPECT WAS MAKING JAB MOTIONS TO THE VICTIMS FACE, THE OFFICER ADVISED HIM TO PUT THE KNIFE DOWN TIME AND TIME AGAIN, THE SUSPECT REFUSED AND CONTINUED TO JAB AT THE VICTIM, THE OFFICER PULLED HIS TASER IN ATTEMPT TO STOP THE SUSPECT. THE OFFICER KEPT TELLING THE SUSPECT TO DROP THE KNIFE. THE SECOND TASER WAS ALSO USED WITH NO EFFECT. THE OFFICER THEN PULLED HIS SERVICE WEAPON AND AGAIN ORDERED THE SUSPECT TO DROP THE KNIFE. THE SUSPECT WOULD NOT DROP THE KNIFE SO THE OFFICER USED DEADLY FORCE TO STOP THE ATTACK.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON MARCH 1,2019, AT APPROXIMATELY 9:39 PM, WACO POLICE OFFICERS WERE DISPATCHED TO A LOCAL MOTEL ON IH-35, REGARDING A CIVIL DISTURBANCE INVOLVING A GUEST AT THE MOTEL. INFORMATION GIVEN TO THE OFFICERS WAS THAT THE GUEST HAD BROKEN OUT THE WINDOWS TO HIS ROOM AND WAS OUTSIDE WITH A KNIFE AND ATTEMPTING TO GAIN ENTRY INTO ANOTHER ROOM THAT WAS OCCUPIED. MANAGEMENT AND MAINTENANCE PERSONNEL HAD APPROACHED THE GUEST PRIOR TO CALLING THE POLICE AND ASKED HIM TO LEAVE THE PROPERTY BUT HE REFUSED. MANAGEMENT IDENTIFIED THE GUEST AS A WHITE MALE, KYLE ASHMORE. THE PRIMARY OFFICER ARRIVED ON SCENE AT 9:46 PM AND DUE TO THE ERRATIC BEHAVIOR OF MR. ASHMORE, THE OFFICER HAD TO APPROACH HIM AND ATTEMPT TO GET HIM TO DROP THE KNIFE AND TO CALM DOWN. HE WAS STILL OUTSIDE THE MOTEL AND FOR THE SECOND TIME HE HAD ATTEMPTED TO GAIN ENTRY INTO ANOTHER ROOM BY USING HIS KNIFE TO PRY OPEN THE DOOR. AS THE OFFICER WAS GIVING COMMANDS TO MR. ASHMORE TO DROP THE KNIFE AND GET DOWN ON THE GROUND, MR. ASHMORE TOOK OFF RUNNING INTO A PUBLIC ROADWAY (1400 BLOCK OF SPEIGHT AVENUE). A MAINTENANCE EMPLOYEE FROM THE MOTEL SUDDENLY GAVE CHASE AND CAUGHT UP WITH MR. ASHMORE AFTER HE HAD STOPPED A CAR AND WAS ATTEMPTING TO OPEN ONE OF THE BACK DOORS TO THE VEHICLE. THE CAR WAS OCCUPIED BY TWO ADULTS, AND CHILDREN WHO WERE IN THE BACK SEAT. THE MAINTENANCE EMPLOYEE GRABBED MR. ASHMORE TO KEEP HIM FROM GAINING ACCESS TO THE CHILDREN AND WAS TRYING TO THROW HIM TO THE GROUND. MR. ASHMORE IMMEDIATELY BEGAN TO STAB THE MAINTENANCE EMPLOYEE WITH THE KNIFE, CAUSING MULTIPLE STAB WOUNDS TO HIS HEAD AND UPPER TORSO. THE OFFICER HAD JUST CAUGHT UP TO THEM, YELLING FOR MR. ASHMORE TO DROP THE KNIFE AND FOR THE EMPLOYEE TO GET AWAY FROM MR. ASHMORE. MR. ASHMORE CONTINUED TO STAB THE EMPLOYEE AND THE OFFICER FIRED HER SERVICE WEAPON AT MR. ASHMORE, TO STOP HIS DEADLY ASSAULT ON ANOTHER. MR. ASHMORE RELEASED HIS GRIP ON THE EMPLOYEE AND FELL TO THE GROUND. OFFICERS WHO HAD ARRIVED ON SCENE BEGAN LIFE SAVING EMERGENCY CARE FOR MR. ASHMORE, UNTIL PARAMEDICS ARRIVED AND HE WAS TRANSPORTED TO A LOCAL HOSPITAL BY AMBULANCE. HE WAS PRONOUNCED DECEASED AT 10:27 PM. THE MOTEL EMPLOYEE SUFFERED LIFE THREATENING WOUNDS AND WAS TAKEN TO A LOCAL HOSPITAL WHERE HE WAS ADMITTED AND UNDERWENT SURGERY. HIS CONDITION IMPROVED AFTER A COUPLE DAYS AND HE IS EXPECTED TO RECOVER. THE INVESTIGATION REVEALED EVIDENCE OF NARCOTICS AND/OR NARCOTICS USE IN MR. ASHMORE'S MOTEL ROOM. THE KNIFE THAT THE USED AT THE MOTEL AND TO CRITICALLY INJURE THE MOTEL EMPLOYEE, WAS ALSO RECOVERED AT THE SHOOTING SCENE. IT WAS LEARNED THAT MR. ASHMORE HAS SUFFERED FROM SCHIZOPHRENIA AND BI-POLAR DISORDER FOR MANY YEARS. FAMILY MEMBERS REVEALED THAT WHEN HE IS NOT TAKING HIS MEDICATIONS, HE WILL HALLUCINATE AND WILL SEE AND HEAR THINGS THAT ARE NOT VISIBLE TO OTHER PEOPLE; AS WELL AS BELIEVING THAT HE HAS BEEN SELECTED TO LOCATE AND DESTROY EVIL.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative:
THE MOTHER OF THE ACTOR CALLED POLICE STATING THAT HER SON IS BI-POLAR AND SCHIZOPHRENIC AND IS OFF HIS
MEDICATIONS. SHE WENT ON TO SAY THAT HE WAS HAVING AUDITORY HALLUCINATIONS, THROWING ITEMS, AND BREAKING
DOORS INSIDE THE RESIDENCE. TWO OFFICERS ARRIVED TO THE LOCATION AND BEGAN TO ASSESS THE ACTOR'S CONDITION AS
HE WAS BACKED INTO A CORNER OF A BEDROOM. THE ACTOR WAS INSTRUCTED TO SHOW HIS HANDS AND DID SO BUT WOULD
NOT MOVE FROM THE CORNER. A DECISION WAS MADE TO ARREST THE ACTOR ON MUNICIPAL COURT WARRANTS. AS OFFICERS
WALKED TOWARDS THE ACTOR, HE RAISED A SHOTGUN FROM BEHIND HIM. HE FIRED THE SHOTGUN AT THE OFFICERS. A
SERGEANT THAT WAS THERE TO ASSIST THE OFFICERS RETURNED FIRE. THE ACTOR WAS STRUCK AND FELL TO THE GROUND.
OFFICERS SECURED THE ACTOR'S SHOTGUN ALONG WITH ANOTHER ASSAULT RIFLE THAT WAS IN CLOSE PROXIMITY. MEDICAL
ATTENTION WAS RENDERED BY THE OFFICERS AND EMS WAS REQUESTED. THE ACTOR WAS TRANSPORTED TO A LEVEL 1
TRAUMA HOSPITAL WHERE HE WAS PRONOUNCED DEAD.

incident_result_of: OTHER
cdr_narrative: ON 3/4/2019 AT APPROXIMATELY 1358 HOURS, A CALL WAS RECEIVED FOR A SHOOTING IN PROGRESS ON IOWA STREET AT SPRUCE STREET. WHEN OFFICERS ARRIVED, THEY DISCOVERED AN AGGRAVATED ROBBERY HAD TAKEN PLACE WITH A VICTIM BEING SHOT IN THE LEG. A DESCRIPTION OF THE SUSPECT VEHICLE WAS OBTAINED AND BROADCASTED TO OTHER OFFICERS. THE SUSPECT VEHICLE WAS DESCRIBED AS A SMALL BLACK CAR OCCUPIED BY A FEMALE, MALE, AND SMALL CHILD. A PATROL UNIT WITH UNIFORMED POLICE OFFICERS USING CALL SIGN 7780 BEGAN ASSISTING WITH THE SEARCH FOR THE SUSPECT VEHICLE AND ENCOUNTERED IT ON NEW BRAUNFELS NEAR I-10. 7780 FOLLOWED THE SUSPECT VEHICLE WHICH WAS A BLACK HONDA CIVIC. 7780 FOUND THERE WAS A BOLO FOR A FEMALE ROBBERY SUSPECT ATTACHED TO THE LICENSE PLATE ON THE BLACK HONDA CIVIC WHEN IT WAS CHECKED ON TLETS. 7780 BELIEVED THE BLACK HONDA CIVIC WAS THE SUSPECT VEHICLE IN THE AGGRAVATED ROBBERY SO THEY ACTIVATED THEIR EMERGENCY LIGHTS TO INITIATE A FELONY STOP. THE BLACK HONDA CIVIC APPEARED TO BE EVADING BUT ABRUPTLY STOPPED WHEN IT REACHED THE INTERSECTION OF 1500 S. OLIVE AT 400 WESTFALL AVE. 7780 HAD NOTIFIED THE DISPATCHER AND REQUESTED HELICOPTER SUPPORT. THE POLICE HELICOPTER WAS CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 OVERHEAD WHEN THE SUSPECT VEHICLE STOPPED. 7780 SAW THE FRONT SEAT PASSENGER EXITING THE SUSPECT VEHICLE SO THEY BEGAN TO EXIT THEIR PATROL VEHICLE. THE PERSON WHO EXITED THE SUSPECT VEHICLE WAS LATER IDENTIFIED AS THE LISTED DECEDENT. THE DECEDENT TOOK A FEW STEPS THEN BEGAN SHOOTING AT THE OFFICERS. FEARING FOR THEIR LIVES AND BELIEVING THERE WERE OTHER PEOPLE INSIDE THE SUSPECT VEHICLE, THE OFFICERS BEGAN TO RETURN FIRE. THE GUNSHOTS FIRED BY THE DECEDENT AT THE OFFICERS STRUCK THE PATROL VEHICLE. ONE SHOT HIT THE FRONT PASSENGER DOOR WHERE ONE OFFICER EXITED AND THE WINDSHIELD IN FRONT OF WHERE THE SAME OFFICER HAD BEEN SITTING. A THIRD SHOT HIT THE SPOTLIGHT NEAR THE DRIVER’S DOOR WHERE THE OTHER OFFICER WAS STANDING AFTER EXITING THE PATROL VEHICLE. IT WAS OBVIOUS THE DECEDENT WAS TRYING TO SHOOT THE OFFICERS IN AN ATTEMPT TO COMMIT CAPITAL MURDER. THE OFFICERS WERE ABLE TO EFFECTIVELY RETURN FIRE AND ULTIMATELY STOPPED THE DECEDENT'S ACTIONS. THE DECEDENT WAS TRANSPORTED TO A LOCAL HOSPITAL BY EMS WHERE HE WAS PRONOUNCED DECEASED AT 1454 HOURS.

DEPUTY ENCOUNTERED SUBJECT, WHO ADVANCED TOWARDS THE DEPUTY WITH A LARGE KNIFE IN HIS HAND. THE SUBJECT KEPT ADVANCING TOWARDS THE OFFICER WHO FIRED SHOTS AT THE SUBJECT AND RENDERED HIM DECEASED.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON MARCH 09, 2019 AT APPROXIMATELY 8:30 AM MONAHANS POLICE DEPARTMENT COMMUNICATIONS RECEIVED A CALL ADVISING OF A MALE SUSPECT DISCHARGING A FIREARM IN THE AREA OF 700 BLOCK OF N. BRUCE. OFFICERS WERE DISPATCHED TO THE AREA, OFFICER DIAZ LOCATED THE SUSPECT WALKING NEAR A STREET AND NORTH ALLEN. OFFICER DIAZ CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 ATTEMPTED TO MAKE CONTACT WITH THE SUSPECT, THE SUSPECT DISCHARGED A FIREARM TOWARDS OFFICER DIAZ STRIKING THE DRIVER SIDE DOOR OF OFFICER DIAZ' PATROL UNIT. THE SUSPECT FLED ON FOOT NORTH BOUND, A WARD COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE PATROL UNIT OCCUPYING TWO DEPUTIES LOCATED THE SUSPECT ON EAST B STREET AND N. BRUCE. THE SUSPECT DISCHARGED A FIREARM TOWARDS THE WCSO DEPUTIES, STRIKING THEIR PATROL UNIT TWICE. THE SUSPECT THEN FLED SOUTH BOUND IN THE ALLEY WAY WHERE HE ENGAGED SERGEANT ANDINO OF THE MONAHANS POLICE DEPARTMENT. SERGEANT ANDINO DISCHARGED HIS DEPARTMENT ISSUED M4 RIFLE AT THE SUSPECT. SGT. ANDINO NEUTRALIZED THE SUSPECTS THREATS BY STRIKING THE SUSPECT. THE SUSPECT HAD TWO FIREARMS IN HIS POSSESSION, ONE IN EACH HAND WHEN HE ENGAGED SGT. ANDINO.

officer_caused_injury_2: ON-SITE OBSERVATION OF CRIME OF VIOLENCE.
cdr_narrative: ON 3/17/2019, SEVERAL ON-DUTY AUSTIN POLICE OFFICERS WERE WORKING IN THE DOWNTOWN AREA FOR THE SXSW MUSIC FESTIVAL. AT APPROXIMATELY 2:50AM, TWO CIVILIAN VEHICLES APPROACHED THE RED LIGHT LOCATED AT THE INTERSECTION OF E. 7TH STREET AND THE SERVICE ROAD OF IH 35 SOUTHBOUND, IN AUSTIN, TRAVIS COUNTY, TEXAS. MINUTES PRIOR, THESE SAME TWO VEHICLES WERE INVOLVED IN A MINOR COLLISION WITH ONE ANOTHER AT 7TH ST/ NECHES ST. ONE OF THE VEHICLES WAS A BLACK MASERATI. THE OTHER VEHICLE WAS A BLACK CHEVROLET. WHEN THE VEHICLES STOPPED AT THE RED LIGHT, TWO OCCUPANTS OF THE MASERATI GOT OUT OF THEIR VEHICLE AND APPROACHED THE DRIVER'S SIDE OF THE CHEVROLET. AFTER A BRIEF CONVERSATION, ONE OF THE OCCUPANTS THAT HAD EXITED THE MASERATI, BEGAN STRIKING THE DRIVER OF THE CHEVROLET WITH A CLOSED FIST, FROM OUTSIDE OF THE VEHICLE. THE DRIVER OF THE CHEVROLET THEN BEGAN FIRING A FIREARM OUT OF THE DRIVER'S SIDE WINDOW OF THE CHEVROLET IN THE DIRECTION OF THE TWO INDIVIDUALS WHO HAD APPROACHED FROM THE MASERATI. THE DRIVER OF THE MASERATI FLED BACK TO THE DRIVER'S SEAT OF THE MASERATI. THE OTHER PASSENGER OF THE MASERATI RAN AROUND THE FRONT OF THE MASERATI AND DISPLAYED A FIREARM, THEN FIRED UPON APPROACHING POLICE OFFICERS, AND GOT INTO THE BACKSEAT OF MASERATI. MULTIPLE OFFICERS RETURNED FIRE ON THE SUBJECT WHO FIRED UPON THEM. BOTH VEHICLES THEN FLED FROM THE SCENE EASTBOUND ON 7TH STREET. AT APPROXIMATELY 12PM ON 3/17/2019, THE BLACK MASERATI WAS LOCATED IN THE 4200 BLK OF TILLEY. THE DECEDENT WAS DISCOVERED IN THE BACKSEAT OF THE VEHICLE APPARENTLY DECEASED. THE DECEDENT WAS PRONOUNCED DECEASED AT 12:13PM.

incident_result_of: OTHER
cdr_narrative: ON MARCH 27, 2019 AT APPROX. 1:40A.M.; BURNET PD RESPONDED TO THE 300BLK OF SOUTH MCNEIL WITHIN THE CITY LIMITS OF BURNET, TX IN REFERENCE TO A LOUD MUSIC COMPLAINT. OFFICER ARRIVED AND OBSERVED A VEHICLE STARTING TO BACK UP FROM A PARKED POSITION IN FRONT OF A RESIDENCE. OFFICER GAVE COMMANDS TO STOP, SAID VEHICLE PLACED VEHICLE IN DRIVE AND STARTED TO DRIVE FORWARD AT A VERY LOW RATE OF SPEED. OFFICER FELT THAT THE VEHICLE WAS COMING TOWARDS HIM, AND STARTED GIVING VERBAL COMMANDS TO STOP, THE VEHICLE CONTINUED TO DRIVE FORWARD. OFFICER FELT HE WAS IN DANGER AND SHOT HIS DUTY WEAPON THREE TIMES INTO THE WINDSHIELD OF SAID VEHICLE, STRIKING THE DRIVER THREE TIMES IN THE CHEST AREA. THE DRIVER WAS PRONOUNCED AT THE SCENE, AND LATER TRANSPORTED TO THE TRAVIS COUNTY ME'S OFFICE IN AUSTIN TEXAS. THE TEXAS RANGERS WERE CALLED TO THE SCENE AND WILL BE CONDUCTING AN INVESTIGATION.

incident_result_of: TRAFFIC STOP
cdr_narrative: ON MARCH 27, 2019, AT 4:16 P.M., A TEXAS HIGHWAY PATROL TROOPER, ALONG WITH A DPS SPECIAL AGENT, ATTEMPTED TO STOP A 2006 CHEVROLET PICKUP FOR FAILING TO SIGNAL A TURN IN LEVELLAND, TEXAS. THE DRIVER, LATER IDENTIFIED AS LEONARDO GALLEGOS JR., FAILED TO STOP, AND A PURSUIT ENSUED. CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 THE PURSUIT LASTED APPROXIMATELY TWO HOURS AND SIX MINUTES. DURING THIS TIME, ASSISTING OFFICERS SUCCESSFULLY DEPLOYED SPIKES STRIPS, DEFLATING THE FLEEING VEHICLE'S TWO FRONT TIRES. GALLEGOS, HOWEVER, CONTINUED TO EVADE AND ULTIMATELY LED APPROXIMATELY TEN TEXAS HIGHWAY PATROL UNITS AND ONE HOCKLEY COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE UNIT INTO A FIELD OFF OF FM 1337 BETWEEN WHITEFACE AND MORTON, TEXAS. WHILE DRIVING THROUGH THE FIELD, GALLEGOS FIRED A SAWED-OFF SHOTGUN AT THE PURSUING OFFICERS. NINE TROOPERS AND THE SPECIAL AGENT RETURNED FIRE, STRIKING GALLEGOS FOUR TIMES. THE OFFICERS IMMEDIATELY PULLED GALLEGOS FROM THE VEHICLE, BUT THEY FOUND NO PULSE. THEY ATTEMPTED LIFESAVING MEASURES WITHOUT SUCCESS. GALLEGOS WAS LATER PRONOUNCED DECEASED BY A COCHRAN COUNTY JUSTICE OF THE PEACE.

incident_result_of: TRAFFIC STOP
cdr_narrative: THE OFFICER SHOT THE DECEDENT, AUGUSTINE GUTIERREZ, AFTER A LENGTHY CHASE INVOLVING DPS TROOPERS AND SAN ANTONIO POLICE THAT STARED IN SAN ANTONIO, TEXAS. THE DECEDENT, AUGUSTINE GUTIERREZ, CRASHED THE STOLEN VEHICLE HE WAS DRIVING (BLACK, ACURA, ILX, 4-DR, TX LIC LNS7628) INTO THE BACK OF A GUADALUPE COUNTY CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 SHERIFF’S VEHICLE THAT WAS PARKED ON THE RIGHT SHOULDER OF THE HIGHWAY AT IH 10 E AND FM 464 NEAR SEGUIN, TEXAS. THE CRASH RENDERED THE VEHICLE DISABLED. AT THAT TIME, DPS TROOPERS AND SAN ANTONIO POLICE ATTEMPTED TO GET THE DECEDENT, AUGUSTINE GUTIERREZ, OUT OF HIS VEHICLE BY GIVING HIM VERBAL COMMANDS, DEPLOYING A TASER, AND REMOVING HIM BY HAND WHEN THE TASER PROVED INEFFECTIVE. OFFICERS OBSERVED A HANDGUN IN THE DECEDENT'S, AUGUSTINE GUTIERREZ, LAP AND TOLD HIM NOT TO REACH FOR IT. THE DECEDENT, AUGUSTINE GUTIERREZ, TOLD THE OFFICERS HE DID NOT WANT TO HURT THEM BUT BEGGED THEM TO KILL HIM. THE DECEDENT, AUGUSTINE GUTIERREZ, REACHED FOR THE HANDGUN CAUSING A SAN ANTONIO POLICE OFFICER TO FIRE HIS WEAPON AT THE DECEDENT, AUGUSTINE GUTIERREZ, ONCE STRIKING HIM IN THE CHEST. THE DECEDENT, AUGUSTINE GUTIERREZ WAS TRANSPORTED TO GUADALUPE COUNTY REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER WHERE HE DIED SOON AFTER ARRIVAL.

incident_result_of: TRAFFIC STOP
cdr_narrative: ON APRIL 11, 2019, TROOPER JESSE PEREZ STOPPED A VEHICLE ON INTERSTATE 10 IN KENDALL COUNTY FOR A TRAFFIC VIOLATION. THE VEHICLE CONTAINED THE DRIVER, LATER IDENTIFIED AS MARCUS WILEY JAMAL WES MCVAE, AND A FEMALE PASSENGER. WHILE BEING QUESTIONED, MCVAE FALSELY IDENTIFIED HIMSELF TO TROOPER PEREZ. TROOPER PEREZ ATTEMPTED TO PLACE HANDCUFFS ON MCVAE WHEN MCVAE FLED ON FOOT. MVVAE RAN ACROSS TWO LANES OF TRAFFIC AND INTO A BRUSHY AREA OFF THE SIDE OF THE ROAD. TROOPER PEREZ INITIALLY PURSUED MCVAE IN HIS PATROL CAR. ONCE MCVAE LEFT THE INTERSTATE, TROOPER PEREZ CHASED HIM ON FOOT. TROOPER PEREZ CAUGHT UP TO MCVAE AND ATTEMPTED TO DETAIN HIM. MCVAE RESISTED ARREST AND REFUSED TO SURRENDER. TROOPER PEREZ ATTEMPTED TO USE HIS TASER, BUT IT WAS INEFFECTIVE. MCVAE THEN PICKED UP A LARGE ROCK AND ATTEMPTED TO STRIKE TROOPER PEREZ WITH IT. TROOPER PEREZ DISCHARGED HIS HANDGUN, STRIKING MCVAE AND KILLING HIM.

incident_result_of: HOSTAGE/BARRICADE/OTHER EMERG SITUATION
incident_call_other: THE DECEASED HAD JUST ASSAULTED HIS WIFE, SHOT AND KILLED HIS NEIGHBOR AND SET HIS HOUSE ON FIRE. OFFICERS WERE DISPATCHED TO THE LOCATION FOR THE ABOVE REPORTED SITUATION.THE DECEASED WAS ALSO FIRING HIS WEAPON AT OFFICERS UPON THEIR ARRIVAL. A PERIMETER WAS SET UP AROUND THE DECEASED LOCATION AND THE SWAT TEAM WAS NOTIFIED. IN RESPONSE TO THE ABOVE LISTED SWAT MADE THE LOCATION AND TOOK UP POSITIONS TO PROTECT THE PUBLIC. THE DECEASED WAS SET UP ON THE FRONT PORCH WITH A LONG GUN UTILIZING FURNITURE AS CONCEALMENT. AS THE RESIDENCE BECAME FULLY ENGULFED, A SWAT TEAM MEMBER OBTAINED A CLEAR LINE OF SIGHT ON THE DECEASED LOWER EXTREMITIES AND FIRED TWO (2) SHOTS TO NEUTRALIZE THE THREAT.
cdr_narrative: IT WAS REPORTED TO THE POLICE THAT THE DECEASED WAS ASSAULTING HIS WIFE IN PLAIN VIEW. IT WAS ALSO REPORTED THAT THE DECEASED THREATENED TO KILL OFFICERS AND SET HIS RESIDENCE ON FIRE. AS OFFICERS BEGAN TO ARRIVE ON SCENE THE DECEASED FIRED AT OFFICERS AND STRUCK A CIVILIAN BY-STANDER. THE CIVILIAN BY-STANDER DIED AT THE SCENE. OFFICERS SET UP A CONTAINMENT PERIMETER AND NOTIFIED SWAT. THE DECEASED HAD SET HIS RESIDENCE ON FIRE AND TOOK A POSITION ON HIS FRONT PORCH USING FURNITURE AS CONCEALMENT. THE DECEASED HAD A LONG GUN AND CONTINUED TO FIRE RANDOMLY IN THE DIRECTION OF OFFICERS. AT SOME POINT IT'S BELIEVED THE DECEASED SHOT HIMSELF IN THE HEAD BECAUSE THE FIRE WAS TOO HOT FOR A CONSCIOUS PERSON TO TOLERATE AND HE MADE NO ATTEMPT TO MOVE AWAY FROM THE FIRE. THE SWAT OFFICER FIRED (2) TWO ROUNDS AT THE DECEASED'S LOWER EXTREMITIES (TO NEUTRALIZE THE THREAT) WHICH IS ALL HE HAD ACCESS TO AND IT DID NOT PROVOKE A RESPONSE. IT IS BELIEVED HE WAS DECEASED PRIOR TO THE OFFICERS ACTIONS. THE DECEASED WAS BURNED BEYOND RECOGNITION AND WAS LATER IDENTIFIED BY DENTAL RECORDS.

EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON 4/28/19, TWO SUBJECTS WERE TRAVELLING SOUTH BOUND IN A LAND ROVER ON NORTH CAPITAL OF TEXAS HWY. AS THE DRIVER AND VICTIM TRAVELLED IN THE SOUTH BOUND LANES THEY STOPPED AT THE RED LIGHT AT COURTYARD DR. WHILE STOPPED AT THE RED LIGHT, THE VICTIM WAS FEARFUL OF THE DRIVER AND EXITED THE VEHICLE. THE VICTIM QUICKLY ENTERED ANOTHER VEHICLE (AUDI) AT THE STOP LIGHT AND STARTED SCREAMING FOR HELP. ONCE THE LIGHT TURNED GREEN, THE AUDI AND THE RANGE ROVER BEGAN TO ACCELERATE SOUTH BOUND THROUGH THE INTERSECTION. THE SUBJECT DRIVING THE RANGE ROVER ATTEMPTED TO SIDE SWIPE OR INTENTIONALLY COLLIDE WITH THE AUDI. THE DRIVER OF THE AUDI PULLED THE VEHICLE OVER TO THE SHOULDER OF THE ROAD. AS THE VICTIM EXITED THE AUDI AND ATTEMPTED TO ENTER ANOTHER VEHICLE, THE DRIVER OF THE RANGE ROVER TURNED AROUND THE VEHICLE AND STARTED DRIVING NORTH BOUND IN THE SOUTH BOUND LANES. THE RANGE ROVER ACCELERATED AND THEN INTENTIONALLY COLLIDED WITH SEVERAL VEHICLES WHICH RESULTED IN ONE OF THE VEHICLES STRIKING THE VICTIM CAUSING BODILY INJURY. THE VICTIM CONTINUED TO BE IN FEAR OF THE DRIVER OF THE RANGE ROVER AND ATTEMPTED TO RUN AWAY AND GET INTO ANOTHER VEHICLE. THE DRIVER OF THE RANGE ROVER RAN AFTER THE VICTIM AND GRABBED THE VICTIM PHYSICALLY TRYING TO PULL THE VICTIM AWAY. SEVERAL CITIZENS WHO WITNESSED THE EVENT ATTEMPTED TO HELP THE VICTIM AND RESTRAIN THE DRIVER OF THE RANGE ROVER. THE DRIVER OF THE CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 RANGE ROVER WAS EVENTUALLY ABLE TO FLEE THE SCENE AND RAN AWAY ON FOOT INTO A NEARBY WOODED AREA. ONE OF THE WITNESSES TO THE INCIDENT WAS ABLE TO RUN AFTER THE SUBJECT AND OBSERVED THE AREA OF THE WOODS THE SUBJECT RAN INTO. AUSTIN POLICE OFFICERS LATER ARRIVED AT THE SCENE AND AIR AND K-9 UNITS WERE CALLED IN TO SEARCH FOR THE SUBJECT. WHILE CONDUCTING THEIR SEARCH, AUSTIN POLICE OFFICERS LOCATED AND OBSERVED THE DRIVER OF THE RANGE ROVER IN THE WOODS AND BEGAN TO GIVE HIM VERBAL COMMANDS. OFFICERS GAVE VERBAL COMMANDS SUCH AS, LET ME SEE YOUR HANDS AND DROP THE WEAPON. THE SUBJECT DID NOT OBEY VERBAL COMMANDS AND TOLD THE OFFICERS HE HAD A GUN AND WOULD SHOOT THEM. AN OFFICER OBSERVED THE SUBJECT WITH WHAT APPEARED TO BE AN OBJECT IN HIS HAND AND BELIEVED IT TO BE A FIREARM. THE OFFICER ANNOUNCED OUT LOUD THAT THE SUBJECT HAS A GUN SEVERAL TIMES. THE OFFICERS THEN GAVE MORE VERBAL COMMANDS FOR THE SUBJECT TO DROP THE GUN. THE SUBJECT CONTINUED TO NOT COMPLY WITH THE VERBAL COMMANDS. AN OFFICER OBSERVED THE SUBJECT RAISE A HAND AND EXTEND THE HAND OUT AS IF POINTING A FIREARM. ANOTHER OFFICER SAW RAPID, SUDDEN MOVEMENT FROM THE TORSO OF THE SUBJECT AGAINST THE COMMANDS THAT WERE BEING GIVEN. THE OFFICERS FEARING FOR THEIR LIFE AND SAFETY OF EACH OTHER, FIRED THEIR WEAPONS AT THE SUBJECT. THE OFFICERS ADMINISTERED FIRST AID TO THE SUBJECT WHO WAS TRANSPORTED TO THE HOSPITAL. THE SUBJECT WAS PRONOUNCED DECEASED AT 6:58 PM.

incident_result_of: OTHER
OTHER
incident_call_other: A MOTOR VEHICLE PURSUIT ENDED IN A STANDOFF.
cdr_narrative: THE OFFICER, IN UNIFORM AND DRIVING A MARKED POLICE VEHICLE, UTILIZED HIS OVERHEAD LIGHTS AND ATTEMPTED TO MAKE A TRAFFIC STOP ON THE DECEDENT'S VEHICLE FOR A TRAFFIC VIOLATION. THE DECEDENT FAILED TO YIELD AND BEGAN TO EVADE CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 THE OFFICER, ATTEMPTING TO FLEE AT HIGH SPEEDS. THE VEHICLE PURSUIT WENT THROUGH PARTS OF DALLAS, COCKRELL HILL, DUNCANVILLE, AND ENDED IN CEDAR HILL AT 101 S. HWY 67 IN A BUSINESS PARKING LOT. THREE OTHER GRAND PRAIRIE POLICE OFFICERS HAD JOINED THE PURSUIT AS BACK UP OFFICERS. THE OFFICERS SURROUNDED THE DECEDENT'S VEHICLE AND BEGAN GIVING COMMANDS FOR HIM TO EXIT THE VEHICLE AND SURRENDER. THE DECEDENT REFUSED TO COMPLY WITH THE ORDERS. HE DISPLAYED A PISTOL AND POINTED IT AT HIS HEAD. THE DECEDENT WAS MOVING AROUND IN THE DRIVER SEAT AND NOT COMPLYING WITH COMMANDS TO DROP THE PISTOL. THE VEHICLE WINDOWS WERE ROLLED UP AND THERE WAS NO TWO WAY COMMUNICATION, ONLY THE OFFICERS GIVING COMMANDS TO DROP THE PISTOL AND SURRENDER. APPROXIMATELY FOUR (4) MINUTES AFTER DISPLAYING THE PISTOL, THE DECEDENT MADE A FURTIVE MOVEMENT, SUDDENLY TURNING HIS HEAD AND UPPER BODY TO HIS RIGHT AS IF TO POINT HIS PISTOL AT THE POLICE VEHICLE BEHIND HIM. THE OFFICER WHO INITIATED THE PURSUIT AND WHO WAS POSITIONED FACING THE DRIVER DOOR, DISCHARGED HIS DUTY PISTOL AND STRUCK THE DECEDENT.

incident_result_of: EXECUTION OF A WARRANT
cdr_narrative: OFFICER AND DECEASED LIVED IN THE SAME APARTMENT COMPLEX. OFFICER KNEW THE DECEASED BY NAME AND SIGHT. ON THE NIGHT OF THE INCIDENT OFFICER SAW THE DECEASED WALKING INSIDE THE APARTMENT COMPLEX AND THE OFFICER CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 HAD PREVIOUS KNOWLEDGE OF ARREST WARRANTS FOR THE DECEASED. THE OFFICER MADE CONTACT AND ATTEMPTED TO TAKE THE DECEASED INTO CUSTODY. THE DECEASED RESISTED ARREST. IT WAS THEN THE OFFICER USED HIS DEPARTMENT ISSUED TASER ON THE DECEASED WITHOUT AFFECT. DURING A STRUGGLE, THE DECEASED TOOK AWAY THE OFFICER'S TASER WEAPON AND USED IT ON HIM. THE OFFICER DREW HIS DEPARTMENT ISSUED FIREARM AND SHOT THE DECEASED.

incident_call_other: CALL OF A WELFARE CONCERN WITH A SUBJECT THAT WAS POSSIBLY SUICIDAL. ORIGINALLY DISPATCHED TO THE NEW BOSTON POLICE DEPARTMENT WHO RESPONDED AND CALLED FOR ASSISTANCE AFTER SUBJECT DISCHARGED A FIREARM AT THEM
officer_caused_injury_2: WELFARE CHECK ON A POSSIBLE SUICIDAL PERSON CALLED IN BY THIRD PARTY. BECAME BARRICADED SUBJECT AFTER SHOT WAS FIRED AND SHE RAN INTO THE HOME, WITHIN MINUTES OF OFFICER ARRIVAL.
cdr_narrative: ON 05/16/2019 AT 11:04 P.M. OFFICERS WERE DISPATCHED TO THE 219 N. CENTER, NEW BOSTON, TX 75570 ON A WELFARE CHECK FOR A POSSIBLE SUICIDAL PERSON. WHEN OFFICERS ARRIVED A WHITE FEMALE EXITED THE RESIDENCE AND FIRED A GUN AT OFFICERS. ADDITIONAL OFFICERS WERE DISPATCHED TO THE AREA, WHERE MORE SHOTS WERE FIRED FROM THE WHITE FEMALE. CRISIS NEGOTIATORS FROM THE BOWIE COUNTY SHERIFF WERE CALLED TO TALK WITH THE WOMAN, WHO WAS NOW REFUSING TO COME OUT OF HER HOME. AT APPROXIMATELY 00:51 HOURS THE WOMAN EXITED HER HOME AND ADVANCED TOWARD OFFICERS WITH A HANDGUN. SHE FIRED A SHOT TOWARD OFFICERS. OFFICERS RETURNED FIRE, WHICH CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 RESULTED IN THE DEATH OF THE WHITE FEMALE. TEXAS RANGER JOSH MASON PROCESSED THE SCENE. NEW BOSTON CASE NUMBER NB19-1566.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON MAY 16, 2019, TROOPER ANDREW FAGLIE AND DEPUTIES FROM THE VAN ZANDT COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE RESPONDED TO A CALL FOR ASSISTANCE FROM 341 VAN ZANDT COUNTY ROAD 4710 IN BEN WHEELER, TEXAS. WHILE OFFICERS WERE RESPONDING TO THE SCENE, SEVERAL 911 CALLS WERE RECEIVED STATING SHOTS HAD BEEN FIRED BY THE SUSPECT, FERNANDO RUIZ. IT WAS LATER DETERMINED THAT RUIZ SHOT AT TWO PEOPLE, STRIKING ONE OF THEM. UPON ARRIVAL, OFFICERS INSTRUCTED RUIZ TO EXIT THE HOUSE, BUT HE DID NOT COMPLY. ONE OF THE DEPUTIES APPROACHED THE HOUSE AND SAW RUIZ STANDING OUTSIDE HOLDING A HANDGUN. RUIZ YELLED AT THE DEPUTY, THREATENING TO KILL HIM. AT 12:27 A.M., RUIZ CAME FROM BEHIND THE HOUSE AND FIRED A SHOT THAT FATALLY WOUNDED HIS FATHER, ISMAEL LUGO-CERVANTEZ. CERVANTEZ COLLAPSED ON THE DRIVEWAY. RUIZ THEN FIRED ANOTHER ROUND AT THE OFFICERS. TROOPER FAGLIE RETURNED FIRE, AND RUIZ RETREATED TO THE REAR OF THE HOUSE, OUT OF SIGHT, AND DID NOT RESPOND TO THE OFFICERS' REPEATED CALLS. AFTER BACKUP ARRIVED, THE OFFICERS APPROACHED RUIZ'S LOCATION AND FOUND THAT HE HAD A GUNSHOT WOUND TO THE CHEST AND APPEARED TO BE DECEASED. AT 3:32 A.M., JUSTICE OF THE PEACE SCOTT SHINN PRONOUNCED RUIZ DEAD.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
officer_caused_injury_2: WELFARE CHECK ON A POSSIBLE SUICIDAL PERSON CALLED IN BY THIRD PARTY. BECAME BARRICADED SUBJECT AFTER SHOT WAS FIRED AND SHE RAN INTO THE HOME, WITHIN MINUTES OF OFFICER ARRIVAL.
cdr_narrative: ON THURSDAY, MAY 16, 2019, AT APPROXIMATELY 11:04 PM, THE NEW BOSTON POLICE WERE DISPATCHED TO THE 200 BLOCK OF NORTH CENTER STREET IN NEW BOSTON ABOUT A POSSIBLE SUICIDAL PERSON. WHEN OFFICERS ARRIVED ON SCENE, A FEMALE, LATER IDENTIFIED AS ELIZABETH ANN HARRIS, EXITED A RESIDENCE AND FIRED A GUN AT OFFICERS. AS ADDITIONAL CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 OFFICERS ARRIVED ON SCENE, INCLUDING TROOPER STEVE VERMILLION, THEY WERE ALSO MET WITH GUNFIRE. HARRIS THEN RETREATED BACK INTO THE RESIDENCE. CRISIS NEGOTIATORS FROM THE BOWIE COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE WERE CALLED TO ASSIST. AFTER APPROXIMATELY TWO HOURS, HARRIS EXITED THE RESIDENCE, CONFRONTED THE OFFICERS AND AGAIN FIRED AT POLICE. TROOPER VERMILLION AND MULTIPLE OFFICERS FROM THE OTHER AGENCIES RETURNED FIRE, STRIKING HARRIS. EMS PROVIDED IMMEDIATE ASSISTANCE; HOWEVER, HARRIS DIED AT THE SCENE.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON FRIDAY MAY 24, 2019, OFFICERS FROM THE PATROL REGION 1 COMMAND, GANG DIVISION, RESPONDED TO A SUSPICIOUS PERSON WITH A WEAPON CALL AT 5901 SELINSKY RD. #82. AS THE OFFICERS WERE RESPONDING TO THE CALL, THEY WERE ADVISED THAT THE SUSPECT WAS ARMED WITH A GUN. THEY WERE GIVEN A PHYSICAL AND CLOTHING DESCRIPTION OF HIM. WHEN THE OFFICERS ARRIVED ON THE CALL, THEY OBSERVED A MALE MATCHING THE DESCRIPTION OF THE SUSPECT AND THEY CONFRONTED HIM NEAR APARTMENT #82. THE OFFICERS OBSERVED THE SUSPECT WAS ARMED WITH A CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 GUN AND HE APPEARED AGITATED. THE OFFICERS GAVE THE SUSPECT REPEATED VERBAL COMMANDS TO DROP HIS WEAPON WHICH HE IGNORED. THE SUSPECT BECAME MORE AGITATED AS THE OFFICERS WERE GIVING HIM THE VERBAL COMMANDS, AND HE THEN POINTED HIS GUN AT THE OFFICERS. FEARING THAT THE SUSPECT WAS GOING TO SHOOT THEM, ONE OF THE OFFICERS DISCHARGED HIS DUTY WEAPON MULTIPLE TIMES AT THE SUSPECT STRIKING HIM. THE OFFICERS CHECKED ON THE SUSPECT AFTER HE WENT DOWN, AND THEY REQUESTED AN AMBULANCE TO RESPOND TO THE SCENE. THE SUSPECT WAS PRONOUNCED DEAD AT THE SCENE. THERE WERE NO INJURIES TO ANY OF THE OFFICER'S INVOLVED IN THIS INCIDENT. THE SUSPECT'S IDENTITY IS PENDING AT THIS TIME

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE; OTHER
cdr_narrative: ON MAY 26TH, 2019 AT ABOUT 2030 HOURS OFFICERS OF THE ODESSA POLICE DEPARTMENT WERE DISPATCHED TO 7209 DONATELLO ST IN REFERENCE TO SHOTS FIRED. NUMEROUS CALLERS REPORTED TO THE ODESSA POLICE DEPARTMENT THAT A WHITE MALE WAS SHOOTING INTO THE AIR. EVIDENCE REVEALED THAT BEFORE OFFICERS ARRIVED THE SUSPECT EXITED HIS RESIDENCE AND FIRED A ROUND INTO THE AIR WHILE STANDING ON HIS PORCH. AFTER SEVERAL MINUTES HE FIRED SEVERAL MORE ROUNDS AND WALKED BACK INTO HIS RESIDENCE. AFTER OFFICERS ARRIVED, THE SUSPECT EXITED HIS RESIDENCE WITH A RIFLE. OFFICERS GAVE COMMANDS IN AN ATTEMPT TO GAIN COMPLIANCE, BUT THE SUSPECT FAILED TO COMPLY AND WENT BACK INTO THE RESIDENCE. MINUTES LATER, THE SUSPECT EXITS HIS HOUSE AND CAN BE SEEN FACING OFFICERS AND POINTS A HANDGUN IN THE DIRECTION OF THE OFFICERS AT WHICH POINT OFFICERS FIRE ON THE SUSPECT. OFFICER ADVISED OVER THE RADIO THAT THE SUSPECT WAS DOWN. OFFICERS QUICKLY SECURED THE SCENE AND REQUESTED STAGED EMS PERSONNEL TO ADMINISTER MEDICAL CARE TO THE SUSPECT. EMS ADVISED THAT THERE WAS NOTHING THEY COULD DO FOR THE SUSPECT AND A VITAL SIGN STRIP WAS PRINTED THAT INDICATED NO VITAL SIGNS.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE; TRAFFIC STOP
TRAFFIC STOP; EXECUTION OF A WARRANT
cdr_narrative: OFFICERS WERE LOOKING FOR THIS SUSPECT FOR AN AGGRAVATED ASSAULT WDW THAT HAD OCCURRED ON 5/28/2019. OFFICER GAINED INFORMATION ON THE SUSPECTS WHEREABOUTS AND BEGAN SURVEILLANCE. OFFICERS WATCHED THE SUSPECT GET INTO CAR AND TRAFFIC STOP WAS MADE. THE SUSPECT FLED ON FOOT ,FROM THE BACK SEAT OF THE CAR. THE SUSPECT FIRED SEVERAL ROUNDS AT THE PURSUING OFFICERS. THE OFFICERS GAVE COMMANDS FOR THE SUSPECT TO STOP AND GET ON THE GROUND. THE SUSPECT REFUSED COMMANDS AND RAN TOWARDS A CONTAINMENT TEAM. THE CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 CONTAINMENT OFFICERS FEARED FOR THEIR LIVES AND FIRED AT THE SUSPECT. THE SUSPECT WAS STRUCK SEVERAL TIMES. THE OFFICERS ADMINISTERED FIRST AID ON SCENE AND CALLED FOR AN AMBULANCE. THE SUSPECT DID NOT SURVIVE HIS INJURIES AND DIED AT THE SCENE.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE; HOSTAGE/BARRICADE/OTHER EMERG SITUATION
incident_call_other: DOMESTIC DISTURBANCE, THE DECEASED REPORTEDLY WAS USING A CROWBAR TO SWING AT FAMILY, DECEASED POINTED RIFLE AT RESPONDING OFFICERS, DECEASED BARRICADED SELF INSIDE HOUSE, DECEASED POINTED OBJECT PERCEIVED TO BE A FIREARM AT OFFICERS WHEN SHOT.
cdr_narrative: FAMILY CALLED POLICE REGARDING AGGRESSIVE BEHAVIOR OF DECEASED. OFFICERS ARRIVED ON SCENE AND DECEASED POINTED RIFLE AT OFFICERS. OFFICERS ESTABLISHED PERIMETER AROUND HOUSE. DECEASED EXITED HOUSE DISPLAYING AN OBJECT BELIEVED TO BE A HANDGUN AND POINTED IT AT OFFICERS. OFFICERS FIRED AT DECEASED AND HE DIED ON SCENE.

EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE; TRAFFIC STOP; EXECUTION OF A WARRANT
cdr_narrative: THE DECEASED WAS WANTED ON A FELONY WARRANT. OFFICERS STOPPED THE VEHICLE HE WAS IN. THE DECEASED FLED FROM THE VEHICLE ON FOOT. THE DECEASED DROPPED A HANDGUN AND PICKED IT UP WHILE RUNNING FROM POLICE. THE DECEASED BARRICADED HIMSELF INSIDE A PARKED TRUCK INSIDE OF A BACK YARD OF A RESIDENCE. THE DECEASED FAILED TO EXIT THE VEHICLE UPON OFFICER'S COMMANDS. THE DECEASED RAISED A HANDGUN AND DISCHARGED IT. OFFICERS RETURNED FIRE AT THE DECEASED. THE DECEASED DIED ON SCENE.

incident_result_of: TRAFFIC STOP; OTHER
incident_call_other: ATTEMPTED TRAFFIC STOP / PURSUIT DUE TO STALKING AND DEATH THREATS OF MRS. ODELL
cdr_narrative: ON JUNE, 11, 2019, THE HOPKINS COUNTY SHERIFF’S OFFICE RECEIVED INFORMATION THAT JIMMY DE ODELL HAD MADE A COMMENT TO AN INDIVIDUAL ABOUT KILLING HIS EX-WIFE, GINA ODELL. JIMMY WAS RECENTLY RELEASED FROM THE TEXAS DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS FOR STALKING GINA. GINA HAD RECENTLY FILED A REPORT WITH THE HOPKINS COUNTY SHERIFF’S OFFICE AND ANOTHER LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCY REGARDING BEING STALKED BY JIMMY. GINA HAD ALSO OBTAINED AN EMERGENCY PROTECTIVE ORDER AGAINST JIMMY. CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 THE INFORMATION PROVIDED WAS JIMMY WAS RIDING A BLACK MOTORCYCLE, WEARING A WIG AND HELMET IN AN ATTEMPT TO DISGUISE HIMSELF. DEPUTIES RESPONDED TO GINA’S PLACE OF EMPLOYMENT AND REMOVED HER FOR SAFETY AND ESTABLISHED SURVEILLANCE AROUND HER OFFICE. DEPUTIES SEARCHED THE AREAS WHERE GINA FREQUENTS IN THE COURSE OF HER EMPLOYMENT IN AN ATTEMPT TO INTERCEPT JIMMY. A HOPKINS COUNTY DEPUTY LATER LOCATED A VEHICLE MATCHING THE DESCRIPTION PROVIDED AND ATTEMPTED TO CONDUCT A TRAFFIC STOP. THE VEHICLE EVADED THE DEPUTY FOR A SHORT DISTANCE AND CAME TO A STOP IN THE 500 BLOCK OF SMITH STREET AT THE INTERSECTION OF BETHEL ROAD. JIMMY MADE SEVERAL COMMENTS TO THE DEPUTY TO SHOOT HIM. WHILE THE INITIAL DEPUTY WAS PROVIDING VERBAL COMMAND, ADDITIONAL DEPUTIES ARRIVED ON-SCENE TO ASSIST. JIMMY CONTINUED TO DISREGARD VERBAL COMMAND AS HE REACHED INTO THE SADDLE BAG ON THE MOTORCYCLE. DEPUTIES CONTINUED TO GIVE VERBAL COMMANDS AS JIMMY CONTINUED TO TELL DEPUTIES TO SHOOT HIM. JIMMY REMOVED A PISTOL FROM THE SADDLE BAG AND AGGRESSIVELY PULLED THE PISTOL OUT OF ITS HOLSTER. A DEPUTY RESPONDING BY DISCHARGING HIS DUTY WEAPON STRIKING JIMMY CAUSING HIM TO FALL OFF THE MOTORCYCLE ONTO THE GROUND. WHEN JIMMY FELL TO THE GROUND, HE CONTINUED TO POSSESS THE PISTOL AS HE ROLLED FACE DOWN CONCEALING THE PISTOL AND HIS HANDS UNDER HIS BODY. WHILE ON THE GROUND, JIMMY PLACED THE GUN TO HIS HEAD AND FIRED ONE SHOT. AFTER THE SHOT, JIMMY CONTINUED TO MOVE AND DISREGARD VERBAL COMMANDS TO SHOW HIS HANDS. JIMMY ULTIMATELY ROLLED ONTO HIS LEFT SIDE HOLDING THE PISTOL IN HIS LEFT HAND AND RAISED THE PISTOL IN THE DIRECTION OF A RESPONDING LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICER. THE SAME DEPUTY AGAIN DISCHARGED HIS DUTY WEAPON STRIKING JIMMY CAUSING THE GUN TO FALL TO THE GROUND. DEPUTIES WERE ABLE TO SEE THE PISTOL AND JIMMY’S HANDS AND ADVANCED TOWARD JIMMY. DEPUTIES MOVED THE PISTOL FORM NEAR JIMMY’S BODY AND BEGAN LIFE SAVING MEASURES AS THEY CONTACTED EMERGENCY MEDICAL SERVICES. JIMMY ULTIMATELY DIED FROM HIS INJURIES.

incident_result_of: TRAFFIC STOP; OTHER
incident_call_other: OFFICER WAS INVOLVED IN AN OPERATION. OFFICERS WERE CONDUCTING SURVEILLANCE OF A KNOWN SUBJECT AND A STOLEN TRUCK.
cdr_narrative: ON 6/12/2019, AT APPROXIMATELY 7:00PM, FARMERS BRANCH OFFICERS WERE CONDUCTING AN OPERATION WITHIN THE CITY LIMITS OF DALLAS, TEXAS. FARMERS BRANCH OFFICERS WERE CONDUCTING SURVEILLANCE ON A KNOWN SUBJECT, JUAN MORENO, AND A STOLEN VEHICLE THE SUBJECT WAS OBSERVED DRIVING EARLIER IN THE DAY. THE OFFICERS OBSERVED THE VEHICLE BECOME OCCUPIED BY THE SUBJECT AND TWO OTHER UNKNOWN INDIVIDUALS. WHEN FARMERS BRANCH OFFICERS ATTEMPTED A FELONY ARREST THE SUBJECT PLACED THE VEHICLE IN GEAR AND DROVE THE VEHICLE IN THE DIRECTION OF A FARMERS BRANCH OFFICER WHO DISCHARGED HIS SERVICE WEAPON THREE TIMES STRIKING THE SUBJECT. THE VEHICLE CRASHED INTO OTHER VEHICLES IN THE PARKING LOT AND CAME TO A RESTING POSITION. THE SUBJECT EXPIRED FROM HIS INJURIES. NO OFFICERS OR WITNESSES WERE INJURED IN THE INCIDENT.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: OFFICERS RESPONDED TO A ROBBERY IN PROGRESS AT A DAIRY QUEEN CALLED IN BY AN EMPLOYEE WHO STATED THE SUSPECT WAS ARMED AND HOLDING A MANAGER HOSTAGE. AS OFFICER APPROACHED THE REAR OF THE BUSINESS, THE SUSPECT ATTEMPTED TO FLEE OUT THE BACK DOOR. WHEN SUSPECT SAW OFFICER HE RAISED HIS FIREARM BUT SLIPPED ON CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 THE FLOOR. SUSPECT THEN RAN BACK INTO THE INTERIOR OF THE RESTAURANT AND OFFICER PURSUED. AS OFFICER ENTERED THE KITCHEN AREA HE OBSERVED THE SUSPECT CROUCHED AND HIDING IN A CORNER WITHIN A FEW FEET AND IN POSITION TO AMBUSH THE OFFICER. AS OFFICER TURNED TOWARDS SUSPECT, SUSPECT RAISED AND POINTED HANDGUN AT THE OFFICER. OFFICER DISCHARGED HIS PATROL RIFLE MULTIPLE TIMES STRIKING THE SUSPECT. SUSPECT WAS TENDED TO BY EMS AND DECLARED DECEASED ON SCENE. A LOADED HANDGUN WAS RECOVERED FROM THE SUSPECT.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE; TRAFFIC STOP
cdr_narrative: PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS IS STILL AN ONGOING INVESTIGATION. THE FINAL AUTOPSY REPORT (TO INCLUDE TOXICOLOGY), BALLISTIC REPORT, AND THE TEXAS RANGERS INVESTIGATION ARE PENDING. THE SUMMARY SET OUT BELOW IS BASED ON INFORMATION KNOWN TO DATE AND COULD BE SUBJECT TO CHANGE BASED ON FURTHER INFORMATION. ON JUNE 17, 2019 AT AROUND 1:30AM, OFFICERS WITH THE BROWNSVILLE POLICE DEPARTMENT RESPONDED TO 470 GILSON RD. IN REFERENCE TO AN ASSAULT. THE COMPLAINANT ADVISED DISPATCH THAT HER SISTER'S BOYFRIEND, MARK GALVAN (20 YEAR OLD MALE), HAD JUST ASSAULTED HER SISTER, AND LEFT THE AREA DRIVING A RED MUSTANG. OFFICER MARIO A. ALVARADO #8404, WHO WAS ON DUTY, RAN MARK ANTHONY GALVAN'S NAME ON SPILLMAN SOFTWARE, WHICH PROVIDED HIM WITH MARK ANTHONY'S ADDRESS. BELIEVING THAT THE SUSPECT WOULD RETURN TO HIS RESIDENCE, OFFICER ALVARADO REMAINED NEAR THE INTERSECTION OF BOCA CHICA BLVD. & CENTRAL BLVD. AT AROUND 1:34AM, OFFICER ALVARADO OBSERVED A VEHICLE MATCHING THE DESCRIPTION TRAVELING SOUTHBOUND ON CENTRAL BLVD. APPROACHING BOCA CHICA BLVD. THE VEHICLE THEN TURNED LEFT AND BEGAN TO TRAVEL EASTBOUND ON BOCA CHICA BLVD. AS PER OFFICER ALVARADO, HE THEN ASCERTAINED WITH DISPATCH VIA UNIT RADIO IF THE SUSPECT'S MUSTANG HAD A CONVERTIBLE TOP, WHICH DISPATCH CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 8 CONFIRMED (THE MUSTANG IN FRONT OF HIM HAD A CONVERTIBLE TOP AND MATCHED THE PREVIOUS DESCRIPTION PROVIDED BY DISPATCH IN REGARDS TO THE SUSPECT VEHICLE OTHER THAN THE PARTIAL LICENSE PLATES PROVIDED WHICH WERE LSN AND WERE ACTUALLY LSM). OFFICER ALVARADO PROCEEDED TO CONDUCT A TRAFFIC STOP ON THE VEHICLE, WHICH CAME TO A COMPLETE STOP ON MEDICAL ST. ITSELF (MEDICAL ST. IS A NARROW TWO-WAY TRAFFIC RESIDENTIAL STREET WITH NO IMPROVED SHOULDER). OFFICER ALVARADO APPROACHED THE DRIVER SIDE OF THE VEHICLE AND MADE CONTACT WITH THE DRIVER. OFFICER ALVARADO BEGAN HIS INTERVIEW BY ASKING THE DRIVER "ARE YOU MARK ANTHONY?", TO WHICH DRIVER SAID "YES SIR". OFFICER ALVARADO THEN ADVISED MARK ANTHONY "THEY CALLED MAN" AND THEN TOLD HIM HE COULD TURN OFF HIS CAR IF HE WANTS. MARK ANTHONY THEN TURNED OFF THE VEHICLE AND REPLIED BY SAYING "MY BABY MOMMA OR WHAT?". OFFICER ALVARADO REPLIED BY SAYING "YES" AND ASKED "WHAT HAPPENED OVER THERE ON GILSON?" (THE SITE OF THE ASSAULT), TO WHICH MARK ANTHONY REPLIED "I MEAN SHE WAS ARGUING WITH ME SO I JUST LEFT". OFFICER ALVARADO THEN ASKED MARK ANTHONY FOR A DRIVERS LICENSE, BUT HE CLAIMED HE ONLY HAD AN ID, TO WHICH OFFICER ALVARADO SAID IT WAS FINE. AT THAT TIME, MARK ANTHONY HANDED OVER TO OFFICER ALVARADO HIS TX IDENTIFICATION CARD, FURTHER CONFIRMING THAT HE WAS IN FACT MARK ANTHONY GALVAN. WHILE SEARCHING FOR INSURANCE DOCUMENTS, MARK ANTHONY ASKED OFFICER ALVARADO "WHAT DID SHE SAY?" MARK ANTHONY IS ADVISED BY OFFICER ALVARADO THAT OFFICERS ARE AT GILSON INVESTIGATING WHAT HAPPENED. OFFICER ALVARADO THEN ASKED MARK ANTHONY TO STEP OUT OF THE VEHICLE WHILE OFFICERS FIGURED OUT WHAT HAD OCCURRED ON GILSON RD. MARK ANTHONY STAYED INSIDE HIS VEHICLE FOR A FEW MOMENTS, THEN ASKED OFFICER ALVARADO "DO YOU NEED ME TO STEP OUT?" TO WHICH OFFICER ALVARADO REPLIED "YES PLEASE MAN". INSTEAD OF STEPPING OUT OF HIS VEHICLE, MARK ANTHONY INSERTED HIS VEHICLE'S KEY IN THE IGNITION AND TURNED THE VEHICLE BACK ON. OFFICER ALVARADO THEN ORDERED MARK ANTHONY TO TURN THE VEHICLE BACK OFF, AND STEP OUT, WHICH HE REFUSED. MARK ANTHONY THEN QUESTIONED OFFICER ALVARADO WHY HE NEEDED TO STEP OUT, TO WHICH OFFICER ALVARADO REPLIED THAT THINGS NEEDED TO BE SORTED "OVER THERE". WHILE THE INTERVIEW CONTINUED, SGT. JOHN M. JONES #5119 ARRIVED AT THE SCENE OF THE TRAFFIC STOP AND ASSISTED AS THE BACK-UP OFFICER BY STANDING NEAR THE FRONT PASSENGER SIDE AREA OF MARK ANTHONY'S VEHICLE. OFFICER ALVARADO THEN ADVISED MARK ANTHONY THAT HE WAS ASKING HIM TO STEP OUT OF THE VEHICLE AND ASKED MARK ANTHONY IF HE WAS GOING TO COMPLY OR NOT. MARK ANTHONY THEN CLAIMED THAT HE WAS COMPLYING. OFFICER ALVARADO FURTHER STATED THAT HE WAS GOING TO EXPLAIN TO MARK ANTHONY WHAT WAS GOING ON ONCE HE WAS OUTSIDE OF HIS VEHICLE AND ORDERED MARK ANTHONY TO TURN OFF THE VEHICLE. MARK ANTHONY CONTINUED TO QUESTION OFFICER ALVARADO'S ORDERS, AND AT THAT POINT, OFFICER ALVARADO TELLS MARK ANTHONY THAT HE HAD BEEN ASKING FOR HIS COMPLIANCE NICELY, AND ADVISED HIM THAT HE COULD COMPLY OR THINGS COULD GO A DIFFERENT WAY. OFFICER ALVARADO ONCE AGAIN ORDERED MARK ANTHONY TO TURN OFF THE VEHICLE AND EXIT. MARK ANTHONY ONCE AGAIN CLAIMED HE WAS COMPLYING AND MOVED THE VEHICLE'S GEAR SELECTOR BACK. OFFICER ALVARADO THEN ORDERED MARK ANTHONY TO PUT THE VEHICLE ON PARK, UNHOLSTERED HIS CONDUCTED ENERGY DEVICE (TASER), AND AIMED IT AT MARK ANTHONY. MARK ANTHONY THEN ACCELERATED AT A HIGH RATE SPEED, AND BEGAN TO EVADE THE OFFICERS IN HIS MOTOR VEHICLE AT AROUND 1:37AM. AS THIS HAPPENED, OFFICER CELESTE RIVERA #6394 ARRIVED AT THE LOCATION, AND SHE ALONG WITH OFFICER ALVARADO AND SGT. JONES BEGAN TO PURSUE MARK ANTHONY IN THEIR INDIVIDUAL MARKED POLICE UNITS WITH EMERGENCY LIGHTS AND SIRENS ON. OFFICER ALVARADO THEN ADVISED DISPATCH VIA UNIT RADIO WHAT HAD JUST OCCURRED, AND OTHER POLICE UNITS WERE DISPATCHED TO ASSIST. MARK ANTHONY THEN REACHED THE END OF MEDICAL ST. (DEAD END STREET) AND DROVE BACK TOWARDS THE DIRECTION OF THE OFFICERS. NEAR 47 MEDICAL ST., THE OFFICERS (SGT. JONES, OFFICER ALVARADO, & OFFICER RIVERA) QUICKLY EXITED THEIR POLICE UNITS. DUE TO THE EXIGENT CIRCUMSTANCES, AND BECAUSE OF TWO VEHICLES BEING PARKED ON THE RIGHT SIDE OF THE NARROW ROAD (FACING SOUTHBOUND), OFFICER ALVARADO STOPPED AND PARKED HIS UNIT ON THE ONCOMING LANE. OFFICER RIVERA'S UNIT WAS BEHIND OFFICER ALVARADO'S UNIT SLIGHTLY TO THE RIGHT ALSO NEAR THE ONCOMING LANE. SGT. JONES UNIT WAS BEHIND OFFICER RIVERA'S UNIT TO THE LEFT ON THE ONCOMING LANE. ALL UNITS APPEARED TO BE AT A SLIGHT ANGLE TOWARDS THE LEFT FACING SOUTHBOUND. THE OFFICERS THEN TOOK DIFFERENT POSITIONS IN THE CONFINED AREA DUE IN PART TO THE SPLIT SECOND DIFFERENCE IN THEIR ARRIVAL TIME AT THAT SPECIFIC LOCATION. OFFICER ALVARADO WAS THE FIRST TO BE CONFRONTED BY MARK ANTHONY AS MARK ANTHONY APPROACHED HIM IN HIS VEHICLE, WHILE SGT. JONES WAS COMING FROM BEHIND OFFICER ALVARADO AND WAS SECOND IN BEING CONFRONTED BY MARK ANTHONY. UPON EXITING HER POLICE UNIT, OFFICER RIVERA RAN TOWARDS HER RIGHT COUNTERCLOCKWISE AND AROUND A POLICE UNIT THAT WAS IN FRONT OF HER. UPON REACHING THE FRONT OF SAID POLICE UNIT, OFFICER RIVERA OBSERVED MARK ANTHONY APPROACHING OFFICER ALVARADO. THE OFFICERS HAD THEIR ASSIGNED DUTY PISTOLS DRAWN AND BEGAN TO ACTIVELY TARGET MARK ANTHONY AS THEY GAVE HIM VERBAL COMMANDS TO STOP THE VEHICLE MULTIPLE TIMES AS HE APPROACHED THEM COMING NORTHBOUND. MARK ANTHONY DISOBEYED THE OFFICER'S MULTIPLE VERBAL COMMANDS TO STOP THE VEHICLE AND INSTEAD HE DROVE HIS VEHICLE ON TOP OF THE RIGHT CURB AND ONTO THE FRONT YARD OF 47 MEDICAL ST. (FACING NORTHBOUND). THE RESIDENCE HAD AN OPEN FRONT YARD WITH NO FENCE. MARK ANTHONY CONTINUED TO DRIVE HIS VEHICLE NEAR AND IN THE DIRECTION OF OFFICER ALVARADO AND SGT. JONES. THEN SGT. JONES CAN BE HEARD TELLING THE OFFICERS "DON'T GET IN FRONT OF HIM" WHILE THEY WERE ALL EXPOSED IN A TIGHTLY SPACED AREA DUE THE NARROWNESS OF THE ROAD, SURROUNDING PARKED VEHICLES, A STUCCO MAILBOX, A STREET LIGHT POLE, A NEIGHBOR'S RESIDENCE CONCRETE BLOCK FENCE, A RESIDENCE (47 MEDICAL ST.), AND THE PARKED POSITIONS OF THE POLICE UNITS WHICH BLOCKED THE ROADWAY AND BOXED THEM IN DUE TO MARK ANTHONY'S UNLAWFUL BEHAVIOR. HAVING NO MEANS OF ESCAPE, AND WHILE DRIVING ON TOP OF THE FRONT YARD AREA AT 47 MEDICAL ST., MARK ANTHONY THEN SUDDENLY ACCELERATED QUICKLY CAUSING HIS VEHICLE'S TIRES TO SQUEAL. OFFICER ALVARADO AND SGT. JONES THEN CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 8 OF 8 SUBSEQUENTLY SHOT AT THE DIRECTION OF MARK ANTHONY AS HE FELONIOUS CRASHED INTO A POLICE UNIT AT AROUND 1:37AM (APPROXIMATELY 42 SECONDS AFTER EVADING FROM THE TRAFFIC STOP). OFFICER ALVARADO ADVISED MARK ANTHONY HAD COME WITHIN INCHES FROM STRIKING HIM AND THEN OBSERVED MARK ANTHONY DRIVE DIRECTLY TOWARDS SGT. JONES. HE ALSO ADVISED HE WAS UNAWARE WHO ELSE WAS AT THE SCENE BEHIND SGT. JONES OR IN THE POLICE UNITS BEHIND HIS POLICE CAR. OFFICER ALVARADO REASONABLY BELIEVED THAT DEADLY FORCE WAS IMMEDIATELY NECESSARY TO PROTECT SGT. JONES, THE OTHER OFFICERS ON SCENE, HIMSELF, AND THE CITIZENS IN THE AREA AGAINST THE SUSPECT'S USE OF UNLAWFUL DEADLY FORCE AND TOOK SEVERAL SHOTS AT THE DRIVER SIDE AREA TO TRY AND ELIMINATE THE IMMEDIATE THREAT. AFTER OBSERVING MARK ANTHONY COME WITHIN INCHES OF STRIKING OFFICER ALVARADO, SGT. JONES WAS CONFRONTED BY MARK ANTHONY AND OBSERVED THE MUSTANG COMING DIRECTLY TOWARDS HIM. WHEN SGT. JONES HEARD THE VEHICLE ACCELERATE QUICKLY CAUSING THE TIRES TO SQUEAL, SGT. JONES FELT HIS LIFE WAS NOW IN JEOPARDY ALONG WITH THE OTHER OFFICERS ON SCENE AND THE CITIZENS IN THE AREA. SGT. JONES STATED HE DID NOT KNOW WHO ELSE WAS AT THE SCENE BEHIND HIM OR IN THE POLICE UNITS PARKED AT THE LOCATION. SGT. JONES REASONABLY BELIEVED THAT MARK ANTHONY USED HIS VEHICLE AS A DEADLY WEAPON AND SHOT IN THE DIRECTION OF MARK ANTHONY. AFTER BEING SHOT BY SGT. JONES AND OFFICER ALVARADO AND INTENTIONALLY CRASHING INTO A POLICE UNIT WITH GREAT FORCE, MARK ANTHONY THEN PLACED HIS VEHICLE ON REVERSE, AND BACKED UP TOWARDS THE DIRECTION OF THE OFFICERS WHO WERE STILL EXPOSED IN THE NARROW CONFINED AREA AND IN CLOSE PROXIMITY OF THE VEHICLE. MULTIPLE VERBAL COMMANDS BY THE OFFICERS TO MARK ANTHONY TO STOP HIS VEHICLE WERE IGNORED AGAIN. MARK ANTHONY THEN QUICKLY ACCELERATED FORWARD AS ALL THREE OFFICERS (SGT. JONES, OFFICER ALVARADO, & OFFICER RIVERA) SUBSEQUENTLY SHOT AT THE DIRECTION OF MARK ANTHONY AS HE CRASHED INTO TWO POLICE UNITS IN ORDER TO ESCAPE AND EVADE FROM THE AREA, WHICH HE ACCOMPLISHED. THE OFFICERS BELIEVED AN OFFICER BEING WAS INSIDE THE POLICE UNIT MARK ANTHONY HAD FELONIOUS STRUCK WITH GREAT FORCE. THEY FEARED OFFICERS COULD HAVE BEEN OUTSIDE AND AROUND THE POLICE VEHICLES ON SCENE. THE OFFICERS FELT THEIR LIVES WERE IN DANGER AS WELL AS THE CITIZENS IN THE AREA. THEY REASONABLY BELIEVED IT WAS IMMEDIATELY NECESSARY TO USE DEADLY FORCE TO STOP THE IMMINENT THREAT AND PERFORMED THEIR DUTIES. OFFICER ALVARADO WAS ABLE TO CONTINUE TO PURSUE MARK ANTHONY IN HIS POLICE UNIT (APPROXIMATELY 27 SECONDS LATER) WHILE SGT. JONES & OFFICER RIVERA STAYED AT THE SCENE OF THE SHOOTING ON MEDICAL ST. A FEW MOMENTS LATER, MARK ANTHONY CRASHED HIS VEHICLE INTO A PALM TREE NEAR THE 1300 BLOCK OF BOCA CHICA BLVD. AFTER THE CRASH, OFFICER ALVARADO APPROACHED THE VEHICLE AND ASSISTED MARK ANTHONY BY TAKING HIM OUT OF THE VEHICLE. ONCE OUTSIDE THE VEHICLE, MARK ANTHONY WAS PROVIDED WITH FIRST AID BY MULTIPLE OFFICERS AT THE SCENE. BROWNSVILLE EMS RESPONDED TO THE SCENE AND TRANSPORTED MARK ANTHONY TO VALLEY BAPTIST MEDICAL CENTER FOR FURTHER TREATMENT. MARK ANTHONY GALVAN SUCCUMBED TO HIS WOUNDS AND DIED AT 3:32AM AT VBMC. THE PRELIMINARY CAMERON COUNTY FORENSIC PATHOLOGY REPORT DOCUMENTED THE CAUSE OF DEATH AS "GUNSHOT WOUNDS OF THE CHEST".

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON JUNE 20, 2019 AT APPROXIMATELY 8:05 PM, A FEMALE WAVED DOWN A MISSION POLICE OFFICER IN THE AREA OF STEWART ROAD AND BUSINESS HIGHWAY 83. ACCORDING TO THE FEMALE, HER SON, IDENTIFIED AS JUAN CARLOS CHAPA JR., HAD SHOT AT HER CAR WITH A HANDGUN. AS MISSION POLICE OFFICERS ARRIVED AT LOCATION TO THE AREA, THEY OBSERVED A SUBJECT WALKING AT ABOUT THE 1700 BLOCK OF EAST BUSINESS HIGHWAY 83. OFFICERS ATTEMPTED TO MAKE CONTACT WITH THE SUBJECT, BUT HE BEGAN TO RUN FROM THE OFFICERS. AS THE MALE SUBJECT WAS RUNNING TOWARD THE PARKING AREA OF THE MISSION BELL RESORT, HE TURNED AROUND AND BEGAN DISCHARGING A WEAPON IN THE DIRECTION OF THE OFFICERS. GUNFIRE WAS EXCHANGED BETWEEN THE SUBJECT AND MISSION POLICE OFFICERS. THE MALE SUBJECT WAS STRUCK MULTIPLE TIMES AND WAS TRANSPORTED TO RIO GRANDE REGIONAL HOSPITAL WHERE HE WAS PRONOUNCED DEAD.

incident_result_of: OTHER
incident_call_other: SUSPICIOUS PERSON AND/OR VEHICLE ON PRIVATE PROPERTY
cdr_narrative: DEPUTY RESPONDED TO A CALL OF A SUSPICIOUS PERSON OR VEHICLE ON PRIVATE PROPERTY/RESIDENCE. DEPUTY ARRIVED AND WAS SPEAKING WITH THE SUBJECT. SUBJECT PULLED OUT A KNIFE AND STABBED THE DEPUTY. DEPUTY WAS ABLE TO DRAW HIS SERVICE WEAPON, FIRE ONCE AT THE SUBJECT. SUBJECT DIED OF THE INJURIES SUSTAINED DURING THE ATTACK ON THE DEPUTY.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE; HOSTAGE/BARRICADE/OTHER EMERG SITUATION
cdr_narrative: OFFICERS WERE DISPATCHED TO THE LISTED LOCATION FOR A SUICIDE IN PROGRESS. UPON ARRIVAL, OFFICERS ENCOUNTERED AN ADULT MALE WHO WAS DISTRAUGHT AND APPEARED TO BE SUICIDAL. THE MALE WAS SITTING ON THE LEDGE OF THE IH-37 S BRIDGE OVER W. BOYER AVENUE WITH A ROPE TIED TO A LIGHT POLE. THE ROPE HAD WHAT APPEARED TO BE A NOOSE TIED TO THE END. AFTER COMMUNICATIONS BETWEEN PATROL OFFICERS AND THE SUICIDAL MALE PROVED INEFFECTIVE, MEMBERS OF CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 THE SAN ANTONIO POLICE DEPARTMENT (SAPD) MENTAL HEALTH UNIT (MHU) WERE REQUESTED. AFTER OFFICERS FROM THE MHU ARRIVED, IT WAS DETERMINED THE SUICIDAL MALE WAS ARMED WITH SOME TYPE OF WEAPON BELIEVED TO BE A FIREARM. SAPD SPECIAL OPERATIONS UNIT (SOU) PERSONNEL AND HOSTAGE NEGOTIATIONS TEAM (HNT) PERSONNEL WERE CONTACTED AND RESPONDED. AFTER HNT PERSONNEL ARRIVED, ATTEMPTS TO COMMUNICATE WITH THE SUICIDAL MALE CONTINUED. THE SUICIDAL MALE WOULD NOT COMMUNICATE WITH OFFICERS AND WOULD NOT COMPLY WITH COMMANDS AS HE CONTINUALLY REACHED BEHIND HIS BACK TO AN AREA AROUND HIS WAISTBAND WHERE OFFICERS BELIEVED THEY HAD SEEN A SMALL FIREARM. THE SUICIDAL MALE CLIMBED ONTO THE LEDGE WHILE OFFICERS WERE ATTEMPTING TO DEESCALATE THE SITUATION. AS THE SUICIDAL MALE WAS STEPPING OFF THE LEDGE AND BACK ONTO THE ROADWAY, HE BEGAN TO REMOVE WHAT WAS BELIEVED TO BE A FIREARM FROM HIS REAR WAISTBAND AREA. THE SUICIDAL MALE PULLED THE ITEM UP AT WHICH TIME FOUR OFFICERS FIRED THEIR WEAPONS AT THE SUICIDAL MALE IN FEAR THE SUICIDAL MALE WAS ABOUT TO FIRE UPON THEM. THE SUICIDAL MALE WAS HIT MULTIPLE TIMES AND FELL TO THE GROUND. AS THE SUICIDAL MALE WAS FALLING, AN OBJECT COULD BE SEEN FLYING IN THE AIR FROM HIS RIGHT HAND. FROM A DISTANCE, THE ITEM APPEARED TO BE A SMALL HANDGUN. AFTER THE SUICIDAL MALE WAS SECURED, A CLOSER LOOK AT THE ITEM REVEALED IT WAS A BLACK HANDLED FOLDING KNIFE WITH A BOX CUTTER BLADE. THE KNIFE WAS HALF WAY OPEN AT AN APPROXIMATE 90 DEGREE BREAK RESEMBLING THE APPEARANCE OF A SMALL CALIBER HANDGUN. IT WAS OBVIOUS THE SUICIDAL MALE WAS ATTEMPTING TO COMMIT AGGRAVATED ASSAULT ON THE POLICE OFFICERS WITH A DEADLY WEAPON RESULTING IN THE OFFICERS USING DEADLY FORCE DUE TO THE REASONABLE BELIEF THE DEADLY FORCE WAS IMMEDIATELY NECESSARY TO PROTECT THEMSELVES AND OTHERS.

incident_result_of: HOSTAGE/BARRICADE/OTHER EMERG SITUATION
cdr_narrative: ZACKERY HOPPE WAS A WANTED SUSPECT ON SEVERAL FELONY WARRANTS. WHEN DEPUTIES ATTEMPTED TO ARREST HIM, HE BARRICADED HIMSELF IN A BEDROOM ARMED WITH A SHOTGUN. AS DEPUTIES ENTERED THE ROOM, HOPPE POINTED A SHOTGUN AT ONE OF THE DEPUTIES. OTHER DEPUTIES RESPONDED BY SHOOTING HOPPE. HOPPE PRONOUNCED DECEASED AT THE SCENE.

incident_result_of: TRAFFIC STOP
cdr_narrative: ON FRIDAY, JUNE 28, 2019 AT APPROXIMATELY 11:51 P.M., OFFICERS C. DULIN, EMPLOYEE #154339 AND T. PEACOCK, EMPLOYEE #154625, BOTH ASSIGNED TO THE GANG DIVISION, CRIME REDUCTION UNIT, WERE AT THE INTERSECTION OF THE SOUTHWEST FREEWAY FRONTAGE ROAD AND THE SAM HOUSTON TOLLWAY FRONTAGE ROAD AND OBSERVED A VEHICLE BEHIND THEM WITH A DEFECTIVE HEADLIGHT. AS THEY TRAVELLED NORTHBOUND ON THE SOUTHWEST FREEWAY FRONTAGE ROAD, THEY GOT BEHIND A 1998 WHITE, MERCEDES BENZ ML350 WITH LICENSE PLATE CLP1932 AND ACTIVATED THEIR LIGHTS. THE SUSPECT REFUSED TO STOP AND TURNED LEFT ONTO BISSONNET. OFFICERS WERE UNABLE TO FOLLOW DUE TO A VEHICLE MALFUNCTION AND LOST SIGHT OF THE SUSPECT. OFFICERS CALLED OUT THE LAST KNOWN DIRECTION OF THE SUSPECT'S VEHICLE OVER THE AIR. CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 A WRECKER DRIVER HEARD THE GENERAL BROADCAST AND FOUND THE SUSPECT'S VEHICLE IN THE 10100 BLOCK OF FORUM PARK. HE CALLED OFFICER E. GARZA, EMPLOYEE #127961M ASSIGNED TO WESTSIDE DTU AND HE GAVE THE CURRENT LOCATION OF THE VEHICLE OVER THE AIR. OFFICERS K. D. SMITH, EMPLOYEE #160178 AND L. MALDONADO III, EMPLOYEE # 155756, ASSIGNED TO THE SOUTH GESSNER DIVISION, CRIME SUPPRESSION TEAM HEARD OVER THE POLICE RADIO THAT THERE WAS A VEHICLE PURSUIT IN THEIR AREA AND LOCATED THE WHITE MERCEDES SUV WITH THE RIGHT FRONT HEADLIGHTS OUT AT 10110 FORUM PARK. THEY OBSERVED A WHITE MALE MATCHING THE SUSPECT'S DESCRIPTION, DIVERT TO THE SIDE AND PARK ALONG THE CURB BETWEEN OTHER PARKED VEHICLES. OFFICERS SMITH AND MALDONADO PARKED THEIR PATROL VEHICLE, WHILE OFFICER J. SELLE, EMPLOYEE #161383, ASSIGNED TO WESTSIDE DIVISION, TURNED ON HER OVERHEADS AND PARKED NEAR THE REAR OF THE SUSPECT'S VEHICLE BLOCKING HIM IN. THE SUSPECT STEPPED OUT OF THE VEHICLE AND OFFICER MALDONADO GAVE VERBAL COMMANDS FOR THE SUSPECT TO SHOW HIS HANDS, TO WHICH THE SUSPECT REPLIED, "NO!: OFFICERS SMITH AND MALDONADO OBSERVED A SILVER REVOLVER IN THE SUSPECT'S RIGHT HAND AND NOTIFIED OTHER OFFICERS ON THE SCENE. BOTH OFFICERS OBSERVED THE SUSPECT RAISE HIS FIREARM TOWARD OFFICER SELLE WHO WAS POSITIONED BEHIND THE SUSPECT'S VEHICLE. OFFICER SELLE ALSO SAY THE SUSPECT RAISE HIS GUN TOWARDS HER AND THEN SHE HEARD A LOUD POP. REALIZING THE SUSPECT HAD FIRED TOWARDS HER, OFFICER SELLE DISCHARGED HER WEAPON 18 TIMES TOWARD THE SUSPECT. FEARING FOR OFFICER SELLE'S LIFE, AS WELL AS THEIR OWN. OFFICER SMITH DISCHARGED HIS DUTY WEAPON 18 TIMES TOWARD THE SUSPECT. FEARING FOR OFFICER SELLE'S LIFE, AS WELL AS THEIR OWN. OFFICER SMITH DISCHARGED HIS DUTY WEAPON 8 TIMES AND OFFICER MALDONADO DISCHARGED HIS WEAPON 11 TIMES AT THE SUSPECT UNTIL HE WAS NO LONGER A THREAT. OFFICER SMITH CLEARED THE SUSPECT'S VEHICLE AS HE APPROACHED OFFICER SELLE. SHE ADVISED OFFICERS THAT SHE HAD BEEN SHOT AND THEY APPLIED A TOURNIQUET AND DRESSING TO HER RIGHT ARM. FELLOW OFFICERS TRANSPORTED OFFICER SELLE TO SOUTHWEST MEMORIAL WITH ONE GUNSHOT (ENTRANCE AND EXIT) TO HER LOWER RIGHT ARM. SHE WAS RELEASED LATER THE SAME NIGHT. THERE WERE NO INJURIES TO ANY OF THE OTHER OFFICERS. MEANWHILE, OFFICERS PROVIDED FIRST AID TO THE SUSPECT, HOWEVER HE WAS LATER PRONOUNCED DECEASED ON THE SCENE BY HFD. THE SUSPECT WAS IDENTIFIED BY THE MEDICAL EXAMINERS OFFICE THROUGH FINGERPRINTS. DURING THE PRELIMINARY AUTOPSY, THE SUSPECT SUSTAINED 19 GUNSHOT WOUNDS. HE WAS IN POSSESSION OF A FIVE SHOT CLARK REVOLVER AND ALL FIVE CASINGS HAD BEEN FIRED. BODY WARN CAMERAS ( BWC) WORN BY OFFICER MALDONADO, SMITH AND ASSISTING OFFICERS CAPTURED VARIOUS ASPECTS OF THE SHOOTING, ALL ALIGNING WITH THE OFFICERS' ACCOUNT OF THE EVENT. A REVIEW OF MR. FAZZOLARI'S CRIMINAL HISTORY REVEALED ARRESTS FOR POSSESSION OF MARIJUANA AND TERRORISTIC THREAT ( FAMILY MEMBER). FURTHERMORE, CARMINE FAZZOLARI'S MENTAL HEALTH HISTORY WAS CHECKED BY THE HOUSTON POLICE DEPARTMENT'S MENTAL HEALTH UNIT, WHICH SHOWED NO CONTACT OR DOCUMENTED HISTORY. HOWEVER, WHILE ON SCENE, A MALE IDENTIFYING HIMSELF AS MR. FAZZOLARI'S BROTHER-IN-LAW APPROACHED OFFICERS TO INQUIRE ABOUT THE IDENTITY OF THE SUSPECT. HE SAID HE WAS MADE AWARE OF THE INCIDENT BECAUSE MR. FAZZOLARI HAD SENT A SNAPCHAT VIDEO TO HIS FAMILY MEMBERS TO SHOW THE POLICE WERE CHASING HIM. THE FAMILY MEMBER MENTIONED THAT THE SUSPECT HAD BEEN DIAGNOSED WITH MENTAL HEALTH ISSUES. THE DEAD MAN REPORT IS DOCUMENTED UNDER INCIDENT # 0826492-19

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE; HOSTAGE/BARRICADE/OTHER EMERG SITUATION
incident_call_other: MAN WITH A GUN, HOLDING COUPLE HOSTAGE INSIDE RESIDENCE.
cdr_narrative: ON 06-29-2019, AT APPROXIMATELY 06:30 AM, THE SUSPECT, JACK WEST, ENTERED THE RESIDENCE OF DONALD AND PAULETTE WILLS OF LANTANA, DENTON COUNTY, TEXAS. WEST IS THE DOMESTIC PARTNER OF DONALD WILLS’, JERRY WILLS. ON 06-26-2019, WEST HAD ASSAULTED JERRY TO THE POINT HE REQUIRED HOSPITALIZATION, WEST BELIEVED JERRY WAS AT THE BROTHER’S HOUSE RECOVERING FROM THE ASSAULT. WEST, ARMED WITH A SHOTGUN, ENTERED THE RESIDENCE AND CONFRONTED DONALD AND PAULETTE IN THE KITCHEN. WEST DIRECTED THEM TO THE LIVING ROOM. UNKNOWN TO WEST, A THIRD PERSON WAS IN THE RESIDENCE AND WITNESSED WEST CONFRONT THE WILLS WITH THE WEAPON. THE WITNESS CALLED THE DENTON COUNTY SHERIFF’S OFFICE AND REPORTED THE INCIDENT. TWO DENTON COUNTY DEPUTIES RESPONDED AND MET THE WITNESS OUTSIDE THE RESIDENCE. THE WITNESS ADVISED THE DEPUTIES TO ENTER THE RESIDENCE THROUGH THE OPEN GARAGE. AS DEPUTIES ENTERED THE RESIDENCE THROUGH THE KITCHEN AREA, THEY OBSERVED THE WEST, ANNOUNCED THEIR PRESENCE AND DIRECTED HIM TO SHOW THEM HIS HANDS. AT THIS POINT WEST TURNED TOWARDS THE DEPUTIES AND FIRED ONE ROUND FROM HIS SHOTGUN. BOTH DEPUTIES RETURNED FIRE AND WEST WAS STRUCK MULTIPLE TIMES. EMS ARRIVED A SHORT TIME LATER, BY THEN WEST HAD EXPIRED AND WAS ANNOUNCED DEAD ON THE SCENE. THIS INVESTIGATION WAS TURNED OVER TO THE TEXAS RANGERS.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE; HOSTAGE/BARRICADE/OTHER EMERG SITUATION
incident_call_other: BARRICADED SUBJECT WITH A GUN, AGGRAVATED ASSAULTED AGAINST A PEACE OFFICER. RESULTED IN HER DEATH.
cdr_narrative: EL PASO POLICE OFFICERS WERE DISPATCHED TO A SUBJECT WITH A GUN AT 5150 EL PASO DR. (FOOD STAMP OFFICE).OFFICERS ARRIVED ON SCENE AND EVACUATED THE BUILDING CONTAINING .DECEDENT WAS BARRICADED AND SHE HAD THREATENED PARTIES IN THE BUILDING WITH A GUN. THE DECEDENT EXITED THE OFFICE SHE WAS BARRICADED AFTER CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 HOURS OF FAILED NEGOTIATIONS AND POINTED A WEAPON AT SWAT OFFICERS. ONE SWAT OFFICER FIRED HIS SERVICE RIFLE, ULTIMATELY LEAD TO THE DECEDENT'S DEATH.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON 7/13/2019, AT APPROXIMATELY 2:46PM, OFFICERS WERE DISPATCHED TO 3400 GREAT TRINITY FOREST WAY REGARDING A MALE WHO WAS SHOT. ON ARRIVAL OFFICERS OBSERVED DFR PROVIDING MEDICAL TREATMENT TO A MALE COMPLAINANT AND A WITNESS STATED THE SUBJECT RESPONSIBLE WAS DOWN THE STREET HIDING BEHIND A TRASHCAN WITH A GUN. OFFICERS CANVASSED THE AREA AND LOCATED THE SUBJECT AT THE 5000 BLOCK OF CRANFILL DRIVE. OFFICERS BELIEVED THE SUBJECT WAS ARMED AND TOOK COVER BEHIND SQUAD CARS AND GAVE THE SUBJECT VERBAL COMMANDS TO SURRENDER. CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 THE SUBJECT REACTED NEGATIVELY TO THE OFFICER’S COMMANDS AND DISCHARGED A HANDGUN MULTIPLE TIMES IN THE DIRECTION OF OFFICERS. OFFICERS RETURNED FIRE STRIKING THE SUBJECT. OFFICERS WAITED FOR A BALLISTIC SHIELD AND WHILE USING A VEHICLE ADVANCED TO THE SUBJECT. OFFICERS WERE ABLE TO HANDCUFF THE SUBJECT AND CALLED IN DFR WHO TRANSPORTED THE SUBJECT TO BAYLOR HOSPITAL WHERE HE EXPIRED FROM HIS INJURIES. SIU, THE BODY CAMERA AND DVR TEAM, THE DA’S OFFICE AND PES RESPONDED TO THE SCENE. A HANDGUN WAS RECOVERED AT THE SCENE BELONGING TO THE SUBJECT. BODY WORN CAMERA VIDEO, DASH CAMERA VIDEO, AND AIR ONE VIDEO WAS COLLECTED AND IS BEING REVIEWED. A LEICA SCAN OF THE SCENE IS BEING PRODUCED BY PES. SIU DETECTIVES REQUESTED A WALK-THROUGH, A STATEMENT, AND A BLOOD SPECIMEN FROM THE INVOLVED OFFICERS WHICH WAS DECLINED THROUGH THEIR ATTORNEY. THEIR ATTORNEY DID SCHEDULE A TIME FOR THE INVOLVED OFFICERS TO REPORT TO SIU TO PROVIDE A STATEMENT ON TUESDAY, JULY 16TH. WITNESS OFFICERS PROVIDED A WALK THROUGH AND REPORTED TO SIU AND PROVIDED A WRITTEN STATEMENT FROM THE SCENE. THE ORIGINAL COMPLAINANT WAS SHOT IN THE NECK BY SUBJECT AND TRANSPORTED TO BAYLOR HOSPITAL WITH NON-LIFE-THREATENING INJURIES. NEXT OF KIN NOTIFICATION WAS MADE BY DETECTIVE BILLINGS AT SIU TO THE SUBJECTS’ MOTHER.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE; HOSTAGE/BARRICADE/OTHER EMERG SITUATION
incident_call_other: 911 CALL FOR ASSISTANCE WHERE THE CALLER SAID MULTIPLE PEOPLE WERE BEING HELD HOSTAGE.
cdr_narrative: ON JULY 17, 2019, THE FORT WORTH POLICE DEPARTMENT RESPONDED TO A PERSON WITH A WEAPON CALL AT 2900 BROADMOOR DRIVE, APARTMENT 1305. MARKEVVION CANNON WAS HOLDING MULTIPLE PEOPLE HOSTAGE (HIS CHILD'S MOTHER; HER 3 SIBLINGS AGES 19, 15, AND 12; HER 20 YEAR OLD FEMALE FRIEND; AND THEIR 1 YEAR OLD SON), AND HE CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 WAS ARMED WITH A GUN. AS OFFICERS ARRIVED ON SCENE, MARKEVVION'S CHILD'S MOTHER, WHO WAS HOLDING THEIR SON, AND HER 20 YEAR OLD FRIEND RAN OUT OF THE APARTMENT; LEAVING THE 19, 15, AND 12 YEAR OLD HOSTAGES INSIDE. AS OFFICERS WERE TRYING TO GET MARKEVVION TO COME OUT OF THE APARTMENT, MARKEVVION BEGAN FIRING MULTIPLE OFFICERS AS THEY STOOD AT THE APARTMENT DOOR AND THE OFFICERS IN THE PARKING LOT. THE OFFICERS STANDING AT THE DOOR SAW THAT MARKEVVION WAS USING TWO OF THE HOSTAGES TO SHIELD HIMSELF FROM THE OFFICERS AS HE FIRED UPON THEM. FWPD SWAT TEAM MEMBERS ARRIVED AND CONDUCTED A HOSTAGE RESCUE. WHEN THE SWAT OFFICERS ENTERED THE APARTMENT, MARKEVVION WAS IN A WALK-IN CLOSET WITH THE 15 AND 12 YEAR OLD HOSTAGES POSITIONED DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF HIM, AND THE 19 YEAR OLD HOSTAGE WAS ALSO IN THE CLOSET. WHEN SWAT OFFICER A. ALESHIRE, ID 3934 ENTERED THE CLOSET, MARKEVVION POINTED HIS HANDGUN AT OFFICER ALESHIRE. OFFICER ALESHIRE BELIEVED HE WAS IN IMMINENT DANGER OF SERIOUS BODILY INJURY OR DEATH. HE MOVED FORWARD AND GRABBED MARKEVVION'S HANDGUN TO POINT IT AWAY FROM HIMSELF AND TOWARDS THE CEILING. MARKEVVION STRUGGLED AGAINST OFFICER ALESHIRE TO KEEP THE GUN POINTED AT THE OFFICER. DURING THIS STRUGGLE, OFFICER ALESHIRE MOVED SO THAT HIS DUTY HANDGUN WAS PAST THE HOSTAGES AND THEN HE FIRED HIS HANDGUN AT MARKEVVION, STRIKING HIM IN THE HEAD. MARKEVVION WAS TAKEN TO A MEDSTAR AMBULANCE FOR MEDICAL TREATMENT AND TRANSPORTATION TO JOHN PETER SMITH HOSPITAL WHERE HE WAS LATER PRONOUNCED DECEASED.

incident_result_of: HOSTAGE/BARRICADE/OTHER EMERG SITUATION
incident_call_other: TACTICAL TEAM CALL-OUT FOR BARRICADED/SUICIDAL INDIVIDUAL WHO WAS ARMED WITH AN ASSAULT RIFLE AND HAD ALREADY FIRED ROUNDS; DISTURBANCE AT A SINGLE FAMILY RESIDENCE INVOLVING A SUBJECT ARMED WITH A RIFLE AND WEARING A BULLET PROOF VEST. MALE MADE THREATS TO COMMIT SUICIDE AND ENGAGE IN A SHOOTOUT WITH OFFICERS.
cdr_narrative: OFFICER RESPONDED TO A CALL FOR ASSISTANCE FROM THE MOTHER OF THE DECEASED. THE MOTHER ADVISED THAT HER SON WAS THREATENING TO COMMIT SUICIDE AND BELIEVED THE SON MAY ALSO KILL HER. UPON THE ARRIVAL OF THE OFFICERS, THE MALE ENTERED HIS HOME FROM THE DRIVEWAY. THE MOTHER ADVISED HER SON WAS NOW ARMED WITH A RIFLE AND A BULLET PROOF VEST. SHE STATED THAT HER SON THREATENED TO ENGAGE IN A SHOOT OUT WITH OFFICERS AND THAT HE PLANNED TO DIE THAT NIGHT. SWAT OFFICERS AND HOSTAGE NEGOTIATORS WERE CALLED TO THE SCENE. THEY ESTABLISHED CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 CONTACT WITH THE MALE OVER THE PHONE IN AN ATTEMPT TO HAVE THE MALE COME OUT OF THE HOME PEACEFULLY. THE MALE FIRED SEVERAL ROUNDS THROUGH THE FRONT DOOR BECAUSE HE BELIEVED THE OFFICER WAS STANDING AT THE FRONT DOOR. THE NEGOTIATORS CONTINUED SPEAKING WITH THE MALE AND REQUESTED THAT HE COME OUT OF THE HOME. THE MALE SAID HE WAS COMING OUT OF THE HOME BUT HE WAS NOT LEAVING HIS RIFLE AS THE NEGOTIATORS ASKED HIM TO DO SEVERAL TIMES. THE MALE SUBJECT STATED THAT HE WANTED TO DIE AND TO HAVE THE SWAT OFFICERS KILL HIM. A SECOND NEGOTIATOR TOOK OVER THE COMMUNICATION IN AN ATTEMPT TO GET THE SUBJECT TO PEACEFULLY EXIT THE RESIDENCE. THE SUBJECT EXITED THE RESIDENCE WITH THE RIFLE WHICH WAS EQUIPPED WITH A 100 ROUND DRUM MAGAZINE, AND A BULLET PROOF VEST. THE MALE WAS ADVISED MULTIPLE TIMES TO DROP THE RIFLE WHICH HE REFUSED. THE MALE WAS HOLDING THE RIFLE IN A VERTICAL POSITION WHILE LOOKING AT THE OFFICERS IN FRONT OF HIM. THE SUBJECT MOVED HIS HANDS TO GRIP THE FRONT OF THE RIFLE AND PLACED HIS FINGER ON THE TRIGGER AS HE LOWERED THE RIFLE INTO A SHOOTING STANCE. THE SWAT OFFICERS FIRED AND THE MALE WAS PRONOUNCED DECEASED ON THE SCENE.
