incident_call_other: OFFICERS WERE FLAGGED DOWN REGARDING A MALE WITH A GUN.
cdr_narrative: LOCATION: 6700 S. LANCASTER ROAD DATE: JULY 27, 2019 TIME: 10:09 P.M. CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 INVOLVED OFFICERS: TENURE: DUTY STATION: NARCISSE, JARDON #11231 2 YEARS 9 MONTHS SOUTH CENTRAL PATROL PORTILLO, JOEL #11243 2 YEARS 8 MONTHS SOUTH CENTRAL PATROL KANIA, MATTHEW #10993 4 YEARS 4 MONTHS SOUTH CENTRAL PATROL PROCK, GEORGE #8288 17 YEARS, 0 MONTHS CANINE SUBJECT: MUHAMMAD, JAMAL B/M, 5-17-1977 **NOT CONFIRMED. WAITING ON M.E. TO IDENTIFY SYNOPSIS OF OFFICER INVOLVED SHOOTING AT 6700 S. LANCASTER ROAD: ON 7/27/2019, AT APPROXIMATELY 10:09PM, OFFICERS WERE FLAGGED DOWN BY A CITIZEN WHO STATED A MALE WAS POINTING A GUN AT PASSING VEHICLES AROUND THE INTERSECTION OF S. LANCASTER ROAD AND SIMPSON STUART ROAD. OFFICERS LOCATED THE SUBJECT AND OBSERVED HIM DISCHARGE A WEAPON ONE TIME. OFFICERS PURSUED THE SUBJECT AND DISCHARGED THEIR WEAPONS AFTER THE SUBJECT POINTED A PISTOL IN THEIR DIRECTION. THE SUBJECT WAS STRUCK MULTIPLE TIMES AND TRANSPORTED TO METHODIST CHARLTON HOSPITAL BY DALLAS FIRE RESCUE WHERE HE EXPIRED FROM HIS INJURIES. SIU, THE BODY CAMERA AND DVR TEAM, THE DA’S OFFICE, AND PES RESPONDED TO THE SCENE. A HANDGUN WAS RECOVERED AT THE SCENE BELONGING TO THE SUBJECT. BODY WORN CAMERA VIDEO AND DASH CAMERA VIDEO WAS COLLECTED AND IS BEING REVIEWED. A LEICA SCAN OF THE SCENE IS BEING PRODUCED BY PES. SIU DETECTIVES REQUESTED A WALK-THROUGH, A STATEMENT, AND A BLOOD SPECIMEN FROM THE INVOLVED OFFICERS WHICH WAS DECLINED THROUGH THEIR ATTORNEY. THEIR ATTORNEY DID SCHEDULE A TIME FOR THE INVOLVED OFFICERS TO REPORT TO SIU TO PROVIDE STATEMENTS ON TUESDAY, JULY 30TH. WITNESS OFFICERS REPORTED TO SIU AND PROVIDED A WRITTEN STATEMENT FROM THE SCENE BUT DID NOT OBSERVE THE SHOOTING THEREFORE UNABLE TO PROVIDE A WALK-THROUGH. NO OFFICERS WERE INJURED DURING THE INCIDENT. NEXT OF KIN NOTIFICATION IS PENDING A POSITIVE IDENTIFICATION FROM THE MEDICAL EXAMINERS’ OFFICE. THIS IS AN ON-GOING INVESTIGATION.

incident_result_of: EXECUTION OF A WARRANT
EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON JULY 28, 2019, HARRIS COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE DEPUTIES RESPONDED TO A CAR-JACKING CALL FOR SERVICE. APPROXIMATELY 30 MINUTES LATER, A K-9 DEPUTY LOCATED THE COMPLAINANT'S VEHICLE PARKED AT AN APARTMENT COMPLEX. OCCUPANTS FROM THE VEHICLE IMMEDIATELY FLED ON FOOT . THE K-9 DEPUTY RETRIEVED HIS DOG AND A FOOT CHASE ENSUED. THE DEPUTY RELEASED HIS DOG, WHO CAUGHT AND DETAINED ONE OF THE SUSPECTS. THE DEPUTY CAUGHT UP TO THE DOWNED SUSPECT AND OBSERVED THE SUSPECT STRIKING HIS DOG WITH A HANDGUN. THE DEPUTY DISCHARGED HIS HANDGUN AND STRUCK THE SUSPECT. EMS PARAMEDICS DETERMINED THE SUSPECT HAD NO SIGNS OF LIFE.

incident_result_of: EXECUTION OF A WARRANT
cdr_narrative: ON 07-31-2019 AT APPROXIMATELY 09:15 A.M., MEMBERS OF THE UNITED STATES MARSHALS LONE STAR FUGITIVE TASK FORCE SAN ANTONIO DIVISION ALONG WITH MEMBERS OF THE OFFICE OF THE ATTORNEY GENERAL OF TEXAS, FUGITIVE APPREHENSION UNIT WERE ATTEMPTING TO APPREHEND JOSE BACA-OLIVARES, HISPANIC MALE, DATE OF BIRTH: 05-25-1961, IN REFERENCE TO MULTIPLE OUTSTANDING WARRANTS ISSUED OUT OF BEXAR COUNTY, TEXAS FOR MURDER, AGGRAVATED ASSAULT WITH A DEADLY WEAPON X 2, AND CONTINUOUS VIOLENCE AGAINST FAMILY. TASK FORCE AND OFFICE OF ATTORNEY GENERAL OFFICERS LOCATED BACA-OLIVARES IN HIS VEHICLE PARKED IN THE PARKING LOT OF THE TEXAS CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 DIABETES INSTITUTE NEAR THE 2700 BLOCK OF SAN LUIS STREET, SAN ANTONIO, TEXAS 78207. UPON ATTEMPTING TO EFFECT THE ARREST AS OFFICERS APPROACHED BACA-OLIVARES'S VEHICLE, HE DISPLAYED AND FIRED UPON OFFICERS WITH A HANDGUN. THREE OFFICERS RESPONDED WITH DEADLY FORCE. TASK FORCE OFFICERS ON SCENE ATTEMPTED TO PROVIDE MEDICAL ATTENTION WITH EMERGENCY MEDICAL SERVICES ARRIVING SHORTLY AFTER. BACA-OLIVARES DIED FROM HIS INJURIES ON SCENE.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON 7/31/2019, AUSTIN POLICE OFFICERS WERE DISPATCHED TO A CHECK WELFARE URGENT CALL AT 300 BOWIE ST. THERE WERE MULTIPLE CALLS TO 911 MADE BY CITIZENS. ONE 911 CALLER SAID THERE WAS AN INDIVIDUAL WHO WAS HOLDING A LARGE BUTCHER KNIFE AND WAS NOW WALKING BACK INTO THE CONDOMINIUMS. ANOTHER 911 CALLER STATED THEY OBSERVED THE SUBJECT HOLDING THE KNIFE TO THEIR OWN NECK. ONCE OFFICERS ARRIVED AT THE SCENE, THEY WERE NOTIFIED BY BUILDING EMPLOYEES THAT THE SUBJECT WITH THE KNIFE WAS IN THE BUILDING NEAR WHERE THE GYM/FITNESS CENTER IS LOCATED. OFFICERS THEN RESPONDED TO THE AREA OF THE GYM/FITNESS CENTER. AS THE ELEVATOR DOORS OPENED, OFFICERS IMMEDIATELY ENCOUNTERED THE SUBJECT WITH THE KNIFE. OFFICERS GAVE VERBAL COMMANDS TO THE INDIVIDUAL TO DROP THE WEAPON. THE SUBJECT DID NOT COMPLY WITH THE OFFICERS VERBAL COMMANDS AND PROCEEDED TO WALK TOWARDS THE OFFICERS WITH THE KNIFE IN THE RIGHT HAND. THE OFFICERS FEARING FOR THEIR LIFE AND SAFETY OF EACH OTHER, FIRED THEIR WEAPONS AT THE SUBJECT. THE OFFICERS ADMINISTERED FIRST AID TO THE SUBJECT WHO WAS TRANSPORTED TO THE HOSPITAL. THE SUBJECT WAS PRONOUNCED DECEASED AT 6:07 PM.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: OFFICERS RESPONDED TO A CRIMINAL TRESPASSING CALL. THE VEHICLE INVOLVED IN THE CALL HAD BEEN REPORTED AS BEING TAKEN IN AN AGGRAVATED ROBBERY ON 8/2/2019. OFFICERS LOCATED THE VEHICLE IN THE PARKING LOT AT 1600 PINE TREE ROAD. WHEN OFFICERS ATTEMPTED TO CHECK ON THE VEHICLE AND SEE IF IT WAS OCCUPIED, A PASSENGER EXITED AND FLED ON FOOT. THE DRIVER OF THE VEHICLE EXITED THE VEHICLE. THE DRIVER IGNORED OFFICERS' VERBAL COMMANDS AND THEN POINTED A HANDGUN AT THE OFFICERS. THE OFFICERS FIRED THEIR HANDGUNS AND STRUCK THE SUSPECT. OFFICERS RENDERED MEDICAL CARE UNTIL EMS ARRIVED. THE SUSPECT WAS TRANSPORTED TO THE HOSPITAL WHERE HE WAS LATER PRONOUNCED DEAD.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON AUGUST 9, 2019 AT 10:24 P.M. THE GARLAND POLICE DEPARTMENT BEGAN RECEIVING CALLS OF A MALE SUBJECT IN THE PARKING LOT AT 3610 BOBTOWN ROAD, WHO WAS BRANDISHING A WEAPON AND DAMAGING VEHICLES. OFFICERS N. SWAVEY AND J. BETHEL WERE DISPATCHED TO THE SCENE. UPON ARRIVING, THE OFFICERS ENCOUNTERED JASON X. SALAS. MR. SALAS WAS WIELDING TWO LARGE KNIVES. THE OFFICERS GAVE MR. SALAS MULTIPLE VERBAL COMMANDS TO DROP THE KNIVES. MR. SALAS IGNORED THE COMMANDS. MR. SALAS RAISED THE KNIVES IN A THREATENING MANNER AND ADVANCED TOWARD THE OFFICERS. BOTH OFFICERS FIRED THEIR DUTY WEAPONS, STRIKING MR. SALAS. MR. SALAS WAS TAKEN TO A HOSPITAL WHERE HE LATER DIED FROM HIS INJURIES

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: OFFICERS DISPATCHED TO INVESTIGATE A POSSIBLE FAMILY VIOLENCE ASSAULT. UPON ARRIVAL OFFICERS SEPARATED PARTIES INVOLVED; HUSBAND AND WIFE. THE HUSBAND TOLD OFFICERS THAT HE WAS LAW ENFORCEMENT. THE WIFE WENT OUTSIDE OF THE HOUSE TO TALK WITH OFFICERS AND THE SUSPECT REMAINED INSIDE THE HOUSE. THE WIFE SAID THAT SHE AND HER HUSBAND, THE SUSPECT, WERE ARGUING AND THAT HE HAD ACCUSED HER OF BEING UNFAITHFUL AND DEMANDED THAT SHE GIVE HIM ACCESS TO HER CELL PHONE. WHEN HE WAS UNABLE TO ACCESS HER CELL PHONE, HE WENT TO THE KITCHEN AND CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 GOT A SERRATED KITCHEN KNIFE AND THREATENED HER WITH IT. THE OFFICERS THEN ENTERED THE HOUSE TO TALK WITH THE SUSPECT. THE SUSPECT HAD MOVED INTO THE LIVING AREA AND WAS SEATED ON A COUCH. AS OFFICERS ENTERED THE HOUSE AND WERE STANDING INSIDE THE HALLWAY, THE SUSPECT ASKED IF HE WAS GOING TO JAIL. THE OFFICERS TOLD THEM THAT THEY WANTED TO TALK TO HIM ABOUT THE INCIDENT. THE SUSPECT STOOD UP, FACED THE OFFICERS, RAISED HIS SHIRT WITH HIS LEFT HAND TO DISPLAY A HANDGUN THAT WAS HOLSTERED IN HIS RIGHT FRONT WAISTBAND. THE OFFICERS BEGAN TO GIVE HIM COMMANDS TO NOT REACH FOR THE HANDGUN. THE SUSPECT TOLD THE OFFICERS THAT HE WAS NOT GOING TO GO TO JAIL AS HE REACHED DOWN WITH HIS RIGHT HAND, PULLED HIS HANDGUN OUT OF THE HOLSTER AND BEGAN TO RAISE THE HANDGUN AT THE OFFICERS. ONE OFFICER FIRED HIS HANDGUN THREE TIMES AND THE PROJECTILES STRUCK THE SUSPECT. THE SUSPECT COLLAPSED TO THE GROUND. THE SUSPECT WAS PRONOUNCED DECEASED BY MEDICAL PERSONNEL.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON THURSDAY, AUGUST 15, AT APPROXIMATELY 11:09 P.M., HOUSTON POLICE OFFICERS ASSIGNED TO THE NORTHEAST PATROL DIVISION WERE DISPATCHED TO A "WELFARE CHECK" CALL AT 2406 CHARLES ROAD. UPON ARRIVAL OFFICERS OBSERVED A HISPANIC MALE, LATER IDENTIFIED AS JOSE LUIS CAMPOS JR., STANDING IN THE MIDDLE OF THE STREET HOLDING A HANDGUN. OFFICERS GAVE VERBAL ORDERS AND ATTEMPTED TO GET MR. CAMPOS TO DROP THE WEAPON. MR. CAMPOS THEN PUT THE FIREARM TO THIS HEAD AND ADVISED OFFICERS THEY WOULD HAVE TO SHOOT HIM. MR. CAMPOS DISCHARGED HIS FIREARM AT WHICH POINT OFFICER J. A. WHITE BECAME IN FEAR OF THIS LIFE AND FELLOW OFFICERS. OFFICER WHITE DISCHARGED HIS WEAPON ONCE AT MR. CAMPOS WAS PRONOUNCED DEAD AT THE SCENE. A PRELIMINARY INVESTIGATION BY MEDICAL EXAMINER DETERMINED MR. CAMPOS DIED FROM A CLOSE RANGE GUNSHOT TO THIS HEAD. OFFICER WHITE DOES NOT APPEAR TO HAVE STRUCK R. CAMPOS, WHEN OFFICER DISCHARGED HIS LONG RIFLE. OFFICIAL AUTOPSY IS STILL PENDING***********

incident_result_of: TRAFFIC STOP
cdr_narrative: ON AUGUST 17, 2019, AT APPROXIMATELY 10:57 P.M., TROOPER ROBERT LITVIN, IN A PATROL UNIT ALSO OCCUPIED BY TROOPER JOSHUA ENGLEMAN, ATTEMPTED TO STOP A TOYOTA CAMRY FOR FAILING TO SIGNAL A TURN IN DALLAS, TEXAS. THE CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 DRIVER, LATER IDENTIFIED AS SCHASTON THEODORE LAMARR HODGE, DID NOT STOP, AND A PURSUIT ENSUED. AFTER EVADING FOR SEVERAL MINUTES, HODGE PULLED INTO THE DRIVEWAY OF A RESIDENCE AND STOPPED. HODGE GOT OUT OF THE VEHICLE, POINTED A HANDGUN AT THE TROOPERS, AND FIRED. IN RESPONSE, BOTH TROOPERS RETURNED FIRE WITH THEIR SERVICE PISTOLS, STRIKING HODGE. THE TROOPERS IMMEDIATELY APPLIED FIRST AID TO HODGE UNTIL HE WAS TRANSPORTED TO THE HOSPITAL. HODGE WAS LATER DECLARED DECEASED BY THE HOSPITAL STAFF AT APPROXIMATELY 11:42 P.M.

incident_result_of: OTHER
incident_call_other: THE OFFICER WAS HEADED HOME AFTER HAVING WORKED A "SIDE JOB" WHEN THE SUSPECT BEGAN TAILGATING THE OFFICER, FLASHING HIS LIGHTS AT THE OFFICER AND "BRAKE CHECKING" HIM. EVENTUALLY THE OFFICER PULLED OVER ALLOWING THE SUSPECT SOME SPACE TO KEEP GOING. THE SUSPECT RETURNED, PRODUCED A FIREARM AND THREATENED THE OFFICER AT WHICH TIME THE OFFICER HAD ALSO PULLED HIS FIREARM AND FEARING FOR HIS SAFETY, FIRED AT THE SUSPECT HITTING HIM ONCE. THE SUSPECT SPED OFF BUT SURVIVED.

incident_result_of: TRAFFIC STOP; OTHER
incident_call_other: OFFICERS WERE ORIGINALLY DISPATCHED TO AN AGGRAVATED ROBBERY OF AN INDIVIDUAL THAT HAD JUST OCCURRED. SEVERAL MALES, ARMED WITH HANDGUNS ROBBED THE VICTIM IN THE STREET. THE VICTIM WAS NOT SHOT, BUT WAS STRUCK WITH A FIREARM. THE SUSPECTS FLED THE SCENE AND A DESCRIPTION OF THE SUSPECT VEHICLE WAS PROVIDED. THE INVOLVED OFFICER LOCATED THE SUSPECT VEHICLE AND ATTEMPTED TO INITIATE A TRAFFIC STOP. A VEHICLE PURSUIT, FOLLOWED BY A FOOT PURSUIT ENSUED. DURING THE FOOT PURSUIT, ONE SUSPECT FIRED AT THE INVOLVED OFFICERS POLICE CANINE (AND POSSIBLY THE OFFICER), STRIKING IT TWICE. THE OFFICER RETURNED FIRE, STRIKING THE SUSPECT ONCE.

incident_result_of: OTHER
incident_call_other: ASSISTING HOMICIDE UNIT DETECTIVES WITH A PERSON OF INTEREST. CONDUCTING A CONSENSUAL ENCOUNTER ON FOOT.
cdr_narrative: ON WEDNESDAY, AUGUST 21, 2019, FORT WORTH POLICE DEPARTMENT HOMICIDE UNIT DETECTIVES REACHED OUT FOR ASSISTANCE FROM ONE OF THE FWPD SPECIAL RESPONSE TEAMS IN LOCATING A PERSON OF INTEREST FROM A HOMICIDE THAT TOOK PLACE ON AUGUST 5, 2019. OFFICERS WENT TO THE LOCATION THEY WERE GIVEN WHERE MALONE WAS POSSIBLY STAYING IN THE WOODHAVEN NEIGHBORHOOD. THE LOCATION WAS 6065 STONEYBROOK #6065 WHICH IS JUST SOUTH FROM THE INTERSECTION OF 5900 OAKLAND HILLS DRIVE AND 5900 BOCA RATON BOULEVARD. OFFICERS ENTERED THE APARTMENT COMPLEX AND PARKED IN THEIR UNDERCOVER VEHICLE IN A LOCATION WHERE THEY COULD MONITOR THE APARTMENT. MALONE CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 EXITED THE APARTMENT JUST AFTER 5:00 P.M. AND WALKED THROUGH THE PARKING LOT TOWARD OAKLAND HILLS DRIVE. MALONE CONTINUED WALKING NORTH TOWARD BOCA RATON BOULEVARD WHERE HE MET UP WITH AN INDIVIDUAL LATER IDENTIFIED AS HIS BROTHER AT THE DIAMOND MINI MART WHICH IS LOCATED ON THE SOUTHEAST CORNER OF OAKLAND HILLS AND BOCA RATON. OFFICERS FOLLOWED HIM IN THE UNDERCOVER VEHICLE AND THEN PARKED NORTH OF THE BUSINESS AND CONTINUED TO MONITOR MALONE. THE TEAM HAD SEVERAL OTHER OFFICERS FROM THEIR TEAM STANDING BY IN MARKED PATROL VEHICLES. THEY WERE TO MAKE CONTACT WITH MALONE TO CONDUCT A CONSENSUAL ENCOUNTER IN HOPES OF HAVING HIM AGREE TO VOLUNTARILY TALK WITH THE HOMICIDE DETECTIVES. AFTER A SHORT TIME, OFFICERS INSIDE THE UNDERCOVER TRUCK OBSERVED WHAT THEY BELIEVED TO BE THE BUTT END OF THE MAGAZINE FROM A HANDGUN IN MALONES ATHLETIC SHORTS. THE SHORTS WERE SAGGING AS IF THERE WERE SOMETHING HEAVY IN HIS POCKET. BECAUSE THERE WAS A LARGE GROUP OF INDIVIDUALS GATHERED LOITERING IN THE SAME AREA WHERE MALONE WAS STANDING, OFFICERS MADE THE DECISION TO WAIT UNTIL MOST HAD DISPERSED BEFORE MAKING CONTACT WITH MALONE. THE OFFICERS ADVISED THE MARKED UNIT OFFICERS THAT THEY WERE READY TO MOVE IN AND MAKE CONTACT WITH MALONE AND TOLD THEM THEY BELIEVED HE WAS ARMED WITH A HANDGUN CONCEALED IN HIS PANTS. A MARKED UNIT APPROACHED FROM THE SOUTH AND ENTERED THE STORE PARKING LOT AND THE UNDERCOVER TRUCK APPROACHED FROM THE NORTH. THE OFFICER IN THE MARKED PATROL VEHICLE OPENED HIS DRIVERS DOOR AND CALLED OUT TO MALONE, "HEY, CAN I TALK TO YOU FOR A MINUTE?". MALONE WAS WALKING SOUTH DOWN THE COVERED SIDEWALK NEXT TO THE EAST SIDE OF THE STORE. THE MINUTE THE OFFICERS APPROACHED, MALONE TURNED TOWARD STREET AND RAN. SEVERAL OFFICERS BEGAN TO CHASE MALONE AND AS HE RAN HE PULLED A HANDGUN FROM HIS RIGHT POCKET WITH HIS LEFT HAND. OFFICERS YELLED, "GUN. GUN. GUN.". FOUR OFFICERS WERE PURSUING MALONE AND AS HE ENTERED OAKLAND HILLS DRIVE, MALONE TURNED HIS UPPER BODY TOWARD THE LEFT AND POINTED THE HANDGUN DIRECTLY BACK TOWARD THE OFFICERS. ALL FOUR OFFICERS FIRED AT MALONE; TWO OFFICERS IN THEIR STATEMENTS BELIEVED THAT HE FIRED HIS HANDGUN AT THEM. (BALLISTICS ARE NOT BACK YET TO CONFIRM). MALONE CONTINUED TO RUN SOUTHWEST ACROSS THE STREET STILL POINTING THE HANDGUN AT THE OFFICERS. OFFICERS FIRED THE HANDGUNS SEVERAL MORE TIMES. MALONE FELL TO THE GROUND ON THE WEST SIDE OF THE STREET IN THE GRASSY AREA BETWEEN THE STREET AND THE SIDEWALK. OFFICERS APPROACHED AND WERE ABLE TO GET HIM HANDCUFFED. A TAURUS 24/7 .45 CALIBER HANDGUN WAS LOCATED NEAR MALONE IN THE GRASS. OFFICERS LOCATED A GUNSHOT WOUND ON MALONE'S UPPER LEFT BACK JUST TO THE LEFT OF HIS SPINE. OFFICERS REQUESTED MEDSTAR AMBULANCE MAKE THE SCENE AND THEY PROVIDED MEDICAL TREATMENT UNTIL THE MEDICAL PERSONNEL ARRIVED ON THE SCENE. MALONE WAS TRANSPORTED TO HARRIS METHODIST HOSPITAL WHERE HE WAS PRONOUNCED DECEASED A SHORT TIME LATER.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE; OTHER
cdr_narrative: ON AUGUST 31, 2019 A TRAFFIC STOP WAS INITIATED BY DPS IN MIDLAND. THE DRIVER OPENED FIRE ON THE DPS TROOPER AND FLED THE SCENE. THE DRIVER THEN PROCEEDED THROUGH THE CITY OF ODESSA SHOOTING SEVERAL CIVILIANS. THE SUSPECT THEN SHOT AND KILLED A MAIL CARRIER AND TOOK THE MAIL CARRIER’S GOVERNMENT VEHICLE. THE SUSPECT CONTINUED SHOOTING CIVILIANS MAKING HIS WAY TO A CROWDED THEATER. THE SUSPECT THEN SHOT AT POLICE OFFICERS. CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 THE SUSPECT THEN INTENTIONALLY RAN INTO A MARKED POLICE UNIT WHERE LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS SHOT AND KILLED THE SUSPECT. AT THE TIME THE SUSPECT WAS KILLED THERE WERE 21 INJURED AND 5 CONFIRMED KILLED. A FEW DAYS LATER THERE WERE 7 CONFIRMED KILLED DURING THE INCIDENT.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE; OTHER
incident_call_other: SUSPICIOUS PERSON / MAN WITH A KNIFE.
cdr_narrative: ON 9/1/19 AT APPROXIMATELY 1538 HOURS, OFFICERS WERE DISPATCHED TRACTOR SUPPLY 1305 SIDNEY BAKER, KERRVILLE, KERR COUNTY, TEXAS, REGARDING A WHITE MALE CARRYING A LARGE KNIFE AND SHOWING PEOPLE THE KNIFE AS THEY DRIVE PAST THE SUBJECT. AT APPROXIMATELY 1543 HOURS, THE UNIFORMED OFFICER MAKES CONTACT WITH THE SUBJECT WHO IS WALKING SOUTHBOUND IN THE 1000 BLOCK OF SIDNEY BAKER ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE ROADWAY. UPON CONTACT WITH THE OFFICER, THE SUBJECT DISPLAYS THE KNIFE AND CONTINUOUSLY APPROACHES THE OFFICER. APPROXIMATELY 52 SECONDS, CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 AFTER INITIAL CONTACT, THE OFFICER SHOOTS HRANICKY IN THE PARKING LOT OF TEXAS TOBACCO LOCATED AT 921 SIDNEY BAKER, KERRVILLE, KERR COUNTY, TEXAS. THE OFFICER PULLS ONTO WHELESS AVENUE SOUTH OF THE SUBJECT WHO IS WALKING SOUTHBOUND ON THE EAST SIDE OF SIDNEY BAKER ENTERING THE 900 BLK WITH HIS OVERHEAD LIGHTS ACTIVATED AND EXITS THE VEHICLE. HE BEGINS TO TRY TO SPEAK WITH THE SUBJECT WHO HAS A JACKET AND KNIFE IN HIS HANDS. THE SUBJECT MOMENTARILY STOPS, PUSHES EYE GLASSES ON AND THEN WALKS A FEW STEPS TO ALMOST THE CENTER OF WHELESS AVENUE WHEN HE STOPS AND TURNS HIS BACK TO THE OFFICER. THE SUBJECT HAS HIS JACKET IN HIS HAND AND AS HE TURNS HIS BACK HIS HANDS ARE MOVING. THE OFFICER VERBALIZES "HOW YOU DOING? WHATS GOING ON? HEY JUST LEAVE THE KNIFE WHERE ITS AT MAN. WHAT ARE YOU DOING? YOU'RE NOT IN TROUBLE." AS THE SUBJECT HAS HIS BACK TURNED AND MOVING HIS HANDS, THE KNIFE FALLS TO THE GROUND CLATTERING AS IT HITS. THE JACKET IS STILL IN THE SUBJECTS HAND BUT THEN HE INTENTIONALLY DROPS THE JACKET IN THE ROADWAY. THE OFFICER VERBALIZES "OKAY, LEAVE IT." THE SUBJECT BENDS OVER, BENDING AT THE WAIST WITH A SLIGHT BEND AT THE KNEES AND PICKS THE KNIFE UP FROM THE GROUND. HE THEN TURNS TO FACE THE OFFFICER WHO VERBALIZES "WHAT ARE YOU DOING?" THE SUBJECT BEGINS WALKING TOWARDS THE OFFICER WITH THE KNIFE POINT DOWN IN HIS RIGHT HAND AND HIS LEFT HAND PUSHING HIS EYE GLASSES UP. THE OFFICER DRAWS HIS WEAPON AND IS AT THE LOW READY AS HE BEGINS BACKING UP. THE OFFICER VERBALIZES "WHAT ARE YOU DOING? DON'T DO THIS. DROP THE KNIFE! DROP THE KNIFE." THE SUBJECT, AS HE CONTINUES TO WALK TOWARDS THE OFFICER, PLACES HIS LEFT HAND OVER THE CENTER OF HIS CHEST AND TAPS HIS CHEST AND TELLS THE OFFICER "HIT ME RIGHT HERE. ALRIGHT?" THE SUBJECT CONTINUES TO ADVANCE ON THE OFFICER AS THE OFFICER BACKS UP AND CONTINUES TO VERBALIZE "DROP THE KNIFE. DROP THE KNIFE." THE OFFICER IS STILL RETREATING AND IS FORWARD OF THE OPEN DRIVER DOOR ON THE KPD FORD EXPLORER, AGAIN VERBALIZES "DROP IT MAN. DON'T DO THIS. DROP THE KNIFE." THE OFFICER HAS BACKED UP AND IS POSITIONED AT THE RIGHT FRONT HEADLIGHT OF THE PATROL UNIT AS THE SUBJECT IS ROUNDING THE FRONT OF THE VEHICLE. THE SUBJECT IS AT THE LEFT FRONT HEADLIGHT AS THE OFFICER IS AT THE RIGHT FRONT HEADLIGHT OF THE PATROL VEHICLE, A SEPARATION DISTANCE OF APPROXIMATELY 6 FEET. THE OFFICER CONTINUES TO RETREAT AS THE SUBJECT CONTINUES APPROACHING HIM WITH THE KNIFE STILL IN HIS RIGHT HAND. THE SUBJECT MOVES HIS LEFT HAND UP TO HIS HAT, REMOVES IT AND CONTINUES TO APPROACH WITH HIS BALL CAP IN HIS LEFT HAND, KNIFE IN HIS RIGHT HAND AS THE OFFICER RETREATS. THE OFFICER VERBALIZES "DON'T DO THIS. DROP IT. DROP IT. COME ON MAN, DROP THE KNIFE. PLEASE." THE SUBJECT PLACES HIS HAT BACK ON HIS HEAD AND CONTINUES APPROACHING THE OFFICER. THE SUBJECT CONTINUES MOVING TOWARDS THE OFFICER, PLACING HIS LEFT HAND ON THE BILL OF HIS HAT. THE KNIFE IS STILL IN HIS RIGHT HAND. THE SUBJECT IS NOW ABREAST OF THE DRIVER REAR VIEW MIRROR OF A PARKED RED VOLVO IN THE PARKING LOT OF TEXAS TOBACCO. THE OFFICER IS AT THE DRIVER REAR TIRE OF THE PARKED RED VOLVO. THE OFFICER AGAIN VERBALIZES "DROP THE KNIFE. DROP THE KNIFE, PLEASE. DROP THE KNIFE." THE SUBJECT ADVANCES ON THE OFFICER AS THE OFFICER RETREATS. THE SUBJECT IS AT THE REAR OF THE VOLVO AS THE OFFICER HAS BACKED UP INTO THE PARKING LOT. THE SUBJECT STATES "I CAN'T GO BACK" AS THE OFFICER AGAIN TELLS HIM TO "DROP THE KNIFE", THE SUBJECT AGAIN SAYS "I CAN'T GO BACK." THE SUBJECT TAKES A STEP FORWARD TO CONTINUE HIS ADVANCE ON THE OFFICER, PLACING THE OFFICER IN FEAR FOR HIS LIFE WHO THEN DISCHARGES HIS WEAPON AND STRIKING THE SUBJECT WITH A SINGLE ROUND. THE OFFICER TOLD THE SUBJECT APPROXIMATELY 13 TIME TO DROP THE KNIFE WHEREIN THE SUBJECT FAILED TO COMPLY WITH THE OFFICERS COMMANDS WHILE CONTINUALLY ADVANCING ON HIM PRIOR TO THE OFFICER FIRING HIS WEAPON. THE TOTAL TIME FROM THE INITIAL ENCOUNTER TO SHOTS FIRED IS APPROXIMATELY 52 SECONDS.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON SATURDAY 09-07-2019 SHORTLY AFTER 1:20 PM, NACOGDOCHES COMBINED DISPATCH RECEIVED A 911 CALL ABOUT A STABBING THAT OCCURRED AT HIGHWAY 103 E AND FM 95. THE CALLER ALSO ADVISED THAT THE SUSPECT THEN APPROACHED HIS VEHICLE AND ATTEMPTED TO CUT HIM WITH A KNIFE AND TAKE HIS VEHICLE. THE SUSPECT WAS OBSERVED GETTING INTO ANOTHER VEHICLE WHICH WAS A WHITE DODGE RAM PICKUP TRUCK THAT TRAVELED WESTBOUND ON HIGHWAY 103 TOWARDS ETOILE. THE WITNESS/VICTIM CONTINUED TO FOLLOW THE TRUCK AND REMAIN ON THE LINE WITH DISPATCH REPORTING INFORMATION AS IT OCCURRED. THE SUSPECT EXITED FROM THE WHITE DODGE TRUCK IN ETOILE, TEXAS AT HIGHWAY 103 E AND FM 226. IT WAS REPORTED TO DISPATCH THAT BEFORE DEPUTIES ARRIVED ON SCENE, THAT THE SUSPECT ATTEMPTED TO CAR JACK SEVERAL MORE VEHICLES ON HIGHWAY 103 E., THE SUSPECT ALSO ENTERED INTO A RESIDENCE UNLAWFULLY WHERE OTHER VICTIMS WERE ASSAULTED. A DEPUTY ARRIVED ON THE SCENE AND ATTEMPTED TO ARREST THE SUSPECT. THE SUSPECT REFUSED TO COMPLY AND DURING THE ATTEMPTED ARREST SHOTS WERE FIRED BY THE DEPUTY. EMS WAS SUMMONED TO THE SCENE AND DEPUTIES STARTED LIFE SAVING MEASURES TO INCLUDE CPR. TERRY WAYNE PHIPPS WAS PRONOUNCED DECEASED AT THE SCENE. AN AUTOPSY WAS ORDERED. THE TEXAS RANGERS WERE NOTIFIED AND CALLED TO THE SCENE. THEY WILL BE THE PRIMARY AGENCY HANDLING THE SHOOTING INVESTIGATION. THE NACOGDOCHES SHERIFF’S OFFICE WILL BE CONDUCTING AN INTERNAL INVESTIGATION INTO THE SHOOTING, AND WILL ALSO BE INVESTIGATING OTHER CRIMES THAT WERE ALLEGED TO HAVE OCCURRED ON THAT DAY BY THE SUSPECT.

incident_result_of: HOSTAGE/BARRICADE/OTHER EMERG SITUATION

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON THURSDAY, SEPTEMBER 12, 2019, AT APPROXIMATELY 10:23 P.M. A HOUSTON POLICE OFFICER WAS SHOT WHILE ASSISTING IN SEARCHING FOR ROBBERY SUSPECTS. OFFICERS WERE ATTEMPTING TO STOP FOUR BLACK MALES THAT WERE DESCRIBED AS SUSPECTS IN SEVERAL AGGRAVATED ROBBERIES (DEADLY WEAPONS). AS OFFICERS ATTEMPTED TO DETAIN THE MALES ALL FOUR MALES TOOK OFF RUNNING ON FOOT. OFFICER ROCCAFORTE CHASED MR. BELL BEHIND A RESIDENCE LOCATED AT CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 3906 TOLNAY STREET. AS OFFICER ROCCAFORTE ATTEMPTED TO PLACE MR. BELL UNDER ARREST A STRUGGLE ENSUED OVER THE OFFICER'S DUTY WEAPON. OFFICER ROCCAFORTE WAS STRUCK ONCE IN FRONT UPPER LEFT OF HIS VEST, ONCE IN THE FRONT LOWER RIGHT OF HIS VEST AND ONCE IN THE FRONT RIGHT SIDE OF HIS ABDOMEN JUST UNDER HIS VEST. OFFICER ZAUNBRECHER HEARD SCREAMING FROM THE BACK OF THE RESIDENCE. OFFICER ZAUNBRECHER ONCE IN THE BACK OF THE RESIDENCE OBSERVED OFFICER ROCCAFORTE HAD BEENSHOT AND WAS PLEADING FOR HELP. OFFICER ZAUNBRECHER THEN NOTHICED MR. BELL RAISING A FIREARM TOWARDS HIM AND OFFICER ROCCAFORTE. OFFICER ZAUNBRECHER IN FEAR OF HIS LIFE FIRED ONCE AT THE MALE. OFFICER ROCCAFORTE WAS TRANSPORTED TO MEMORIAL HERMAN AND TREATED FOR ONE GUNSHOT WOUND. IT WAS LATER LEARNED DURING AUTOPSY THAT MR. BELL WAS SHOT ONCE IN THE LEFT ELBOW AND FRONT UPPER CHEST AREA STRIKING HIS HEART.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE; HOSTAGE/BARRICADE/OTHER EMERG SITUATION
incident_call_other: SHOTS FIRED CALL SUICIDAL SUBJECT BY COP
cdr_narrative: JOSE ORONA HAD FIRED ROUNDS AT OR INTO 2 OCCUPIED HOMES. AS OFFICERS ARRIVED HE HELD HIS GUN TO HIS HEAD AND TOLD OFFICERS HE WANTED THEM TO SHOOT HIM. THIS CONTINUED FOR OVER AN HOUR WITH OFFICERS TRYING TO GET HIM TO PUT THE GUN DOWN. DURING THE EVENT HE TOLD THEM MANY TIMES HE WAS GOING TO MAKE THEM SHOOT HIM AND OFFICERS CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 TRIED TO GET HIM TO JUST PUT THE GUN DOWN AND RESOLVE THE ISSUE. ORONA EVENTUALLY RAISED THE GUN UP AND POINTED IT AT THE RESPONDING OFFICERS. THE POLICE OFFICER AND THE OFFICER HE POINTED THE GUN AT AS WELL AS ORONA ALL FIRED ALMOST SIMULTANEOUSLY. BOTH OFFICERS HIT ORONA AND HIS ROUND HIT THE WINDSHIELD OF THE POLICE CAR BEING USED AS COVER BY THE POLICE OFFICER. EMS WAS STAGED A BLOCK AWAY AND ARRIVED IN ABOUT A MINUTE BUT ORONA DIED AT THE SCENE.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON SEPTEMBER 14, 2019, OFFICERS RESPONDED TO A CALL INVOLVING AN OFFENSE OF AGGRAVATED ASSAULT WITH DEADLY WEAPON AT A RESIDENCE, WHERE THE SUSPECT WAS ALLEGEDLY ARMED WITH A BASEBALL BAT AND CAUSING INJURIES TO CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 ANOTHER. THE DAY BEFORE THIS INCIDENT, THE SAME SUSPECT MADE SUICIDAL THREATS IN THE PRESENCE OF OFFICERS AND WAS TAKEN TO A MENTAL HEALTH FACILITY BY POLICE. UPON OFFICERS’ ARRIVAL ON SEPTEMBER 14, 2019, THE SUSPECT FLED INSIDE HIS RESIDENCE AND REFUSED TO SURRENDER, AND OFFICERS UNSUCCESSFULLY ATTEMPTED TO COMMUNICATE WITH THE SUSPECT BY PHONE AND THROUGH A PUBLIC ADDRESS SYSTEM. AFTERWARDS, THE SUSPECT SUDDENLY WALKED OUT OF THE FRONT DOOR OF THE RESIDENCE, POINTING WHAT APPEARED TO BE HANDGUN (A BB GUN PISTOL RESEMBLING AN ACTUAL HANDGUN) AT OFFICERS. FEARING FOR THEIR SAFETY, OFFICERS DISCHARGED THEIR DUTY WEAPONS, STRIKING THE SUSPECT.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON SEPTEMBER 15, 2019, HARRIS COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE DEPUTIES RESPONDED TO A FAMILY DISTURBANCE. DEPUTIES ARRIVED AND SPOKE TO THE DECEDENT'S WIFE, WHO ADVISED HER HUSBAND WAS INTOXICATED, PHYSICALLY ASSAULTED HER, AND DISCHARGED A FIREARM INSIDE THEIR RESIDENCE. A DEPUTY LOCATED THE DECEDENT WALKING NEAR HIS RESIDENCE. THE DEPUTY ORDERED THE DECEDENT TO STOP AND HE REFUSED. THE DECEDENT TURNED TOWARDS THE DEPUTY AND POINTED A HANDGUN TOWARDS HIM. THE DEPUTY DISCHARGED NUMEROUS ROUNDS FROM HIS PATROL RIFLE AND STRUCK THE DECEDENT. EMS PARAMEDICS ARRIVED AND DETERMINED THE DECEDENT HAD NO SIGNS OF LIFE.

incident_result_of: EXECUTION OF A WARRANT; OTHER
cdr_narrative:
FOLLOW UP INVESTIGATION THAT THE SUBJECT WAS IN POSSESSION OF A STOLEN PICKUP AND ACTIVE WARRANTS FROM THE
STATE OF FLORIDA. CONTACT WAS MADE AT AN ASSOCIATE’S RESIDENCE WHERE THE SUBJECT WAS HIDING. OFFICERS BEGAN
TO SEARCH RESIDENCE WHEN THE SUBJECT FLED OUT OF A WINDOW. AS THE FOOT PURSUIT BEGAN THE SUBJECT FELL AND
DROPPED A GUN. THE SUBJECT RECOVERED THE WEAPON IN HIS RIGHT HAND AND CONTINUED TO FLEE FROM OFFICERS IN AN
OPEN FIELD. THE SUBJECT REFUSED TO COMPLY WITH OFFICER'S COMMANDS. THE SUBJECT WAS OBSERVED POINTING THE
WEAPON TOWARDS POLICE OFFICERS AS HE FLED. THE SUBJECT APPROACHED A SHED, THE ONLY COVER IN THE AREA, AND
BEGAN TO RUN BEHIND IT. THE SUBJECT WAS SHOT BY PURSUING DEPUTY BEFORE HE COULD REACH AN AREA OF COVER.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON MONDAY, SEPTEMBER 16, 2019, OFFICERS ASSIGNED TO THE SOUTH GESSNER CRIME SUPPRESSION TEAM (CST), WERE ON ROUTINE PATROL IN THE AREA OF 10700 S. GESSNER WHEN THEY WERE FLAGGED DOWN REGARDING A SUSPICIOUS BLACK MALE BRANDISHING A PISTOL AT THE WESTBRAE CARWASH LOCATED AT 10800 1/2 S. HOUSTON POLICE OFFICERS DONOVAN AND FOSTER DROVE TO THE CARWASH TO CONDUCT AN INVESTIGATION AND ENCOUNTERED THE SUSPECT. THE SUSPECT IMMEDIATELY FLED ON FOOT AS THE OFFICERS PULLED UP IN THEIR MARKED PATROL CAR. OFFICERS PURSUED THE SUSPECT ON FOOT GIVING HIM CLEAR AND LOUD VERBAL COMMANDS TO STOP AND NOT REACH FOR A WEAPON. AS THE SUSPECT FLED ON FOOT HE PULLED A PISTOL FROM HIS WAISTBAND, POINTED IT IN THE DIRECTION OF PURSUING OFFICERS. OFFICERS DONOVAN AND FOSTER, FEARING FOR THEIR LIVES, SHOT MULTIPLE ROUNDS IN THE SUSPECT'S DIRECTION AND STRUCK THE SUSPECT. OFFICER'S SECURED THE SUSPECT'S WEAPON AND BEGAN TO RENDER MEDICAL AID WHILE SIMULTANEOUSLY CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 CALLING FOR EMS. THE SUSPECT WAS PRONOUNCED DECEASED AT THE SCENE BY HOUSTON FIRE DEPARTMENT EMS PERSONNEL.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: MULTIPLE UNITS RESPONDED TO THE HOME OF THE DECEDENT ON THE DATE OF 09/19/2019 IN RESPONSE A DOMESTIC DISTURBANCE. WHEN UNITS ARRIVED, THE CALLING PARTY HAS BEEN PREVENTED FROM OPENING THE DOOR TO LAW ENFORCEMENT BY THE DECEDENT. WHEN THE REPORTING PARTY DID GET THE CHANGE TO OPEN THE DOOR AND THE OFFICERS ENTERED THE RESIDENCE, THEY OBSERVED SEVERAL FIREARMS LAID OUT WITH SEVERAL MAGAZINES ON DISPLAY. THE INFORMATION RECEIVED BY LAW ENFORCEMENT DISPATCH INDICATED THAT THE DECEDENT HAD MADE THE THREAT THAT SHOULD A PEACE OFFICER POINT A WEAPON AT HIM, HE WAS GOING TO FIRE AT THEM. THE DECEDENT EXITED THE BEDROOM AREA OF THE RESIDENCE WHILE HOLDING A FIREARM. HE WAS GIVEN COMMANDS TO DROP THE FIREARM AND DID NOT DO SO. CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 THE DECEDENT THEN RAISED THE FIREARM AND DISCHARGED IT AT THE OFFICERS. ALL OFFICERS PRESENT (3) THEN RETURNED FIRE AT THE DECEDENT, STRIKING AND INCAPACITATING HIM. MEDICAL ATTENTION WAS IMMEDIATELY SOUGHT FOR THE DECEDENT WHO THEN DID PASS DUE TO THE INJURIES SUSTAINED.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE; HOSTAGE/BARRICADE/OTHER EMERG SITUATION
incident_call_other: DISTURBANCE BETWEEN A HUSBAND AND WIFE.
cdr_narrative: ON 9/22/2019, AUSTIN POLICE OFFICERS RESPONDED TO A CALL OF A DISTURBANCE BETWEEN A HUSBAND AND WIFE. THE CALLER REPORTED HER HUSBAND HAD PHYSICALLY ASSAULTED HER AND THREATENED HER WITH A FIREARM. OFFICERS ARRIVED AT THE SCENE AND WERE ABLE TO RESCUE THE VICTIM. APD OFFICERS VERBALLY INSTRUCTED THE SUSPECT TO COME OUT OF THE APARTMENT WITH HIS HANDS UP, BUT HE REFUSED TO OBEY THE OFFICER'S COMMANDS. AUSTIN POLICE CALLED FOR THE APD SWAT TEAM TO RESPOND SINCE THE SUSPECT WAS ARMED AND REFUSING TO EXIT THE APARTMENT. SWAT OFFICERS ARRIVED AT THE SCENE AND ATTEMPTED TO CONTACT THE SUSPECT VIA TELEPHONE AND IN PERSON OVER THE LOUD SPEAKERS. THE SUSPECT REFUSED TO COMPLY WITH THE OFFICER'S COMMANDS TO EXIT THE APARTMENT AND PUT DOWN HIS HANDGUN. APD SWAT OFFICERS INSERTED AN IRRITANT AGENT INTO THE APARTMENT IN AN ATTEMPT TO THE GET THE SUSPECT TO EXIT THE APARTMENT. THE SUSPECT PARTIALLY OPENED THE FRONT DOOR TO THE APARTMENT AND FIRED A HANDGUN CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 SEVERAL TIMES IN THE DIRECTION OF OFFICERS. A SWAT OFFICER FIRED HIS WEAPON STRIKING THE SUSPECT. THE SUSPECT WAS PRONOUNCED DECEASED AT 9:33 PM BY DR. ESCOTT.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE

TRAFFIC STOP
EXECUTION OF A WARRANT
cdr_narrative: SWAT OFFICERS WERE EXECUTING A SEARCH WARRANT ON LOCATION INVOLVING CAPITAL MURDER SUSPECTS WHO HAD COMMITTED AN AGGRAVATED ROBBERY AND MURDER EARLIER IN THE DAY. DURING THE COMMISSION OF THE CAPITAL MURDER, THE SUSPECTS WERE ARMED WITH ASSAULT RIFLES. ON SEPTEMBER 26, 2019, AT APPROXIMATELY 12:30 A.M., SWAT OFFICERS ARRIVED ON SCENE. THE SUSPECTS BEGAN TO FLEE AS SWAT OFFICERS APPROACHED THE LOCATION. ONE OF THE FLEEING SUSPECTS WAS CARRYING AN ASSAULT RIFLE. DURING THE FOOT PURSUIT, A SWAT OFFICER FIRED HIS WEAPON STRIKING THE SUSPECT. OFFICERS ADMINISTERED FIRST AID TO THE SUSPECT, BUT HE WAS PRONOUNCED DECEASED AT THE SCENE. THERE WERE NO OTHER INJURIES REPORTED DURING THIS INCIDENT.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON SUNDAY, SEPTEMBER 29, 2019, AT APPROXIMATELY 10:42 PM, DEPUTIES RESPONDED TO 776 WEST ACCESS ROAD, LONGVIEW, GREGG COUNTY, TEXAS 75603, IN REFERENCE TO A BURGLARY OF A HABITATION THAT WAS IN PROGRESS. THE FIRST DEPUTY ON THE SCENE LOCATED SUSPECT AT THAT LOCATION, AND THE SUSPECT FLED ON FOOT TOWARDS INTERSTATE 20. THE DEPUTY PURSUED SUSPECT ON FOOT, AND INITIALLY ATTEMPTED TO STOP THE FLEEING SUSPECT WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF A TASER, HOWEVER IT WAS INEFFECTIVE. THE FOOT CHASE CONTINUED ACROSS ALL LANES OF TRAFFIC OF INTERSTATE 20, AND THE DEPUTY CAUGHT THE SUSPECT ON THE GRASS SHOULDER ON THE SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 20, JUST WEST OF MILE MARKER 591. CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 AT THE TERMINATION OF THE FOOT CHASE, THE DEPUTY AND THE SUSPECT STRUGGLED AS THE DEPUTY ATTEMPTED TO LAWFULLY PLACE THE SUSPECT INTO HANDCUFFS. THE DEPUTY WAS UNABLE TO PHYSICALLY RESTRAIN THE SUSPECT, AND THE SUSPECT WAS ABLE GET ON TOP OF THE DEPUTY WHILE THEY WERE ON THE GROUND. WHILE PINNING THE DEPUTY TO THE GROUND, THE DEPUTY WAS ABLE TO YELL AT THE SUSPECT AND ORDERED HIM TO GET OFF OF HIM, STATING THAT HE WAS UNABLE TO BREATH (WITH HIM ON HIS CHEST). AT ABOUT THIS POINT IN THE STRUGGLE, THE SUSPECT MOVED HIS HANDS TO THE DEPUTY'S THROAT, AND BEGAN CHOKING HIM TO THE POINT THAT HE FELT IN FEAR FOR HIS LIFE. AS THE SUSPECT CONTINUED TO CHOKE THE DEPUTY, THE DEPUTY FIRED ONE SHOT FROM HIS COUNTY ISSUED DUTY WEAPON INTO THE UPPER TORSO OF THE SUSPECT TO STOP THE SUSPECT FROM CHOKING HIM TO THE POINT OF UNCONSCIOUSNESS, OR TO THE POINT OF DEATH. ADDITIONAL DEPUTIES AND TEXAS DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY TROOPERS ARRIVED A SHORT TIME LATER, AT WHICH TIME THE SUSPECT WAS HANDCUFFED AND EMS WAS SUMMONED. DEPUTIES AND TROOPERS RENDERED MEDICAL ATTENTION TO THE SUSPECT, ROADSIDE, UNTIL EMS ARRIVED AND TOOK OVER CARE. THE SUSPECT WAS SUBSEQUENTLY TRANSPORTED TO CHRISTUS-GOOD SHEPHERD MEDICAL CENTER IN LONGVIEW FOR TREATMENT BY CHRISTUS-GOOD SHEPHERD EMS. THE SUSPECT WAS LATER PRONOUNCED DEAD AT THE HOSPITAL FROM THE SINGLE GUNSHOT WOUND HE RECEIVED IN THE STRUGGLE. THE DEPUTY INVOLVED IN THE SHOOTING WAS LATER TRANSPORTED TO LONGVIEW REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER IN LONGVIEW FOR TREATMENT BY SHERIFF'S VEHICLE. THE DEPUTY RECEIVED MINOR INJURIES FROM THE ASSAULT, BUT WAS RELEASED FROM THE HOSPITAL AFTER BEING TREATED BY ER PERSONNEL. THE SHOOTING IS BEING INVESTIGATED BY THE TEXAS RANGERS; RANGER CHRIS BAGGETT BEING THE LEAD INVESTIGATOR AT THIS TIME. THE SUSPECT WAS SUBSEQUENTLY TRANSPORTED TO FORENSIC MEDICAL IN TYLER FOR AUTOPSY. AUTOPSY RESULTS ARE PENDING AT REPORT TIME.

incident_result_of: TRAFFIC STOP
EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: OFFICERS RESPONDED TO THE RACETRAC AT 1716 W FRANKFORD AFTER A CALLER REPORTED A MAN ARMED WITH A GUN PASSED OUT IN HIS VEHICLE IN THE PARKING LOT. OFFICERS ARRIVED AND OBSERVED A WHITE MALE AND OUT OF CAUTION INITIALLY ATTEMPTED TO MAKE CONTACT WITH THE MAN USING THE SQUAD CAR PUBLIC ADDRESS SYSTEM, BUT HE REMAINED UNRESPONSIVE. AFTER REPEATED AUDIBLE ATTEMPTS TO WAKE HIM WERE UNSUCCESSFUL, A GROUP OF OFFICERS PROTECTED BY A BALLISTIC SHIELD APPROACHED THE VEHICLE THEY OBSERVED A HANDGUN IN THE MAN'S LAP. AS OFFICERS ATTEMPTED TO OPEN THE CAR DOOR TO SECURE THE WEAPON, THE MAN WOKE UP. OFFICERS INSTRUCTED THE MAN TO PUT HIS HANDS UP AND EXIT THE CAR, AFTER INITIALLY COMPLYING, THE MAN SUDDENLY REACHED DOWN, PICKED UP AND RAISED THE GUN. ONE OFFICER THEN FIRED HIS WEAPON DUTY WEAPON, STRIKING THE MAN. IMMEDIATE MEDICAL ACTION WAS TAKEN BY FIRE RESCUE AND THE MAN WAS TRANSPORTED TO A HOSPITAL WHERE HE WAS LATER PRONOUNCED DECEASED. OFFICERS LATER DETERMINED THE GUN TO BE A FACSIMILE FIREARM.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON 10-7-2019, THE SUSPECT COMMITTED AGGRAVATED ROBBERY BY CAUSING INJURY TO ANOTHER DURING THE COMMISSION OF THEFT. SUSPECT ASSAULTED HIS MOTHER CAUSING INJURY, STOLE HER VEHICLE AND FLED THE SCENE. A SHORT TIME LATER, WHILE PEACE OFFICER WAS ON THE SCENE TAKING THE REPORT, THE SUSPECT RETURNED AND ATTEMPTED TO ASSAULT THE PEACE OFFICER WITH A LARGE TREE LIMB AND A KNIFE. THE PEACE OFFICER USED FORCE TO PROTECT HIMSELF BY DISCHARGING HANDGUN DUTY WEAPON, STRIKING THE SUSPECT, CAUSING DEATH.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: OFFICER RESPONDED TO 2640 IH-10 EAST, THE "MERIT INN" MOTEL, IN REFERENCE TO A DISTURBANCE. WHILE ENROUTE, THE DISPATCHER HAD AN OPEN LINE WITH THE CALLER AND COULD HEAR THE DISTURBANCE, AND RELAYED TO THE RESPONDING OFFICER THAT THE VIOLENCE WAS INCREASING. THE DECEASED HAD ATTACKED THE MOTEL CLERK OUTSIDE, AND ESCORTED HER BACK INSIDE AND WAS DEMANDING SHE GIVE HIM MONEY. THE CLERK WAS BEING HELD VIOLENTLY BY THE HAIR AND PULLED AROUND THE OFFICE AREA. THE FIRST OFFICER ON THE SCENE ENTERED THE OFFICE AS THE ATTACK WAS STILL OCCURRING. THE SUSPECT RELEASED THE CLERK AND BACKED AWAY. THE OFFICER APPROACHED THE SUSPECT FROM BEHIND AND WAS BEGINNING TO HANDCUFF SAID SUSPECT, WHEN THE SUSPECT TURNED AROUND AND BEGAN VIOLENTLY RESISTING THE OFFICER'S ACTIONS. DURING THE FIGHT, THE SUSPECT WAS ABLE TO GET BEHIND THE OFFICER AND BEGAN STRANGLING THE OFFICER, AT ONE POINT LIFTING THE OFFICER'S FEET OFF OF THE GROUND. THE OFFICER CONTINUED FIGHTING AT WHICH TIME BOTH FELL TO THE FLOOR. THE SUSPECT LANDED ON TOP OF THE OFFICER, AND WAS ABLE TO REMOVE THE OFFICERS BATON FROM IT'S HOLDER, AND BEGAN VIOLENTLY STRIKING THE OFFICER IN THE HEAD, CAUSING A LARGE LACERATION IN THE CENTER OF THE TOP OF THE OFFICER'S HEAD. THESE BLOWS CAUSE THE OFFICER TO FALL BACKWARDS, AT WHICH TIME HE HAD NO CHOICE BUT TO DRAW AND FIRE HIS WEAPON AT THE SUSPECT, AND IMMEDIATELY STOPPED THE CONTINUOUS ASSAULT, WHICH HAD ALREADY RESULTED IN BODILY INJURY. THE SUSPECT COLLAPSED TO THE FLOOR WHERE HE EXPIRED.

cdr_narrative: POLICE RESPONDED TO AN OPEN STRUCTURE CALL. OFFICERS OBSERVED THE FRONT DOOR OPEN DURING THE NIGHTTIME. OFFICERS WALKED AROUND TO THE BACKYARD AND ENTERED THROUGH A GATE. ONE OFFICER FIRED ONE SHOT THROUGH THE BACK WINDOW, STRIKING THE RESIDENT WHO PASSED AWAY FROM THE GUNSHOT WOUND.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: OFFICERS WERE CALLED TO A CALL FOR SERVICE ON 10/13/19 AT 4330 BRENTWOOD DR. IN CORPUS CHRISTI, TEXAS RELATED TO A DISTURBANCE INVOLVING THE DECEASED. OFFICERS CONTACTED THE DECEASED IN THE STREET WHO WAS ARMED WITH A BAT AND THREATENING TO ASSAULT OFFICERS. AFTER LESS THAN LETHAL OPTIONS WERE EXHAUSTED AND THE DECEASED APPEARED TO START TO ADVANCE TOWARD OFFICERS, AN OFFICER DISCHARGED HIS WEAPON CAUSING INJURY THAT RESULTED IN DEATH.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON OCTOBER 19, 2019, AT APPROXIMATELY 3:15 P.M., TEXAS HIGHWAY PATROL TROOPERS WERE CALLED TO ASSIST THE ANDERSON COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE AT THE HICKORY RIDGE MOBILE HOME PARK ON HICKORY RIDGE ROAD IN ANDERSON COUNTY. TROOPERS ARRIVED AT THE SCENE AND LEARNED A DEPUTY WAS SERIOUSLY INJURED FROM A SHOOTING INCIDENT. THE SUSPECT, LATER IDENTIFIED AS TERRY LEE COUNTRYMAN, JR., FLED THE SCENE IN THE DEPUTY'S VEHICLE. TROOPERS ON SCENE RENDERED FIRST AID TO THE DEPUTY WHILE ADDITIONAL TROOPERS RESPONDED TO ASSIST. THE SUSPECT WAS LOCATED A SHORT DISTANCE AWAY, DRIVING THE DEPUTY'S PATROL UNIT. THE SUSPECT THEN RAMMED A PALESTINE POLICE DEPARTMENT VEHICLE AND SHOT AT OFFICERS. AFTER OFFICERS USED A TIRE DEFLATION DEVICE TO DISABLE THE VEHICLE, THE SUSPECT FLED ON FOOT WITH A RIFLE TAKEN FROM INSIDE THE DEPUTY'S STOLEN VEHICLE. LATER, THE SUSPECT STOLE A BLUE SUV FROM A PRIVATE RESIDENCE. AFTER OFFICERS LOCATED THE STOLEN SUV, THE SUSPECT EVADED THE OFFICERS UNTIL HE CRASHED AND THEN FLED ON FOOT INTO A WOODED AREA. OFFICERS AND TDCJ TRACKING DOGS ENTERED THE WOODED AREA LOOKING FOR THE SUSPECT AND WERE SUBSEQUENTLY FIRED UPON BY THE SUSPECT. NO OFFICERS OR ANIMALS WERE STRUCK BY THE GUNFIRE. AT APPROXIMATELY 5:27 P.M., TROOPER WILLIAM MACMILLAN LOCATED THE SUSPECT NEAR FM 2330 AND COUNTY ROAD 458. THE SUSPECT POINTED A RIFLE AT TROOPER MACMILLAN. IN RESPONSE, TROOPER MACMILLAN FIRED HIS WEAPON, STRIKING THE SUSPECT. EMS WAS NOTIFIED, AND THE SUSPECT WAS TRANSPORTED TO PALESTINE REGIONAL MEDICAL CENTER WHERE HE WAS LATER PRONOUNCED DECEASED. THE TROOPER WAS NOT INJURED.

incident_result_of: OTHER
incident_call_other: LICENSE PLATE READER, INFORMED THE POLICE UNIT OF STOLEN PLATE AT THE PARKING LOT OF 12236 MONTANA, WAL-MART. THE OFFICERS RESPONDED TO INVESTIGATE THE STOLEN PLATE WHEN THE OFFENDER (DECEASED) USED FORCE AGAINST THEM. THE OFFENDER USED THE VEHICLE AS A DEADLY WEAPON.
cdr_narrative: ON JANUARY 5, 2019, AT APPROXIMATELY 5:40 P.M., THE UNITED STATES BORDER PATROL REQUESTED ASSISTANCE IN PURSUING A FORD PICKUP. THE PICKUP FAILED TO YIELD AT A CHECKPOINT AND WAS FLEEING FROM LAW ENFORCEMENT. TROOPER JAMES PEREZ JOINED THE PURSUIT ON US 62/180 IN EL PASO COUNTY, TEXAS. MULTIPLE AGENCIES WERE INVOLVED, BUT TROOPER PEREZ BECAME THE LEAD OFFICER. TROOPER PEREZ GAVE THE DRIVER OF THE PICKUP, LATER IDENTIFIED BOBBY JOE CARL KING, MULTIPLE COMMANDS TO STOP AND PULL OVER, BUT KING CONTINUED TO EVADE. THE PURSUIT CONTINUED WESTBOUND ON 62/180 AND THEN MERGED ONTO STATE LOOP 375. OTHER ASSISTING OFFICERS SET UP SPIKES, WHICH CAUSED ALL FOUR TIRES OF THE PICKUP TO DEFLATE. THE PICKUP EVENTUALLY CAME TO COMPLETE STOP ON STATE LOOP 375. THE PURSUING OFFICERS THEN CONDUCTED A HIGH-RISK FELONY STOP. TROOPER PEREZ GAVE COMMANDS WHILE OTHER OFFICERS APPROACHED THE PASSENGER SIDE OF THE PICKUP. UPON APPROACHING THE PICKUP, THE OFFICERS OBSERVED KING HUNCHED OVER WITH A PISTOL IN HIS HAND. AFTER SEEING THE PISTOL, THE OFFICERS RETREATED BACK TOWARD THE REAR OF THE PICKUP. THE OFFICERS THEN APPROACHED THE PICKUP FROM THE DRIVER SIDE AND OBSERVED KING STILL HUNCHED OVER. THEY ALSO OBSERVED THAT HE HAD A SELF-INFLICTED GUNSHOT WOUND TO HIS FACE. NONE OF THE OFFICERS HEARD THE GUN, AND IT IS UNCLEAR WHEN KING SHOT HIMSELF. THE OFFICERS OPENED THE DRIVER’S DOOR AND REMOVED THE PISTOL FROM KING’S HAND AND SECURED IT. THE OFFICERS THEN REMOVED KING AND BEGAN TO PROVIDE MEDICAL ASSISTANCE UNTIL PERSONNEL WITH THE EL PASO FIRE CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 DEPARTMENT ARRIVED. THE FIRE DEPARTMENT TRANSPORTED KING TO THE UNIVERSITY MEDICAL CENTER WHERE HE WAS ADMITTED AND REQUIRED IMMEDIATE SURGERY. FOLLOWING SURGERY, KING WAS MOVED TO THE INTENSIVE CARE UNIT. ON JANUARY 17, 2019, AT APPROXIMATELY 10:46 A.M., KING WAS PRONOUNCED DEAD BY STAFF WITH THE UNIVERSITY MEDICAL CENTER. ON JANUARY 22, 2019, DR. RASCON WITH THE EL PASO COUNTY MEDICAL EXAMINER’S OFFICE CONDUCTED AN AUTOPSY ON KING. THE REPORT IS PENDING.

incident_address: SHOP LOCATED IN ALLEY BETWEEN MORRIS AND FAIRWAY STREETS
incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON 10-23-2019 AT APPROXIMATELY 11:27 P.M. OFFICERS RESPONDED TO THE INITIAL REPORT OF SHOTS FIRED AT 1 FAIRWAY STREET SWEETWATER, NOLAN COUNTY TEXAS. UPON ARRIVING OFFICERS MET WITH THE REPORTING PARTY FRED WALDROP WHICH ADVISED THAT HIS SON WAS VERY UPSET AND WAS VERBALLY THREATENING TO "FUCKING KILL THEM OR ANYONE ELSE WANTING TO FUCK WITH HIM" AND AT POINT FRED ADVISED THAT HE GOT UP FROM HIS RECLINER TO DIAL 911 WHEN A SHOT RANG OUT, IT WAS THEN HIS SON JORDAN LEFT OUT THE BACKDOOR OF THE RESIDENCE TO THE ALLEY THAT LED TO THE LOCATION OF A SHOP ON A DETACHED PIECE OF PROPERTY WHERE HE HEARD AN ADDITIONAL SHOT BE FIRED. CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 TWO OFFICERS OF THE SWEETWATER POLICE DEPARTMENT BEGAN THE SLOW TASK OF ATTEMPTING TO LOCATE THE SUBJECT JORDAN REGARDING THE DISTURBANCE, INCLUDING THE AT LEAST TWO SHOT BEING FIRED. THE OFFICERS APPROACHED THE SECONDARY LOCATION FINDING A SHOP CONSISTING OF TWO OVERHEAD DOORS AND ONE METAL DOOR IN THE CENTER, ONLY ONE OF THE OVERHEAD DOORS WAS OPEN WITH LIGHTS ON. THE OFFICERS REPORTEDLY APPROACHED THE OPEN OVERHEAD DOOR AND AS THE OFFICER MADE CONTACT WITH WALDROP HE WAS FOUND TO BE IN POSSESSION OF AN AR-15 STYLE RIFLE, REPORTEDLY WALDROP BEGAN TO RAISE THE WEAPON AND OFFICERS FIRED MULTIPLE ROUNDS STRIKING WALDROP. OFFICERS APPROACHED REMOVED THE RIFLE FROM WALDROP AND SECURING HIM BY PLACING HIM INTO HANDCUFFS AND NOTIFIED DISPATCH OF THE SHOTS HAVING BEEN FIRED AND EMS WAS NEEDED AT THEIR LOCATION. UPON EMS ARRIVING ON SCENE WALDROP WAS FOUND TO NOT BE BREATHING NOR DISPLAYING OTHER SIGNS OF LIFE, IT WAS AT THAT TIME EMERGENCY MEDICAL PERSONNEL RAN A STRIP TO CONFIRM THAT THERE WAS NO SIGN OF A HEART BEAT. AS THE ON DUTY SUPERVISOR WAS RESPONDING TO THE LOCATION, I WAS NOTIFIED OF THE SHOOTING AND RESPONDED TO THE LOCATION AS WELL. AS I SPOKE WITH THE SERGEANT TO DETERMINE WHO WAS INVOLVED AND THEIR STATUS I ALSO ASKED WHAT OTHER RESOURCES HAD BEEN ACTIVATED, I THEN HAD OUR CID UNIT NOTIFIED AS I ALSO THEN NOTIFIED THE TEXAS RANGERS AND REQUESTED THEIR ASSISTANCE PER OUR DEPARTMENTAL POLICY. ONCE ON SCENE THE RANGERS WERE HANDED THE SCENE AND OUR DETECTIVES ASSISTED AS THEY NEEDED. ONCE THE SCENE HAD BEEN PROCESSED A MAGISTRATE WAS NOTIFIED AND UPON THE NOLAN COUNTY JUDGES ARRIVAL HE ARRANGED FOR J. WALDROP'S BODY TO BE TRANSPORTED TO LUBBOCK, TX FOR AN AUTOPSY. IT WAS REPORTED TO ME LATER ON 10/24/2019 THAT THE AUTOPSY WAS COMPLETED AT APPROX. 10:00 A.M. ON 10/24/2019, AND AS OF THE FILING OF THIS REPORT NO INFORMATION HAS BEEN RECEIVED BY THIS OFFICE. NOTHING FURTHER AT THIS TIME, AS I AM AWAITING A BRIEFING FROM INVESTIGATORS.

incident_result_of: TRAFFIC STOP
EXECUTION OF A WARRANT
cdr_narrative: DECEASED WAS A SUBJECT WHO HAD SHOT A FAMILY MEMBER A FEW DAYS PRIOR. THE LOCAL POLICE DEPARTMENT WORKED THE SHOOTING OF THE FAMILY MEMBER THEN HAD A AGG. ASSAULT WITH A DEADLY WEAPON WARRANT ISSUED FOR THE ARREST OF THE SUBJECT. THE SUSPECT WAS SPOTTED, OPERATING A MOTOR VEHICLE IN A NEIGHBORING CITY. THE PD ATTEMPTED TO STOP THE SUBJECT WHO THEN FLED IN A MOTOR VEHICLE INTO ECTOR COUNTY. ECSO ASSISTED IN THE PURSUIT OF THE SUSPECT. THE SUSPECT THEN CAME TO A STOP AND EXITED THE VEHICLE AND FLED ON FOOT. ECSO DEPUTIES BEGAN FOOT PURSUIT WITH THE SUSPECT AND OBSERVED HIM RAISE A FIREARM AT HIS OWN HEAD. SECONDS LATER THE SUSPECT THEN POINTED THE SAME FIREARM TOWARDS PURSUING DEPUTIES. ONE ECSO DEPUTIES THEN ENGAGED THE SUSPECT IN GUN FIRE. THE SUSPECT WAS SHOT MULTIPLE TIME AND KILLED IN THE GUN BATTLE.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
TRAFFIC STOP; EXECUTION OF A WARRANT
cdr_narrative: DECEDENT WAS OBSERVED TRAVELLING 70 MPH IN A MARKED 55 MPH SPEED ZONE. MONTGOMERY COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE DEPUTIES ATTEMPTED TO AFFECT A TRAFFIC STOP AND DECEDENT FLED TO HIS RESIDENCE, WHERE HE RESIDES WITH HIS MOTHER. DEPUTIES ATTEMPTED TO MAKE CONTACT WITH THE DECEDENT AT THE RESIDENCE DUE TO LEARNING OF AN OUTSTANDING FELONY WARRANT AND DID NOT FIND HIM THERE. AFTER DEPUTIES DEPARTED THE RESIDENCE, THEY RECEIVED INFORMATION FROM THE DECEDENT'S GIRLFRIEND THAT THE DECEDENT WAS USING THE RESIDENCE LAND-LINE TO CALL HER. DEPUTIES ATTEMPTED TO MAKE CONTACT WITH HIM AT HIS RESIDENCE A SECOND TIME, AND HE WAS OBSERVED (THROUGH AN UN-OBSCURED WINDOW ) CRAWLING ON THE FLOOR OF THE RESIDENCE TOWARD HIS BEDROOM. DEPUTIES MADE ENTRY INTO THE RESIDENCE TO EFFECT THE ARREST AND THE DECEDENT DISPLAYED A KITCHEN KNIFE AND BEGAN ADVANCING TOWARD THE DEPUTIES WITH THE KNIFE HELD IN A THREATENING MANNER. DEPUTIES DEPLOYED TASERS, BUT THEY WERE INEFFECTIVE AND THE DECEDENT RAN TOWARD THE DEPUTIES WITH THE KNIFE IN HIS HAND. THREE PEACE OFFICERS FIRED MULTIPLE ROUNDS, STRIKING THE DECEDENT IN THE HEAD AND TORSO, STOPPING HIM IMMEDIATELY.

incident_result_of: EXECUTION OF A WARRANT
cdr_narrative: ON 11-06-2019 AT APPROXIMATELY 09:30 P.M., MEMBERS OF THE UNITED STATES MARSHALS LONE STAR FUGITIVE TASK FORCE SAN ANTONIO DIVISION WERE ATTEMPTING TO APPREHEND RAUL CASAS CAMPOS, HISPANIC MALE, DATE OF BIRTH: 05-13-1985, IN REFERENCE TO AN OUTSTANDING WARRANT FOR AGGRAVATED SEXUAL ASSAULT ISSUED OUT OF BEXAR COUNTY, TEXAS. INTELLIGENCE PROVIDED ON CAMPOS WAS THAT HE WAS BELIEVED TO BE ARMED AND DANGEROUS. TASK FORCE MEMBERS LOCATED CAMPOS IN A VEHICLE AT A WAL-MART GAS STATION AT 7239 SW LOOP 410, SAN ANTONIO, TEXAS 78242. UPON ATTEMPTING TO EFFECT THE ARREST, CAMPOS DISPLAYED AND POINTED AN AR-15 RIFLE AT TASK CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 FORCE OFFICERS AND TWO OFFICERS RESPONDED WITH DEADLY FORCE NEGATING CAMPOS'S THREAT OF VIOLENCE. TASK FORCE OFFICERS ON SCENE PROVIDED MEDICAL ATTENTION AND CAMPOS WAS TRANSPORTED BY EMERGENCY MEDICAL SERVICES TO UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL WHERE HE SUCCUMBED TO HIS INJURIES.

EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: OFFICERS RESPONDED TO 2578 IH-10 EAST, THE "AL BASHA" RESTAURANT, IN REFERENCE TO A POSSIBLE "BURGLARY IN PROGRESS". UPON ARRIVAL, OFFICERS DISCOVERED A POINT OF ENTRY, BEING A LARGE PLATE GLASS WINDOW ON THE FRONT OF THE CLOSED BUSINESS, WHICH HAD BEEN SHATTERED. OFFICERS ENTERED THE DARK RESTAURANT THROUGH THIS OPENING, AND MADE CONTACT WITH THE DECEASED, WHO WAS BENT DOWN BEHIND THE COUNTER/REGISTER AREA. OFFICERS GAVE COMMANDS FOR THE SUSPECT TO STOP WHAT HE WAS DOING, HOWEVER, THE SUSPECT STOOD UP AND LEAPED ACROSS THE COUNTER, AND BEGAN RUNNING TOWARDS THE POINT OF ENTRY, WITH THE LARGE SCREWDRIVER IN HIS HAND. OFFICERS CONTINUOUSLY ORDERED HIM TO STOP AND DROP WHAT WAS IN HIS HANDS, HOWEVER, THE SUSPECT CONTINUED TO RUN IN THE DIRECTION OF THE ASSISTING OFFICER, WHO WAS IN THE AREA BETWEEN THE SUSPECT AND THE SHATTERED WINDOW. FEARING THE SUSPECT WAS GOING TO STAB THE OFFICER NEAREST THE WINDOW, THE ORIGINAL OFFICER FIRED HIS WEAPON, AND STRUCK THE SUSPECT FOUR TIMES, CAUSING HIM TO COLLAPSE TO THE FLOOR, AND SUCCUMB TO HIS INJURIES. THE LARGE SCREWDRIVER WAS STILL IN HIS HAND WHEN OFFICERS APPROACHED. THE OFFICERS THEN CALLED FOR HELP FOR MEDICAL ASSISTANCE, AND MADE THE NECESSARY NOTIFICATIONS.

TRAFFIC STOP; OTHER
cdr_narrative: ON 12-02-19 AT APPROXIMATELY 2012HRS, OFFICER CARMEN DECRUZ WAS RUNNING RADAR IN THE AREA OF BLACKLAND RD TEMPLE TX. BELL COUNTY. OFFICER DECRUZ OBSERVED A GRAY PT CRUISER SPEEDING AND INITIATED A TRAFFIC STOP. THE DRIVER OF THE VEHICLE, AND SOLE OCCUPANT, LATER IDENTIFIED AS MICHAEL DEAN, REFUSED TO STOP FOR THE OFFICER AND A SHORT PURSUIT ENSUED. MICHAEL DEAN BROUGHT HIS VEHICLE TO A STOP AT THE INTERSECTION OF E. HWY 190 AND THE 3200 BLOCK OF LITTLE RIVER RD. OFFICER DECRUZ EXITED HIS VEHICLE AND MADE CONTACT WITH MICHAEL DEAN. THERE WAS AN ALTERCATION OF SOME SORT BETWEEN OFFICER DECRUZ AND MICHAEL DEAN. DURING THIS ALTERCATION, OFFICER DECRUZ'S SERVICE WEAPON DISCHARGED STRIKING MICHAEL DEAN. OFFICER DECRUZ INITIATED LIFE-SAVING MEASURES TO NO AVAIL. THE TEXAS RANGERS WERE CALLED TO THE SCENE TO INVESTIGATE THE SHOOTING AND POSSES KEY ELEMENTS OF THE INVESTIGATION.

incident_result_of: EXECUTION OF A WARRANT
cdr_narrative: DECEDENT WAS THE ACTOR NAMED IN A NARCOTICS SEARCH WARRANT ISSUED FOR THE ADDRESS OF 604 S. ALLEN ST.T. DECEDENT ATTEMPTED TO IMPACT OFFICERS WITH THE VEHICLE THAT HE WAS USING AS A WEAPON. DECEDENT WAS KILLED WITH A SINGLE GUNSHOT TO HIS HEAD.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON 12/11/19, A LEAGUE CITY POLICE OFFICER WAS DISPATCHED TO THE 6500 BLOCK OF TURNER FIELDS LANE, IN REFERENCE TO A SUSPICIOUS PERSON. THE SUSPICIOUS PERSON WAS DESCRIBED AS A WHITE MALE WEARING A T-SHIRT AND BOXER SHORTS, COVERED IN BLOOD AND RUNNING AROUND IN THE STREET YELLING AND WAVING HIS ARMS. AS THE FIRST RESPONDING OFFICER ARRIVED, HE WAS APPROACHED BY A MALE FITTING THE DESCRIPTION GIVEN IN THE ORIGINAL CALL NOTES. THE OFFICER NOTICED THAT THE MALE WAS VERY EXCITED AND HAD LACERATIONS TO ONE OF HIS WRISTS. THE OFFICER ATTEMPTED TO CALM THE MALE AND GET HIM TO SIT DOWN SO HIS INJURIES COULD BE ASSESSED, AND AID RENDERED. THE MALE REFUSED TO SIT, AND HIS BEHAVIOR AND STATEMENTS INDICATED AN ALTERED MENTAL STATUS. THE MALE CONTINUED TO ADVANCE TOWARD THE OFFICER DESPITE THE OFFICERS’ COMMANDS TO STOP. THE MALE TURNED FROM EXCITED TO AGGRESSIVE AND MADE COMMENTS THAT HE WAS GOING TO KILL THE OFFICER. THE OFFICER DREW HIS BATON AND ORDERED THE MALE TO STOP. THE MALE MADE ANOTHER STATEMENT THAT HE WAS GOING TO KILL THE OFFICER AND THEN STUCK THE OFFICER IN THE FACE WITH A CLOSED FIST. THE OFFICER THEN DELIVERED 2 STRIKES FROM HIS EXPANDABLE BATON TO THE CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 MALE’S UPPER TORSO. THE STRIKES DID NOT STOP THE MALE FROM ADVANCING ON THE OFFICER AND HE CONTINUED TO STATE THAT HE WAS GOING TO KILL THE OFFICER. THE OFFICER THEN ATTEMPTED A THIRD BATON STRIKE BUT LOST CONTROL AND POSSESSION OF THE BATON DURING THE SWING. THE OFFICER CONTINUED TO ATTEMPT TO CREATE DISTANCE, BUT THE MALE CONTINUED TO ADVANCE. THE OFFICER DELIVERED A FRONT KICK TO THE MALE’S CHEST IN AN ATTEMPTED TO TAKE HIM OFF HIS FEET, BUT THE MALE WAS UNPHASED BY THE KICK AND GRABBED THE OFFICER’S LEG. AT THIS POINT, THE MALE HAD BEEN UNPHASED BY BATON STRIKES AND THE KICK TO THE CHEST. THE MALE HAD ALSO CONTINUOUSLY ADVANCED ON THE OFFICER STATING THAT HE WAS GOING TO KILL HIM EVEN AS THE OFFICER ATTEMPTED TO CREATE DISTANCE. THE OFFICER BELIEVED THAT HE WAS IN A LIFE AND DEATH STRUGGLE AND THAT THE MALE WAS ABOUT TO TAKE HIM TO THE GROUND GIVING THE MALE THE ADVANTAGE AND SUPERIOR POSITION. BASED ON THIS BELIEF, THE OFFICER DREW HIS HANDGUN AND FIRED. THE ROUNDS STRUCK THE MALE IN THE UPPER TORSO AND NECK. THE MALE RELEASED THE OFFICER’S LEG AND CONTINUED TO ADVANCE ON THE OFFICER SEVERAL FEET BEFORE HE COLLAPSED TO THE GROUND.

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: PLEASE NOTE THAT THIS IS STILL AN ONGOING INVESTIGATION. THE FINAL AUTOPSY REPORT (TO INCLUDE TOXICOLOGY), BALLISTIC REPORT AND THE TEXAS RANGERS INVESTIGATION ARE PENDING. THE SUMMARY SET OUT BELOW IS BASED ON CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 INFORMATION KNOWN TO DATE AND COULD BE SUBJECT TO CHANGE BASED ON FURTHER INFORMATION. ON SUNDAY DECEMBER 15, 2019, AT AROUND 2:08AM, THE BROWNSVILLE POLICE DEPARTMENT BEGAN RECEIVING MULTIPLE 911 CALLS FOR SERVICE IN REFERENCE TO SHOTS FIRED IN THE GALAXIA NEIGHBORHOOD AREA. ONE OF THE 911 CALLERS ADVISED THAT HE OBSERVED A MAN IN THE MIDDLE OF THE STREET DISCHARGING A FIREARM ON THE 600 BLOCK OF FLORENCE LN. ANOTHER 911 CALLER ALSO PROVIDED AN ADDRESS ON FLORENCE LN. AND STATED A MALE SUBJECT SHOT 6 TO 7 ROUNDS (THIS SAME CALLER CALLED BACK SHORTLY AFTER HIS INITIAL PHONE CALL AND REPORTED THE MALE SUBJECT SHOT AN ADDITIONAL 10 TO 11 ROUNDS). OTHER 911 CALLERS (14) REPORTED HEARING MULTIPLE GUNSHOTS IN THE AREA, TO INCLUDE TWO CALLERS WHO DESCRIBED THE SHOTS AS COMING FROM A LARGE CALIBER WEAPON. EMERGENCY COMMUNICATION OPERATORS IMMEDIATELY DISPATCHED THE CALL FOR SERVICE AS ADDITIONAL CALLS FOR THE SAME EMERGENCY CAME IN. THE OFFICERS INITIALLY DISPATCHED WERE OFFICER ROLANDO TRUJILLO JR. #7267, OFFICER LUCIO CORTINAS #6833, AND OFFICER JACQUELINE RAMIREZ #8498. THE OFFICERS RESPONDING WERE DRIVING THEIR CLEARLY MARKED POLICE VEHICLES AND WEARING THEIR CLEARLY MARKED POLICE UNIFORMS. WHILE EN-ROUTE, DISPATCH PROVIDED ADDITIONAL INFORMATION TO THE OFFICERS ABOUT THE CALL FOR SERVICE THEY WERE RESPONDING TO FROM THE CONTINUOUS 911 CALLS THAT CAME IN. AT AROUND 2:16AM, TWO OFFICERS ARRIVED IN THE AREA AND DROVE WEST ON FATHER MESTAS DR. TOWARDS FLORENCE LN. THE FIRST OFFICER ON SCENE WAS OFFICER TRUJILLO JR. DIRECTLY FOLLOWED BY OFFICER CORTINAS. BOTH OFFICERS PULLED OVER NEAR 1365 FATHER MESTAS DR. AS OFFICER TRUJILLO JR. DEPLOYED HIS RIFLE. THE OFFICERS THEN DROVE TOWARDS THE INTERSECTION OF FATHER MESTAS DR. & FLORENCE LN. (OFFICER TRUJILLO JR., FOLLOWED BY OFFICER CORTINAS, WITH OFFICER RAMIREZ SLIGHTLY BEHIND BOTH OFFICERS). AS OFFICER TRUJILLO JR. SLOWLY APPROACHED THE INTERSECTION AND TURNED SLIGHTLY LEFT ONTO FLORENCE LN., HE OBSERVED A MALE SUBJECT WALKING ON FLORENCE LN. TOWARDS HIS DIRECTION HOLDING A MIDSIZE BLACK OBJECT IN HIS HAND. WHILE STILL SITTING ON THE DRIVER SEAT WITH THE WINDOWS DOWN AND ATTEMPTING TO COME TO A COMPLETE STOP IN ORDER TO PLACE THE POLICE VEHICLE IN PARK, OFFICER TRUJILLO JR. YELLED AT THE MALE SUBJECT "SHOW ME YOUR HANDS". OFFICER TRUJILLO JR. THEN OBSERVED A FLASH IN FRONT OF THE MALE SUBJECT AND HEARD A LOUD BANG. OFFICER TRUJILLO JR. REALIZED HE WAS GETTING SHOT AT AND FIRED A ROUND AT THE MALE SUBJECT FROM THE SEATED POSITION. OFFICER TRUJILLO JR. QUICKLY EXITED HIS POLICE UNIT AND YELLED "LET ME SEE YOUR HANDS, LET ME SEE YOUR HANDS NOW, DROP IT." THE MALE SUBJECT IGNORED OFFICER TRUJILLO JR.'S VERBAL COMMANDS AS GUNFIRE WAS EXCHANGED. THE MALE SUBJECT SHOT MULTIPLE ROUNDS TOWARDS THE DIRECTION OF OFFICER TRUJILLO JR., THE OTHER RESPONDING OFFICERS (OFFICER CORTINAS & OFFICER RAMIREZ) AND MULTIPLE HOMES IN THE AREA (ONE OF THE ROUNDS STRUCK THE DRIVER SIDE REAR WINDOW OF OFFICER TRUJILLO'S POLICE UNIT). OFFICER TRUJILLO JR. RETURNED FIRE AND SHOT MULTIPLE ROUNDS AT THE MALE SUBJECT IN ORDER TO PROTECT HIMSELF, HIS FELLOW OFFICERS, AND CITIZENS IN THE AREA. HE REASONABLY BELIEVED IT WAS IMMEDIATELY NECESSARY TO USE DEADLY FORCE TO STOP THE IMMINENT THREAT AND PERFORMED HIS DUTIES. AS A RESULT, THE MALE SUBJECT WAS STRUCK BY GUNFIRE AND COLLAPSED. OFFICER TRUJILLO JR., OFFICER CORTINAS AND OFFICER RAMIREZ THEN CAUTIOUSLY APPROACHED THE MALE SUBJECT. OFFICER CORTINAS REMOVED AN ASSAULT RIFLE FROM THE MALE SUBJECT'S IMMEDIATE GRASP AND RADIOED DISPATCH FOR EMS AND A SUPERVISOR TO LOCATION. A U.S. BORDER PATROL MEDIC ARRIVED ON SCENE SHORTLY THEREAFTER AND PROVIDED EMERGENCY MEDICAL ASSISTANCE TO THE MALE SUBJECT UNTIL BROWNSVILLE EMS ARRIVED ON SCENE. HE WAS LATER TRANSPORTED TO VALLEY BAPTIST MEDICAL CENTER BY BROWNSVILLE EMS WHERE HE SUCCUMBED TO HIS WOUNDS AND DIED AT 2:51AM. HE WAS IDENTIFIED AS MARIO ALBERTO TORRES. THE PRELIMINARY CAMERON COUNTY FORENSIC PATHOLOGY REPORT DOCUMENTED THE CAUSE OF DEATH AS "GUNSHOT WOUND OF THE HEAD.

cdr_narrative: A STOLEN VEHICLE WAS BEING TRACKED BY THE OWNER’S IPAD THAT WAS LOCATED INSIDE OF THE TRUCK. EAGLE BEGAN SURVEYING THE AREA AND OBSERVED THE SUSPECT AND A FEMALE DRIVING BETWEEN THE STOLEN TRUCK AND ANOTHER SMALL BLUE VEHICLE. OFFICERS IN THE AREA, BY DIRECTION OF EAGLE, LOCATED THE SMALL BLUE VEHICLE. OFFICERS ATTEMPTED TO STOP THE VEHICLE, HOWEVER, THE DRIVER (SUSPECT) REFUSED AND IN A HURRY TO FLEE DAMAGED AN OFFICER'S PATROL VEHICLE. OFFICERS CEASED THE CHASE AFTER A SUPERVISOR TERMINATED THE PURSUIT. ACCORDING TO CUSTODIAL DEATH REPORT :: PAGE 7 OF 7 EAGLE, THE VEHICLE CONTINUED TO DRIVE ERRATIC. AGAIN OFFICERS, FOLLOWING AT A SAFE DISTANCE, OBSERVED THE SUSPECT VEHICLE HIT ANOTHER VEHICLE AT THE INTERSECTION AND CAUSED A MAJOR ACCIDENT. THE DRIVER FLED FROM THE VEHICLE ON FOOT WITH A HANDGUN. THE SUSPECT CONTINUED TO FLEE ON FOOT TOWARDS THEO AVE. ONCE ON THEO, ON THE SOUTHSIDE OF THE BLOCK, THE SUSPECT THEN ENGAGED THE OFFICERS. OFFICERS STATED THEY GAVE THE SUSPECT SEVERAL COMMANDS TO PUT THE FIREARM DOWN, BUT HE REFUSED AND WOULD NOT COMPLY WITH THEM. FEARING FOR THEIR OWN SAFETY AND SAFETY OF THE OFFICERS AROUND THEM THEY SHOT AT THE SUSPECT CAUSING HIM TO FALL WITH THE FIREARM STILL IN HIS HAND. THUS FAR, THE PRELIMINARY EVIDENCE AT THE SCENE, THE COBAN VIDEO AND BODY CAMERAS WERE ALL CONSISTENT WITH THE OFFICERS’ ACCOUNTS. OFFICER'S STATEMENTS WERE TAKEN AT HEADQUARTERS BY DETECTIVES'. THE OFFICER INVOLVED SHOOTING TEAM WILL CONTINUE TO GATHER AND INVESTIGATE THIS INCIDENT. THIS INVESTIGATION IS ONGOING.

EXECUTION OF A WARRANT
cdr_narrative: ON DECEMBER 28, 2019, DEPUTIES ATTEMPTED TO LOCATE AND ARREST THE DECEDENT ON AN OPEN MURDER WARRANT. DEPUTIES LOCATED THE DECEDENT IN A PARK AND APPROACHED HIM. THE DECEDENT STOOD UP FROM A BENCH AND WALKED AWAY FROM THE DEPUTIES CARRYING A BAG. A DEPUTY SHOT THE DECEDENT TWO TIMES FROM BEHIND AFTER HE REFUSED TO STOP. THE DECEDENT WAS TRANSPORTED TO BEN TAUB HOSPITAL WHERE HE WAS PRONOUNCED DECEASED BY AN ATTENDING PHYSICIAN

incident_result_of: EMERGENCY CALL OR REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE
cdr_narrative: ON MONDAY, DECEMBER 30, 2019, TWO PASADENA PD OFFICER AND TWO HPD OFFICERS WERE INVOLVED IN AN OFFICER INVOLVED SHOOTING AT 5700 PERSHING STREET IN HOUSTON, HARRIS COUNTY TEXAS. PRIOR TO THE OIS< PASADENA P. D. OFFICER M. COLUNGA, UNIT#3339, CONDUCTED A TRAFFIC STOP ON A RED TOYOTA COROLLA BEARING TEXAS LICENSE PLATE #GTH-9218 IN THE 3600 BLOCK OF SHAVER IN PASADENA, TEXAS. ONCE OFFICER COLUNGA CALLED OUT ON TRAFFIC, THE PASADENA DISPATCHER INFORMED HIM THAT THE VEHICLE HAS BEEN STOLEN IN AN AGGRAVATED ROBBERY. THE TOYOTA WAS REPORTED STOLEN IN AN HPD AGGRAVATED ROBBERY, CASE #1707532-19. OFFICER COLUNGA REQUESTED BACK-UP UNITS AT THAT TIME FOR A FELONY TRAFFIC STOP; OFFICER L. HOWARD ON UNIT #3338 AND OTHER PASADENA UNITS ARRIVED TO ASSIST HIM. WHEN THE PASADENA PD UNITS WERE IN PLACE FOR THE FELONY TRAFFIC STOP, THEY GAVE VERBAL COMMANDS TO THE DRIVER LATER IDENTIFIED AS SUSPECT DAVION EDISON, AND PASSENGERS, DAYLON CRAWFORD AND BRANDON JACKSON, TO EXIT THE VEHICLE. THEY DID NOT COMPLY WITH OFFICERS COMMANDS, INSTEAD, SUSPECT EDISON SPED OFF AND LED OFFICERS IN A VEHICLE PURSUIT INTO THE CITY OF HOUSTON. ONCE IN THE CITY OF HOUSTON, HPD OFFICERS JOINED IN ON THE PURSUIT. SUSPECT EDISON CONTINUED TO DRIVE THROUGH THE CITY OF HOUSTON TRYING TO LOSE THE PASADENA PD PATROL UNITS WHO WERE PURSUING HIM. AT ONE POINT WHEN SUSPECT EDISON REACHED THE 7100 BLOCK OF MLK, OCCUPANTS DAYLON CRAWFORD AND BRANDON JACKSON BAILED OUT OF THE VEHICLE AND OFFICERS WERE ABLE TO TAKE THEM INTO CUSTODY WITHOUT INCIDENT. SUSPECT EDISON CONTINUED TO FLEE IN THE VEHICLE THROUGH THE NEIGHBORHOOD, BUT ULTIMATELY COLLIDED WITH PASADENA PD OFFICER I. MASCORRO'S WAS DRIVING SOUTH ON MLK AT PERSHING STREET AND SUSPECT EDISON WAS DRIVING EAST ON PERSHING STREET STILL FLEEING FROM THE OFFICERS. THE TOYOTA SPUN OUT AND CAME TO REST ON THE STREET IN THE 5700 OF PERSHING STREET. SUSPECT EDISON THE EXITED THE STOLEN VEHICLE AND BEGAN RUNNING ON FOOT EAST ON PERSHING STREET. OFFICER COLUNGA DROVE PAST THE STOLEN VEHICLE AFTER IT CAME TO REST IN THE 5700 BLOCK OF PERSHING STREET AS HE WAS ATTEMPTING TO CUT OFF SUSPECT EDISON ESCAPE. AT THAT POINT, PASADENA PD OFFICER M. LUDEKE'S DASH CAM VIDEO SHOWS SUSPECT EDISON POINTING A GUN ( WITH HIS RIGHT HAND), AT OFFICER COLUNGA'S PATROL VEHICLE BEFORE THE GETS OUT OF IT, AND HE ( EDISON), SHOOTS ONE TIME IN OFFICER COLUNGA'S DIRECTION. SUSPECT EDISON'S GUNFIRE DID NOT HIT OFFICER COLUNGA. THE RESPONDING PASADENA AND HPD OFFICERS THEN BEGAN A FOOT PURSUIT ON SUSPECT EDISON. THE OFFICERS CAUGHT UP TO SUSPECT EDISON ON A VACANT LOT, ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF PERSHING STREET JUST EAST OF THE CRASH LOCATION. THE OFFICERS BEGAN GIVING SUSPECT EDISON VERBAL COMMANDS, WHICH HE IGNORED. SUSPECT EDISON THEN STARTED TO TURN TOWARDS THE OFFICERS WITH HIS GUN IN HAND, AND THE OFFICERS SHOT HIM. THE FOLLOWING PASADENA PD AND HPD OFFICERS SHOT AT SUSPECT EDISON. PASADENA PD OFFICER M. COLUNGA PASADENA PD OFFICER L. HOWARD HPD OFFICER J. LOPEA HPD OFFICER K. ARGUELLES-TORRADO SUSPECT EDISON WAS STRUCK BY THE GUNFIRE. SUSPECT EDISON WAS PRONOUNCED DEAD ON SCENE AT 12:43 A.M. BY HFD AMBULANCE PERSONNEL. OFFICER COLUNGA RETRIEVED THE GUN THAT SUSPECT EDISON HAD IN HIS POSSESSION WHEN HE WAS DOWN IN THE LOT. OFFICER COLUNGA TURNED THE GUN OVER TO CRIME SCENE UNIT PERSONNEL. THE GUN THAT SUSPECT EDISON HAD IN HIS POSSESSION WAS A: THERE WERE NO INJURIES TO ANY OF THE OFFICERS INVOLVED DURING THIS INCIDENT.
